text: This place was the Bomb!! The nachos were great fun atmosphere oh yeah and free margarita just for checking in.

Fantastic service here. Our servers name was Mark, amazingly friendly guy. There menu has a little bit for everyone. Me being vegan they had a whole portion of the menu dedicated to Vegans super stoked about that. The food was fantastic, there was a live singer who really lit up the room and the service was timely and enjoyable. Kudos
I know things taste better when you are on vacation but two weeks later I am still thinking about the great food and beer we had here. So wish we had Nacho Daddy at home.

I've been here twice and NOT disappointed! My Husband and I came here for lunch and LOVED our pulled pork nachos (my pick) and cheeseburger nachos (Husband pick). Everything tasted fresh and utterly delicious! SARAH was our server and she was over the top FANTASTIC (thank you again!). We will come back to Nacho Daddy soon and hope that she is there. =)

Enjoyable place to have a casual dinner. We had the filet mignon nachos which were delicious. Two people with average appetites would get full on a single order. If you have a hearty appetite perhaps an appetizer is in order too. The nachos were delicious and they have a great assortment of craft beers and wine. Service was excellent and attentive. Recommended.
Great experience! Started off the meal with a free margarita for checking in. Then had chips and queso and enchiladas, which were great. Will definitely be coming back for our next visit!
This is my favorite spot on Fremont street. Jovanny is our favorite server, making us feel at home. Thanks Jovanny and Nacho Daddy.

4 of us dined here on March 1st. We had a blast! All of the diners (including us) were singing along (loud, proud, and off-key) to the 80's & 90's music videos playing on the big screens. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The food and drinks are worth way more than the price said everyone at the table. I only snacked there while my friends / family ate full meals. The following are items I sampled:

Daddy's Chip Plate - The salsa, guacamole, and queso were perfectly seasoned.

Daddy's Buffalo Wings - May I have these every Sunday?

Tortilla Soup - This is the only dish I was not a fan of. It wasn't bad. I just prefer my torilla soup on the thinner brothy side.

A delicious mango alcoholic beverage - Yum, Yum, and more Yum.
Good food, friendly staff! Cool place to stop by for a bite to eat or a few drinks at the bar while walking the strip!
Great service and but better bartender. Giustina Made me feel welcome and lit the place with some of the best bartending energy I've seen. Def coming back because of her.

Came here two weeks ago and was beyond disappointed. Sat in the main dining room and was immediately greeted and put in a drink order. 15 minutes later no one had been back to our table and I could see our drinks sitting on the bar. Came in on 4/4 and sat at the bar. Our bartender  courtney with het red hair was awesome! Super attentive and made awesome drinks. Completely changed my mind about this location. Definitely would come back if she was at the bar.

Wait was unexpected but its worth it!! Fun atmosphere and clean restroom!!
Helpful happy staff. Thanks Mark and Jess!!!

This is place is chill and bomb. Staff was friendly and the menu is pretty straightforward. We had margaritas and michelada's (like a bloody mary, but with beer for my lil gringos that don't know what that is.) Margarita was great, micheladas were a solid B minus. Ambience was relaxed and all of the food was hot and tasty. See the pics for more. Def coming back!
The fiesta nachos were sooooooooo delicious. I enjoyed my brunch there. The mango margarita and house margaritas are also good. We got the pitcher for both. The service is also good!!!!

Fantastic service by mark. He is really good with kids and gives fantastic recommendations. Nachos are all good and so are the burgers. Don't forget to try a scorpion in your shot if you are brave. If you are downtown try this place. Prices are very reasonable.
Watched Super Bowl last Sunday.  Absolutely great time.  Good fun crowd, excellent service.  Elicia was super, making room for our party of Mark's team.  Will definitely do a repeat next year.

Saw advertisements for this place on the strip, found one near Fremont came for a late lunch and the place was really chill. we both got margaritas which were awesome. we ended up splitting a nacho order and the enchilada combo. we could not finish either of the entrees. Britney was our server she was awesome and considerate, she went over the menu gave us suggestions, neither of which do we regret getting. she was very patient we didn't feel rushed when ordering and she was super attentive. Because of the food/ drinks and superb service this will become one of those restaurants that we return to every time we are I'm Vegas.  I recommend stopping in if nothing else for some delicious house made margaritas and some nachos at the bar =)

They have the best nachos and margaritas! However, we waited 1 hr for our food and our waitress forgot about us and that what we had ordered, even our chips and salsa appetizer. Other than that everyone was nice and it was a fun time.

Food was amazing! We had the breakfast taco, the chicken chimichanga, and the 4 cheese nachos - all delicious!!!! Highly recommend the breakfast taco! Tara was our bartender and she made us some delicious margaritas and was very informative - awesome experience all around!!!

Me and my friend were craving Mexican food when we decided to come here. We sat outside since it's still not too hot out. We were quickly greeted by Sarah. I always like to see what servers recommend, so I put her to the test. I wanted a very refreshing drink, she was spot on about the mango Thai basil margarita. One of my new favs! It went awesome with Sarah's recommendation of the spicy shrimp nachos.

We've done it all here, breakfast, snack, dinner, late night, at the bar, at a table, with our 11 yr and with out him.  We have always enjoyed both the food and the service.  Love the nacho options and how easy it is to customize them.  Breakfast is nice for a group because they have lots of options from plan old eggs, to creative Mexican.  Has a great vibe, nice and casual but welcoming.  Love the open windows.  They have a small patio area in front.  One of our downtown favorites.

We were in Nacho Daddy the other day. We had a great time. Very impressed with Anya's knowledge of tequilas, I'm  not very familiar with different kinds of tequila, Anya suggested her favorite, Don Julio 1942. I never thought I'd  be a tequila drinker!!! Thanks Anya,  next time we are in town  we'll visit.

I have frequented this place many times and have never had a bad meal. I absolutely LOVE , LOVE there Steak Supreme Tacos . First off all they start with a homemade flour tortilla that is lightly grilled to perfection , they proceed to stuff it full with juicy marinated steak , mozzarella cheese , roasted anaheim salsa and then top it off with cilantro , it also comes with refried beans and Mexican rice . This Supreme Taco is very moist and sooooo amazing . It's definitely my favorite menu item . I've also had the Seasoned Ribeye , and OH MY GOD , it was perfectly seasoned and so tender that it melted in my mouth . They are not a steak house so I was surprised as to how delicious the Ribeye was . I'm going to say its one of the best I've ever had here in Las Vegas . 
The local vibe here is great and the service was perfectly on key . My drink is always kept full and the staff is very personable . You must come by and try this place out !!
I really enjoyed my meal here! Enchiladas were great. They have good drink specials too. Service is just so-so. But I've learned in Vegas to never expect good service.

Service: The customer service is excellent. Everyone is very nice. Dalvik was serving our food, while Sara was our waitress. Both were very helpful in my decisions to pick my food. 
Food: margaritas were great. White peach is way better than the house original. 
The appetizer ordered was the extreme tostada nacho. They were great. Real tortilla chips. Ground beef. And cheese. Great cheese. And it comfortably fed four hungover people. (Big plus on that)
I ordered the chorizo breakfast burrito. The chorizo was mild and not what I find in a Mexican supermarket. 
My girlfriend ordered the green enchilada. She loved it. The sauce was the most notable. The refried beans however, should have came from a different can. The rice was good. A little crunchy but the enchiladas made her forget. 
The big day burrito was fucking good, said my friend. He ate it all. 
The big daddy bowl was excellent. 

My opinion, if you were raised in America with parents making Mexican food, you'll love it here; it's great Americanized Mexican food. If you're an immigrant, you might want to stick to the hole in the wall down the street.
Nacho has the best flat iron steak, but it's the people who work here that keeps us coming back for more! Thank you Courtney for being an awesome bartender and keeping on top of the service!

If I could give a zero I would, sitting here still waiting on the check. Their food is terrible and it turns into the Goonies ship as you wait for the check. Go to Taco Bell at least you know  can eat and poop yourself in less time than it takes to get your food here

I swear to god the shrimp tacos will be the best things you ever eat in your entire life. They have prompted me with menus before, to no avail of course. My savory mouth is drenched via saliva due to the fact that I know after the first bite of these, delicious, wonderful, out of this world, outstanding, beautiful little things they call shrimp tacos hit my taste buds, game over. I could eat these things for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and when I happen to wake up at midnight and I'm looking for a snack. Not to mention the astounding amount of knowledge of their liqueurs, can't say I have a negative thing so say about this place. Don't get me wrong, they get huge groups which could make the wait times a little long, we're all human and can accept that. Hands down my favorite place to gorge myself and consume booze downtown. Always 5 stars, service and food alike. Ally was wonderful and very attentive!
Awesome service, shoutout to our server Jess for being so good about fielding our food allergy/cross contamination questions.

Brought a big group of friends (about) to celebrate a special occasion at happy hour. I thought they would be happy that I brought in business, but service was marginal. 
This is the second time I've received poor service, so not planning to go back and neither are my 20 friends. Too bad because this place has a lot of potential to be a fun launch point for a night on Fremont East.
Tasty nachos! Super tasty! We had the burger based nachos and they were great! Also had a chicken taco, also great! Feels like a bar from home immediately.

A great place for some food and brews. I make an effort to get here more than once a week. The food is excellent, the beer list is awesome and the margaritas are the best in town. When you can't choose a drink, count on one of the friendly bartenders to lead you to the right drink. 
Just a great place to watch a game, listen to music, live music or comedy. It's never dull no matter what day of the week you stop in. Oh and by the way, the breakfast line up is up to par. 

Have a blast insisting one of your friends do the real tequila shot with the scorpion. 

I just love this place!
Food, entertainment, service, and drinks!

Me and my girlfriend went tonight she had a hard taco dinner and I had a soft taco meal.the place was jumping we felt very comfortable there the hostice was awesome and our server Alex was great.good margarita and the beer was cold.we will be back

I ordered then vegan chick'n tacos they were really good. I came in a group of 4 so was seated quickly. One person ordered the bbq nachos and about 15 min into us waiting they came out and said they had no bbq sauce.So instead he ordered a chicken burrito that came out 5 min later while nobody else had received food or drinks. I also ordered a mango margarita that tasted like it had no alcohol. I give this 3 stars. 1 for being seated quickly 1 for the food being good and 1 for they fact our waiter attempted to fix our issues.
The tacos freaking rock. Did not have anything else. Three carne asade, three carnitas, and three shrimp. God they were good. Again tacos only. Good stuff!!!!

Customer service not too good. One girl was rude and attitude showed. I wanted to leave but the nachos we ordered we're good. :) things eventually got better. Nice environment. Maybe I'll try again another time.

Went here over memorial day weekend. Had breakfast. At first was concerned they were not open. There were still tables and chairs stacked up and the place looked deserted. Took a minute to find a staff person. We ordered breakfast.The chilaquiles were terrific Our servers were very friendly. My only complaint is that the coffee was weak.

My wife and I saw this on Yelp and took a cab to it ...it's just off Fremont the price was descent we had nachos and wings along with margs nachos were some of the best we have had yumm my wife loves the wings (me too)

Recommended to me by many.  It didn't let me down. The carne asada tacos were fantastic.  The guacamole is great.  Great service.  Small mix up with my to go order but when I called about it they went above and beyond.  I will return when back in Vegas.

The margs are delicious. I had a house salad with the house dressing which was AMAZING. You can't go to nacho daddy's without eating nachos! The carnitas nachos were so so yummy. If only I was brave enough to try the scorpion shot...
Amazing brunch, one of the best coffees I have tried in the US, and awesome staff who would make your experience all the more worthwhile :)'

This place was amazing! Wanted something different than the normal tourist fair. This was a  very refreshing experience. Our waitress Eva was very happy helpful and playful. She made our experience here great. The food was huge! Not what we expected. We came on a taco Tuesday there were 3 of us 2 guys who are big eaters and myself and there was food left over from our supreme tostada nachos and 10 for $10 tacos which were not your typical skimpy tacos Tuesday tacos.  Will be coming here every time we come to Vegas.

We had a good bartender but as soon as the woman replaced him the service was terrible. We had high expectations however, it wasn't pleasant or friendly at all. You would think that since tourists venture this place she would have a better attitude to get a better tip. Nope. And as a friend insisted we go back for breakfast the next day it was the same. Do not suggest going here at all unless you're having all day to sit around and not get any help or a bad attitude.
Had a great time with Courtney the bartender! And the food is Awesome!  Don't miss this place down town.  Can't miss this place!  Love it
Great vegan food. Awesome menu and delicious spicy guacamole. I will be back here when I am in Vegas again. Awesome friendly staff as well. Walking distance from the Plaza hotel.
Happy hour Monday-Saturday 3-6. The Mexican corn is to die for. And specialty margaritas are a MUST have. The spicy cucumber margarita is my favorite!!! Courtney is the BEST!!!!

Came in Tuesday for taco Tuesday since the Henderson location is closed. Sat at the bar. Kimmi was awesome. Very friendly and knowledgable. I think I'll make the drive down here again. Keep up the good work! Thanks Kimmi had a great time.

This place was absolutely terrible! The hostess/lady behind the bar was super rude. There was a small room with about 4 parties of people eating so I was told there would be a 20 minute wait (even though there was a whole section behind the bar that was completely empty). My name was supposedly put on a list. So my family and I walked around the corner to see downtown Vegas for 15 minutes and came back. My name was never put on any list, but they said they would seat us shortly (even though now the whole place was empty). While we were waiting to be seated, I asked if they had any change for the meters outside the restaurant and was told no. Insert side eye here....you are working in a restaurant on a street with meter parking and you don't have a single quarter in this whole place for patrons. Needless to say we just walked out. RUDE. We went to another Nacho Daddy outside of the city and it was fabulous. My advice: DON'T BOTHER GOING TO THIS LOCATION.

Be aware, there is no longer happy hour on Saturdays!!! We used to go there all the time (we live nearby) but likely will not be back. The service is always slow because Nacho Daddy always seems understaffed. Our waiter complained to us one time that he was the only one responsible for the dining area! The food is ok, the margaritas by the glass are good (quality for pitcher margaritas strangely varies), but the service was really only worth it for happy hour. Most disappointing is that the website still advertises happy hour while they don't honor it! We'll go somewhere else.
Hoping this would be amazing, I had the enchilada nachos, someone else had the shrimp street tacos and loved them.

Would definitely recommend! Service was good, prices were very reasonable, the nachos and rice bowl were delicious and the house margaritas were fantastic! Make sure you get one! They are strong and so good. This place is such a nice break from the typical scene on the strip. A community oriented company as well, which was a nice plus for us.
Great service and food.  One nacho plate could feed two. Must try the ceviche its awesome! The house margaritas are on point!
The night manager was incredibly nice and friendly. The nachos were good the drinks were delicious. A good place to visit for a late night snack!
Great place to eat! Nachos where good. Great atmosphere and service. Loved the choice of food on the menu. The Margaritas where slamming. All around good experience.
The food was excellent!!  Shrimp tacos were out of this world! The service was excellent too!  Will go back next time we are in Vegas!

How disappointing all I can do is shake my head... we are huge fans of the Nacho Daddy location in Henderson they do an absolute amazing job and it's one of our favorite places. Therefore we thought going downtown it would be even better we were wrong. Let me preface this review by advising management not need contacting me to make the situation better as addressing my concerns should been done at the restaurant. Unfortunately we had Ryan as a server who tended more to the smaller brunette Hostess then his tables along with our table. We were unattended for so long when it was not even busy that we went to the bar to get a drink. Since we already had a table the bartender with the dreads assumed that I would not tip her because I was not sitting at the bar so I was giving an attitude about ordering a drink from her. Lucky for her I'm a decent human being and I understand that this is a service industry and tips need to be given as I was a bartender for four years. After convincing the bartender she can give me a separate check for the drink I went back to the table and watched Ryan from afar at the hostess stand. In the end I see there is a lack of management at the restaurants as if a manager was on the floor they would notice the lack of activity from their server. Training also needs to be established you should call the Henderson Property and see how they handle their staff then maybe you wouldn't get a review like this.
Mark was a great waiter and we enjoyed our meal. Margaritas were great and would come here again. Sloppy joe nachos were a little too sweet but were good. I had enchiladas and they were tasty.
G was our waitress at the bar. She was awesome. The nachos were great and it's a cool place to hang out!

Awesomness on a tortilla chip! The hubby and I enjoyed it so much that we went back the next morning for breakfast (full menu served all day). The staff was friendly and I personally got a kick out of the retro music vidoes.

The food came out late extremely. I waited for my margarita that never showed up until I just cancelled it. The waiter seemed preoccupied and two waitresses started yelling at each other.The waiter still hasnt come back around to check on us!!! Never again. The shrimp tacos were actually good

This was one of the biggest food let downs I've had in a while. I was really excited about trying their Nachos, expecting something unique that would set them apart from typical Nachos at any other bar/grille. 

They were certainly short handed, because we ordered our drinks and then after what seemed like forever, we had to find our server to make our order.

I ordered the Enchilada Nachos, my wife ordered the Vegan Nachos, my daughter ordered the chicken fingers. 

It was alright. I kept thinking that I could have done far better myself. Maybe I just ordered the wrong item, but my wife absolutely hated her Vegan Nachos. So I tasted one of hers and the cheese tasted horrible. She almost asked them to take it back, but we couldn't find our server for so long that she ended up forcing down half of it by the time he came back around and it didn't seem right.

My daughter's chicken fingers were very good! At least they got that right.

So, if you're looking for nachos that make you say, 'meh', get the Enchilada Nachos. If you are starving and long for cheese that tastes like melted plastic, get the Vegan Nachos.

But if for some reason you find yourself in this average restaurant and you aren't the 'risk-taking' type, ask for the kid's menu and order the chicken strips. They are called 'pull my finger'.

I've been meaning to come in here ever since I heard there's a vegan menu and my only regret is that I didn't come sooner. Food is Amazing! Vegan chick'n fajita bowl and loaded nachos for the win. Our server, Luis, was awesome too, super nice and crazy fast. Definitely come in!

Heather Rae kicks ass, I've probably never had better service,  she was incredibly helpful and if she is ever fired, my friends and I will never be back. The food is also fantastic,  and the scenery is amazing. Get some Iration radio and I'd have to rent a cot in the back.

Had the shrimp tacos and was happy with the food. The condiments with the tacos where good too. Wife had the lobster and crab enchiladas. Those where food too. Would go back again. We should up and we're happy to find out kids eat free in Monday.

If there was a way to leave 10 stars I would. This place is amazing good and super friendly. Everyone is happy to be here super friendly. Food is the best Mexican and street tacos I've ever had. Bartender Bridge is a mixologist who knows her business. Serving staff is very attentive and fun. Food is the best EVER.!!! I would fly here from anywhere in the states to eat here. Best hidden spot in Vegas..!!! Can't say enough good things about this business.

We ate here twice so far. Brandon and Jessie were the best servers.!! Bridge made the best margarita in the world.  I wish I lived here because I'd eat here every day.

This is by far the best mexican grill we have ever been to, authentic and almost like a hole in the wall kinda thing but it is not, we thought they only serve nachos LOL! The place is nice, clean and cozy, full bar, awesome food and awesome service!! Ask for Jovany, really cool dude. All kinds of different nachos, but get the lobster tacos, filet mignon tacos and their queso dip!! Double thumbs up!
The best nacho's in downtown vegas.   The size and the freshness was spot on.   The service was great and the food was out pretty fast.   Will definitely be returning on my next visit.
I had the thai chicken bowl without the beans and had them put the wild rice in the bowl.  It was fantastic.   Great service too.

Very rude staff especially the bartenders. You might be treated you okay based on your appearance but over all the service is subpar. Go here if you like but all it is is some mediocre nachos, loud music and lousy staff.

I have been on the vegas strip and all around fremont for vacation. This place is awesome to snack and drink. That scorpion shot is awesome. This place would kill in texas. Im from san antonio. If you ever want to expand outside nevada. Ill invest. This is a legit place to come to. Your staff was awesome as well. Bartender is quick and friendly. Our server was really cool. This will be my spot every time we come. And we come to vegas a lot!
Awesome food and service. We had margaritas, filet nachos and beef chimichanga. A nice respite from the Fremont Street Experience.

This was my first time to Nacho Daddy and I was pretty excited about it since I've seen them around town and my friend said they had pretty good nachos. We were also in the mood to have some margaritas so we figured perfect! We ordered our fiesta nachos and the nacho burger nachos or something like that, both of which were super yummy. We had a super nice server named Luis who gave us great service and sold us on not getting individual margaritas. He said we'd be better getting the pitchers cause we could get 4-5 margaritas each for less price so we were like done! Took 2 pitches between 5 of us. When he came out pouring the first pitcher it only filled up 4 of them just over half way. He had to use some of the second pitcher to fill ours more but then stopped half way through the second he realized we were clearly being shorted. He left with the still half pitcher and came back with it filled back up. In the end we all only had 1-1.5 drinks each. One of my friends asked for a manger and explained to him the situation and just felt like we were a little shorted and we were really nice about letting him know. Honestly we probably could've gone without even mentioning it and leaving barely satisfied with the situation but we decided let's just let him know. The first thing out of his mouth when we explained to him he said so you only had 1 1/2 drinks each? That's hard to believe. Ok no big deal. We just elaborated and he seriously did not care AT ALL about it. He was like well I sent you out a whole new pitcher and we were like well you took the half filled pitcher back first and just filled it with ice. After the shortest discussion ever he literally said ok well have a good night. I work in a customer service industry as a manager and it's our job to, even if there's not much we can do, to make sure the customer is happy. I'm not exactly sure how he was trained as manager or if customer service is of ANY important to Nacho Daddy but that was my first experience with the company and it's left a sour taste in all of our mouths because of it. The managers name was Rob apparently and I can't express the extent of how he just could not be bothered with us and in no way were we "those" kind of customers. We just wanted to let him know and he gave two shits about it. I don't know if any of us will come back, who knows. But total douche of a manager and that sucks cause other than our experience with him...everything wasn't too bad.
If I'm ever back in Vegas I will make a point of heading to Fremont street just for the Premium Roasted Pork Tacos. Best. Ever.

I went here a couple of weeks ago for lunch. We dined at the down town location. Cute name. Clearly marketing to the tourists as there is a bar that opens to the street. Medium sized dining area. What put me off almost immediately is when I went to the website lunch specials were listed. However, when I went there the waitress new nothing about it and asked the manager, the manager then came over and explained that the lunch specials were only for the Henderson location and not downtown. I will own up that it was my mistake upon review of the website again when you download the menu it states Henderson menu and when you scroll down to the very bottom then there is a cover sheet stating Las Vegas menu that does not list lunch specials. Nonetheless, this left a bad taste in my mouth. 

As to the food, a bit pricey in my opinion for what you get. I will admit that I am a nacho snob - I love nachos and if I am going to splurge they better be darn good. I like traditional nachos piled high with gooey cheese (love the nachos at Big Dog's) and avant-garde nachos such as the asian nachos at Grand Luxe. The nachos sounded good, we ordered the cheeseburger nachos and bbq pulled pork nachos. The queso sauce was smooth and creamy and the pulled pork was sweet although not great bbq but I didn't expect that from here.  Cheeseburger nachos, well, were like a cheeseburger with lettuce, tomatoes, ground beef etc. They were approximately $10 each. They were good but again nothing phenomenal and for the price not a whole lot there. I was full but had I been any hungrier would not have been. And I am pretty sure other people in the group were not full. There were three plates of nachos shared among four people. 

They had one of those new help yourself Coke machines with the different flavors. Overall I have mixed feelings about the Coke machine. You have to get your own drink which I am okay with but if there is anyone standing at the drink machine you may be in for a long wait as they ponder their drink selection.  Anyway, cute idea but I won't be coming back.

So we decided to try this place based on the Stars & pictures posted. But I have to say I was a little disappointed. I ordered a michelada based on the pic in the menu, what I got was a beer with Tabasco & lime in a cup used for water. The rim had an enormous amount of margarita salt. And I have no idea what kind of beer was used since the waitress didn't ask me. The filet minon nachos were ok. Nuthin to write home about. The meat was not as tender as I had hoped. Crab & lobster street tacos were ok, they stuff more corn in it than the crab/lobster. But they were tasty. 
This place was just 'OK' 
I think the pics are amazing but unfortunately the taste isn't.
Dean is the best! He is a respectful and accommodating server! Best bartender goes to Kimmie! This staff is five stars and food is SOOO good!
This place is great. They serve really good coffee (for not being a cafe), and the tortilla soup is delicious!

We came on a Saturday at 6:30pm and there was only a 15 minute wait. Ordered the supreme nachos, chicken tacos and Cadillac margarita. Everything was fantastic! The salsa was very good, which is always a requirement at a Mexican restaurant. They also have a pretty large vegan menu. I will definitely be back!!
The bartender made an excellent Moscow mule, and the nachos were bomb. Would definitely go back.
Scorpion Shots! If you are adventurous and would like to try something new - go to Nacho Daddy's and get yourself a "Scorpion Shot".
Great drinks, delicious food (especially homemade nachos), and excellent service. Jessie and Miles were so friendly and accommodating. Would come back just for the service alone.

This place was pretty cool little spot on freemont street. We had accidentally discovered it after waiting for 15 minutes across the street at Denny's. The service was prompt, sat us right away. We ordered margaritas I got nachos and the hubby got burrito. They had all kinds of nachos! *side note these nachos plates are big enough for two or three ppl. Unless, your pretty tipsy I would recommend one plate to a person. Haha. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a bite to eat and and drink! We will definitely be back again.

Nacho Daddy gets 5 stars for a dedicated vegan menu and fantastic margaritas. For anyone that doesn't eat dairy, their vegan queso is delicious! The price is right and the portions are absolutely massive. You could very easily split an entree and still take home leftovers. Recommend!

Loved the cheese dip, but $50 for a margarita pitcher is a bit much.  It was good, but that's way too much for an off the strip restaurant. 

We also had the sloppy joe nachos. They were tasty. 

The restaurant was packed so we were happy overall.

The service was excellent, apps, and food were to die for. The Daddy Margarita is a Drink you can't go wrong with. As my husband just said, "These are nachos on steroids." Will definitely come again! 
If you are in Old Town it is a "must visit"!
I ended up eating way too much here, but it was super worth it. Hearty vegan menu, despite being the processed chik'n stuff (well cooked and seasoned though). I enjoyed it highly.
Food was so good & service was friendly and great. The pork taco was super delicious. Nice tequila selection as well!!

Want dessert. ...try the apple nachos with ice cream cinnamon and sugar  and Carmel sause. !!! It's so good !!  Served like flour tortilla  nachos...this place is always great a place off the main street.

This place is great!!!  Loved the food and loved our server Luis!!  We were visiting from Phoenix and wanted some good Mexican food.  We just happened upon nacho daddy...and could not be happier with the experience!!!thanks Luis!!!! And thanks to the manager who treated us to t-shirts!!
They have the most delicious Vegan nachos with Vegan Queso and Vegan sour cream. This is a must for a cheat day.

DISAPPOINTED!!! Tried the seasoned ground beef burrito. $1.50 extra for sour cream. Tasted like a 7-Eleven microwave burrito. It was 60% refried beans, 20% rice, 15% beef, 5% sour cream. $12 wasted!!!!  1 star because you can't give ZERO!!!!!

We went to Nacho Vegas last time we were in Vegas and came again to celebrate an early Mother's Day. Kayla was our server and she was great! AWESOME. We took my MIL, aunt, and the round of brothers and we all had a good time here. Good drinks and delicious food. Will definitely come back for more.
Went to Nacho daddy and had some pretty awesome nachos. Deborah was my server and she was by far the best server I've had so far ! I will definitely be back!

Ordered fiesta nachos with no chicken they were so good 

Someone else ordered it with chicken they liked it.  

Other orders:
Steak tacos 
Enchiladas 
Thai machos - they said bomb 

House margarita 

Service the first time I went was not that good a guy helped us. The second time it was so much better we were helped by two ladies (we had a bigger party) 

I would recommend it to family/friends.
Excellent service, Great Food. I had the Ground Beef Quesadilla , the food came out quick, it was hot and the service from Courtney the Bartender was excellent.

I'm giving 5 stars solemnly just because of my server Sarah. Don't get me wrong the food was excusing and the environment and overall look of the restaurant was nice but Sarah made it an outstanding experience, she was helpful, friendly and always had a welcoming genuine smile and went the extra mile to makes sure my visit was great full. I will definitely will be visiting Nacho Daddy over at downtown again.

Jay. He I introduced himself as the manager... We showed up at 1:59 on 9/21/15 and he refused us service. There were several people still at the bar, as well as, ordering food. He informed us the kitchen was closed and refused to serve us. 

I would love to try this place, but due to the horrible management I honestly will NOT return.

Came here to see a friend play music, sat down and waited a while for a menu and  when a waitress finally came over it didn't seem like she wanted to be there. The 6 dollar taco was good but not 6 dollars good and The nachos where nothing to brag about And after 4 beers two tacos and a average portion of nachos my bill was over 60 dollars! I'm pretty sure I just got robbed. I'll go back to see the bands but I'll bring my own food next time.

This was my second time here and I completely love this spot . Ambience is very casual trendy- you can watch any of the sports game on the television which is a good plus . Staff very friendly , always engage on making my experience better each time I'm there . Let's talk about the food . The quality of their meat , fish is top notch . Menu has variety of options . Not your standard Mexican restaurant I would say . My favorite is the street tacos ( Delish) , the naked chicken wings ( not fried or battered ) actually made with a dry rub and grilled , the lobster dishes on the menu are to die for and did I mention they have a nacho caramel apple pie ? So freaking amazing ! They also have a healthy meal option too and vegan ! I would highly recommend this place for food .
Awesome Apple Pie Nachos. It was a wait to get in but it was good experience. Will be back .

I had a friend in Vegas for the week and was excited to bring him here. I had heard mixed reviews, but was willing to try it myself. The place looked dirty and smelled like sewage. I went to the restroom to wash my hands and was greeted by cockroaches. The dirty appearance, awful smell, and roaches were plenty of reason to leave. And we did. It's unfortunate. Won't be back.

I originally wrote a brief review of this restaurant indicating that it was merely average and Yelp removed it from their site because it lacked specific details.  Well, here's the specifics.  The margarita I ordered was not bad nor was it great, i.e., it was merely an average, ordinary margarita.  The grilled fish tacos were bland which constitutes neither bad nor great, i.e., they were average.  Finally, the beans and rice were as average as you would expect from a chain restaurant.  There was nothing distinctly favorable relative to the flavor of the margarita, the fish tacos, the beans, or the rice.  This place isn't bad.  This place isn't great.  IT IS MERELY AVERAGE!

Let me start off with how AMAZING the shrimp nachos are, best part of the meal/experience

The staff? Bartenders, not so friendly, we felt ignore for majority of our experience. They got us drinks & our food order but then..
Nothing.. I work in restaurants, I hate when people have to flag me down.

We started with the amazing spicy shrimp nachos, hands down some of the best nachos I've ever had, piping hot & full of flavor 

Then.. We waited.. 

Ignored by the guy bartender while the girl bartender ate food in plain sight. I understand you have to eat but in front of customers?

We continued to wait.. With empty waters (we were having cocktails too) 

When we received our fajitas, they were cold. I shouldn't be able to touch the cast iron they're served on. I had to be that person to flag the one bartender down, not sure of his name, he had a small curly rat tail hairstyle. I told him they were cold, he looked surprised, they weren't sizzling like fajitas should be, so he took them back. They brought out what I assume we're the same fajitas just reheated somehow. They were ridiculously greasy & lackluster. 

The salsas served with the chips were delicious and spicy..


Highlights- shrimp nachos/chips & salsa

downfalls- bartenders, ignoring us/ cold fajitas 

We are going to try a different location & see if it's better

Great food, good service, and a scorpion shot to boot! 

Food was really great here and the service was really good too. 

The scorpion shot was more to say you did it than anything else. All it is, is a shot of your choice with a dead scorpion in it. 

Yes you can eat the scorpion, or you can take it home. I ate mine, my wife coughed hers up, so she took hers home :p

Came into nacho daddy on a fly today with two of my friends cause we wanted to grub on some Mexican. Sat at the bar. Our bartender was named Zulma. She was really friendly and actually pleasant to talk to. Refreshing for a Fremont bartender. Food was solid we had the enchiladas and queso. Couple of bloody Mary's which were surprisingly good and they had bacon in it which is always great! Their coffees are good just wouldn't recommend the Mexican latte. Overall experience was good. If you want a margarita or a relaxed atmosphere. Check it out.

On the outside it looks like a dingy party bar, but the food here is amazing. We got breakfast here and it was ridiculously good. Also, all day breakfast is a huge plus in my book. The coffee was pricier than some places, but it was amazing and you get your own French press. I want to come back and try their drinks, because they sounded amazing.
I had the Thai chicken nachos and they were seriously phenomenal!!! Soooo much flavor and and little bit of a kick too! Really good!

Super super super slow service. My party waited an Hour and a Half -- Not an exaggeration, we got there at 12:10 PM and did not get most of our orders until 1:40 PM. I say most of our orders as I did not get my order at all! The server/bartender just offered a lot of eye rolling and threw a lot of shade but never gave an apology, no I'm sorry, nothing but attitude. Everyone had separate checks and everyone prepaid and she made bank on the tips. I will never make that mistake again. She didn't deserve a penny! So at 1:40PM as I was getting my refund she rudely told me "I'm also going to cancel that order in the kitchen" like I was fishing for a comp'd meal! So rude, so slow, so bad, so long Nacho Daddy! Your service is in need of retooling and maybe a staff that cares. 
Update: manager contacted me just to get clarification on what happened then abandoned all contact with me. Once again I was let down and nothing was done to make things right. I am no longer surprised that the service was lacking as the manager had no follow through.

So if you are going to use their check in offer of a free margarita, don't make the mistake I did. So I order the "daddy's house margarita" which apparently is NOT their house margarita. They bring you a smaller margarita in a jelly jar for the check in offer. I also made the mistake of showing the waiter at the end of our visit so he offered to bring me the mini margarita but since I already Drank two of the others it was a no thank you! So I bought an entree and two full priced margaritas for $40.

The food was good and our group had a fun time. Chicken taco was too spicy for my son but filet nachos were big and tasty.  Once I pointed out that the menu said "house" they did take some money off of ur our bill which I appreciated! 
Ps they also give a military discount so thank you Daddy!

We came here for my husband 30th birthday and was very please with everything. He took a scorpion shot which was an awesome experience. The food and drinks were good, me and my mother in law had the street tacos, my husband had the famous nachos which were delicious. I wish there was more lighting and not such a long wait until a waiter comes to take your order. We did have a problem with our waiter swiping our card with the chip and causing it to be deactivated. But, other than that we enjoyed ourselves for our first time to Vegas.

We had Luis as our server and he was super awesome, funny and nice. Food was quick, and hot! Awesome place for happy hour just off the Old Strip. $5 happy hour margs, etc. LUIS IS AWESOME! We came back because of him. Had the bartender make my sister a surprise shot for her 30th, 5 stars no doubt ;)

It was my first time here with my friends great spot to have a late dinner nachos were good and the service was great very friendly staff and clean place will be coming back thanks Mark for your great service!!!
Amazing!! Throw a dart at the menu and you won't be disappointed. Ten different kinds of nachos and homemade chips?! Yes please.!

BEST FOOD I HAD MY WHOLE TRIP!!! we went down town to gamble and decided we needed to eat before getting on the bus back to the strip and saw this place out of the corner of our eyes. And I'm glad we did!!! The service was great it was after 2am on Saturday night and everyone was great. We had chicken enchiladas, queso dip with tortillas and a huge burrito and everything was amazing! We will for sure go back next time we are in Vegas and will make sure we tell all our friends to stop by when they are there!!! Thank you!!!
Checked this place out while exploring downtown and hit the jackpot!  Service by Mikey was excellent.  Street tacos were delicious,  and my Thai basil Margarita was perfect. I will be back!

Decent food but any place with two $ signs and paper napkins I just can't get behind.  For that much money I want cloth.  Sorry.   

I did enjoy the mason jars and attentive bartender.  A little on the pricy side for what it is but overall it's a nice atmosphere.  Wish them the best of luck and I appreciate them being in downtown.

Spicy shrimp nachos... Amazing!
Great service! Gustina was our bartender, awesome menu and tequila knowledge! We will be back every time we visit Vegas!

Vegan burrito and bowl are essentials. Love their salsa here. Good place to grab food and a drink with groups, they have something for everyone. I do feel like they could improve on their service. Seems they always forget about me here and it is hard to flag the server down.

Our party of 6 went here Saturday night. For some reason our waitress forgot to put our order in and left the restaurant. After about 20 minutes waiting for our drinks another waiter went to check as our waitress was no where to be found. They were clearly looking for our order and then made our drinks very quickly. Obviously our food also had been forgotten as that took around 45 minutes. Poor poor service, if you recognize you made a mistake don't try and hide it, acknowledge it by offering a free drink or take a meal charge off the bill. Hiding it and hoping we don't mind you forgetting our order isn't acceptable!
My son and I ate here and enjoyed it! Good food,good service and nice atmosphere. I can't wait for my next trip to Vegas so I can go there again
Nothing fancy here, but good food right off Fremont Street.  Huge nachos, friendly staff combined with decent prices (for Las Vegas) gets a thumbs up from me.

Honestly, I just stopped here at like 130am with a buddy because we were hungry and this was one of the only places still serving food. The bartender was friendly, and the portions of nachos are huge. Those were good, but do not order the wings. The sauce is served on the side, and the wings are pretty charred, making them taste somewhat burned on the outside. My buddy got fajitas which came with a second plate of all the fixings, and all that was good too. For late night I would recommend. For earlier in the day/evening I would probably keep looking.... unless you REALLY like nachos.
Great place in the downtown side of Vegas. Had the filet minon tacos and they were awesome. They also have scorpion shots which I did not try but looked like a fun time if you're brave enough.

Checked out Nacho Daddy while vacationing in LV. I guess I should've tried the tacos, because the nachos were a big disappointment. I had the BBQ Chicken Nachos, and it was basically little chunks of chicken meat, and chips with about a half a bottle of bbq sauce. The bbq sauce taste was overwhelming. The other nacho plate we ordered had that cheap tasting nacho cheese on it, and it wasn't that great either. Next time I'm in town I may try the tacos, but the nachos missed the spot.

Perfect! I've been here twice now, and I'm sad that it hasn't been more. I'm too busy running my own restaurant, but I'm glad when I come here. 
First, I was greeted promptly and with a smile. Next, I was welcomed by the manager with fresh chips and roasted salsa. The margaritas were strong and tasty! The Mahi Mahi tacos were filled with fish and slaw and I barely got to the to rice and beans. ( which were fresh and hot) 
Check and exit greeting were on point and I could not have left more satisfied and pleased. Congrats Nacho Daddy! Well done!

The food was great, the service was to amazing, drinks even better. So I suppose you're wondering why I'm giving 2 stars? The poor staff is stretched so damn thin there it's disgusting. My friend and I went many times when we were there because of their vegan menu. It was tough a couple of times service wise. But one time our waitress (who was such a sweetheart! I don't remember her name but she was a lovely, thin yoga teaching girl) was trying so hard to make sure we got our food and drink in a timely matter. The bartender was too busy not paying attention to the orders, and then they ran out of margarita stuff! We were there for punk rock bowling, and I guess the manager (who you could tell was there wearing some hideous lilac colored shirt, really dude?), was too busy sitting on his phone to notice his staff was running around trying to do the work of 5 people per person. 

Long story short, food is awesome, drinks... awesome. The waitstaff, fantastic. But man, I hope they're more prepared next year so I don't have to wait 30 minutes for my food and or margarita.

I was very disappointed with there service. The two hostess was rude to us. We ordered to go and the restaurant was very slow and about five cooks in the kitchen @11pm. I ordered a burrito and my husband ordered six wings and fries. I got my burrito but my husband had to wait 20 mins for his food. While my food got cold. He asked for his money back and they didn't want to give his money and he didn't want his order anymore. One hostess act like he didn't know my husband ordered everything but when my husband started getting upset then he got his food.
Killer Supreme Tostada Nachos! And the margaritas were delicious. Place was packed so we sat at the bar and received great service. We'll definitely be back next trip.

This place is absolutely yummy! We had the queso, nachos, enchiladas, and tacos. Everything was full of flavor and was a reasonable price. Our waiter was very friendly and made our dining experience enjoyable. Definitely would recommend this place, and we will be back next time we are in Las Vegas.

I would give zero stars if I could.  Eric was our server and it was the worst service I've ever had in my life.  He took 30 minutes to get us chips and salsa.  He gave 2 people in our party the wrong order.  One of which took 30 extra minutes to get the right order, so by the time she got her food we were all finished.  He never came around to fill waters or get second drink orders which we all wanted.  He added people's bills together.  It was so bad I didn't leave a tip at all which I've never done because I was a server for many years and know how difficult the job can be.the food was jus ok not nearly good enough to make up for it.  We tried to make a complaint to the manager but she was too busy eating at the bar.

Since it was my birthday, I went in for the breakfast nachos which were unbelieveable!  Tender chicken fried steak strips with fluffy scrambled eggs and country gravy.  The wait staff, I believe it was Ally and Courtney, were so friendly and on top of making sure I was happy.  They gave me a sample breakfast taco with avacado, I'll order that next time.  I highly recommend as the food was excellent, the service was fantastic and the place has a real beach resort feel to it that reminds me of Hawaii or San Diego.  My new 2nd home.
geo is the best, fun times great service!!!!!! food is so good we whet back all weekend
Great place.  Smaller and staff has a full plate and multiple roles. Menu is awesome and drinks plentiful. Most items are shareable.  I would return.

Tried it for some good nacho varieties, and was not disappointed. The meat and cheese toppings were plentiful and of good quality. Didn't like the buffalo sauce on chips that one of our party ordered, but the others were good.

When your boyfriend can't quell his addictions while in Vegas and you're over it... Vegans run don't walk!  Enjoyed the nachos and a gigantic marg.  Great service and recommendations from my bartender.

Had a wonderful experience tonight at Nacho Daddy!  I showed up for Happy Hour and enjoyed a mini nacho plate along with a large platter of fish tacos with a house margarita.  The service was excellent at the bar as well.

Me and my family went in earlier to have dinner and I have never felt so comfortable in a restaurant like today, the server who took care of our table I believe the name was Jose kept coming back making sure we were OK and the manager Debbie was very friendly came up to our table asking us how we were and how was out food I got the enchiladas, those were the best enchiladas I have ever ate we will differently be returning and telling all our friends about nacho daddy... Thank you for such great service...

April D

I grew up in the area, so it is often challenging to get stoked on something when visiting home. But these nachos and loaded fries were pretty dern good. Mark, our waiter, was also a helpful and classy young man. Kept my Glass wicked full of OJ.
Immediate service. Fantastic queso. very friendly and also quite attractive server.  Great price. Highly recommended!

3.5 stars for the food (good, not GREAT) but we had good drinks and good service so I rounded up. The location is just around the corner from Freemont Street craziness so I liked getting out of there for awhile, too. This location is much smaller than the one by Planet Hollywood (in case you wanted to roll in with a big group).

Service is too slow!!! It seems that the manager it's the only one working. 
Food and drinks are good.

The food was super incredible! i got the vegan nachos that were super good & had super large portions! the food runner Lou ee was so so good & was such a great staff member! He was very accommodating and helped our friends out when they came late.... came for the food but stayed for the service!! i cannot emphasize how fantastic he was and I will be back again!!
This is my first time here I've only been here for few years and never experienced a place like this good service and friendly staff .

I recently visited the newly opened Nacho Daddy Downtown. I sampled the Ceviche first: Love their house made white corn nacho chips which complement the lime, lemon, orange marinated shrimp, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, serrano chilies and avocado perfectly! Next I had the Street Tacos, three house made tacos each filled with asada steak, chicken and babacoa pulled pork, flavored with cilentro, onion and cumin. The pulled pork taco was the winner of the three, topped off with a tomatillo salsa and cotija cheese, Yummy! My friend ordered the Daddys Big Burrito with asada steak and all the trimmings, it was big enough for two people, but he rose to the challenge and devoured it all! Nacho Daddy has a great selection of domestic and imported beers, great cocktails and very special shot aptly called the Scorpion Shot, with a real scorpion in the glass, I had to have it, being a Scorpion myself! All in all a good meal in cool, relaxing surroundings. Great staff, especially Nichole, Christian and Will, who were all very accommodating and knowledgeable. Looking forward to checking out the breakfast menu and vegan section also!

Our party of six went to the location downtown near Freemont. The food was really really good! My hubby & I had the Soppy Jose nachos and hot wings. Mmmm mmm good! The margaritas were also on point! It was also clean. However, the service left a lot to be desired. We went for a late lunch, & there weren't very many people in there at all, but the service was slow, & they also forgot a few items we ordered. If service wasn't so bad I would've given 5 stars.

We liked it here!  Hubby ordered the fajita salad with steak.  Said it was delish.  My friend and I split the Supreme Tostada Nachos which were yummy.  Casual place, good food.  Would definitely recommend to friends.  Yum.

We had the BBQ pork nachos. Yummy! They pride themselves by saying "never a dry chip!" That was our experience. We would definitely come back. They also are community service minded and help with children's hunger. Glad to hear it!

This is a very welcome, un-Vegasy place to get a quick, relatively cheap tasty meal and drinks! I love nachos and think nacho-focused restaurants should really start taking off, especially if they have a play-on-words name because I also love that. So many kinds of nachos but my husband wanted to stay away from anything too spicy so we hot the Nacho Average Burger nachos and they were great! The meat was well seasoned, the queso was good, and then of course there was also bacon. I got the spicy blood orange margarita and it was just too spicy for me, I was dying, but I couldn't stop drinking it, because it was delicious! My husband's house margarita was also excellent.

Fantastic margaritas. Great service; Courtney is the bomb. Apparently I have to write more.  I like going to Vegas. They have tequila on tap, that's just amazing. They're just around the corner from Fremont street and well worth it..

I'm sitting here with my cousin for my birthday while he has a quick drink. The section were sitting in is completely empty. One of the waiters, probably fresh out of community college, came over to my cousin and myself and told us we couldn't sit here because we didnt have food. The section is EMPTY. The restaurant has plenty of open spots. We aren't doing anything or being disruptive. We planned on coming back here with more people in an hour to eat. The way she spoke to us was very rude and disrespectful. We won't be back here because of it. Thank you for putting a damper on my birthday Diana.
Food was fantastic.  The vegan menu is surprisingly decent in size and options. Recommend anything with the vegan chickn. Service from our  waiter Luis was also great.

Fantastic! I had the pulled pork nachos and the meat was so tender and had just the right amount of bbq sauce. The queso was fantastic as well! But the highlight of the night was the fried ice cream! Do not skip this dessert! I will be back!
I absolutely love this place. Their unique ingredients in the different nacho dishes are tasty but my favorite here are the burritos

The Scorpion Shots w/1800 are the best...mix it with some Roberto's later on and you'll have a sick hangover the next day...if your a constant "throw-upper" eating Robertos almost 1 hour later will get rid of that lol! This is the best place to drink, the staff are friendly as hell, the food was soooo bomb. I will definitely be back next weekend

Nacho Daddy has a fun atmosphere with great food. There were 5 in our party, everyone ordered something different and it was all sooo good. Our server Jovanny was amazing!!  Super friendly and attentive!! Would recommend this place to everyone.

I was iffy about this place. The reviews were either hit or miss. I came here a few weeks ago. You have the option of sitting at the bar or at one of the tables of your choice (inside and outsude).

 It was lunch time when I stopped in and the noise level was medium to low. The server was friendly and very attentive. I had the ceviche which needed just a tad bit more citrus, it was served with freshly made chips. 

I also had the street tacos and y'all must try the fish tacos! They are Devine! I also tried the Banana bread beer. I enjoyed myself and you will too!
their all you can drink in 2 hours bloody mary bar on saturday and sunday is best deal in town and their filet burrito is the best

First time eating here! Showed up at a busy time at night! Got seated quickly and food out at a good time! I'd recommend the shrimp nachos, or my wife ordered the plain bean and cheese nachos! Both were very excellent!
The vegan nachoes were so, so, so good. The service was a little gruff, but not rude.
Absolutely the worst service. 3 bartenders and couldn't be bothered to make eye contact or barely take an order.

There's this new way of doing small business in Vegas, and Nacho Daddy is the prime example. The management just gets it. Quality food & drink, fair prices and friendly staff - everyone says it, but very few nail it. Even a great kids menu! I'd recommend it to anyone. Oh - and try the buffalo wing nachos.
Nacho daddy is literally my favorite place to eat. Their tacos are the best. They have everything. And the margaritas are very delish! And big.

First time stopping by here, good chill environment perfect place for a sit down, drinks food and away from all the craziness from downtown for a bit. Our server Kayla was nice and provided excellent service! Would definitely recommend this place to anybody and everybody! Definitely coming back, thank you! ;)

Whatta trip! Excellent food and even better margaritas! The nachos are to die for, and after eating them, you just might! : )  Way too much for one person to consume but possible with two with some work. The margaritas are delicious although I can say they are a bit on the sweet side. But nonetheless very good 'medicine' for whatever might ail you. : )  Friendly people, welcoming environment, hey what more could you ask for. OH one thing this place is not exactly cheap but worth the 30 bucks or so that your check is likely to be. And thank goodness it is not too loud either, you can actually have a conversation without straining with your _______ .

My friend and fellow Yelper, Raquel, found this delicious restaurant! Our server, Mark M., was wonderful and took awesome care of our party of seven. The menu has great variety, moderate prices, and tasty food! I'd definitely return for more Nacho Daddy. PS: utilize their complimentary house margarita when you check-in on Yelp! :D
Hands down best nachos I've ever had!!! The service was great!! The atmosphere was relaxed. Everything about this place was great

Have been to the bar for drinks. Never the best service but ok cocktails. Decided to try food because of good reviews. Ordered queso dip and Mexican lasagna to go. Nothing was wrong with the order but did not love the food at all. Queso was like a white processed cheese with not a lot of flavor & I took 1 bite of the lasagna and hated it. My husband ate it said it wasn't the best.. So many better options out there to choose from. Won't be back

Great selection of Mexican beer on draught, also an impressive selection of tequilas, the street tacos were so tasty I keep going back for more, also the bartenders super friendly and personable.  All and all a great place to hang out and have some great eats!
Best margaritas in Vegas.  Amazing food too.  It's not just nachos.  Authentic mexican cuisone.

Second time here and doesn't disappoint. Friendly staff great food. Fresh chips and salsa
)
AMAZING CHIPS AND GUAC!!!!!! And the customer service was on par!!!!!!! Love this little place off the Main Street in down town it was seriously amazing I would definitely recommend to a friend!!

This is one of those times that I wish there were more stars to add.  Elicia M, you are an expert in your field and one of several reasons why I'm really looking forward to returning.   Been to this location three times now and every single time was amazing.  Food and service were always top notch and I cannot say enough about how attentive and pleasant Elicia is.   What an incredible experience!

A restaurant that serves all kinds of different style nacho plates! How amazing is that? Nachos are very delicious prepared with didn't different cheeses and meats. The green enchilada plate was so delicious that i wish i could of had another plate. House brewed beer is refreshing. And if you go and feel a little adventurous you have to get the scorpion shot!

Been here twice now.  Both times the service and food are excellent.  Ariel and Justina were awesome.  Can't bring myself to do the scorpion shot but it's available if you like.  The happy hour menu is really good.  I prefer the daddy margarita and the spicy cucumber margarita.  The chicken mini nachos or the chipotle sliders are dang good.  I've been to the summerlin location once, but we prefer the atmosphere and freemont street location.  Bathrooms are clean.  Overall a great place with great service.  Even the managers are great and take an active role in the guests. 

Parking isn't the best but I uber anyway cause the margaritas are so good and I want several.

We arrived around 2:05 on a Sunday afternoon. We waited in the front next to the sign for someone to help us. After 10 minutes, we were finally approached. We were told they are not accepting customers to be seated until 2:25pm because the "kitchen was backed up" and was trying to catch up on orders, however when we asked if we could sit at the bar, it was ok...Didn't really make sense but nonetheless, we found some seats available at the bar. I was already somewhat annoyed by waiting around but was so hungry at this point, I just wanted to order some food. There was only one bartender on staff at the time, and after another 7 minutes of waiting, the bartender apologized and said she'll be right with us. Nice gesture, however it would have been nice to have some menus to take advantage of the time we were waiting.

Finally, we got some menus, ordered some drinks (they have a free margarita with yelp check in) and ordered grilled wings and nachos for appetizers. The margarita was on the sweet side. Some of the wings were extra charred. I must admit, they do have several nacho options that all sounded great! We got the crab and lobster nachos. Flavors were there, but wish there was more to each bite. That being said, we would order this again. We ordered the baja seafood combo (fish taco and the lobster and crab enchilada with beans and rice), and the signature Taco-enchilada combo. Both of these dishes were extremely filling. Tortilla for the taco's were delicious and the enchilada was really good too. Prices weren't too bad either considering you're eating in downtown Vegas right next to Fremont St. At this point, we were stuffed and couldn't order dessert. Overall, the food wasn't too bad however our experience dropped this rating to a 3.

Fantastic vegetarian/vegan menu with plenty of options for carnivores and omnivores. Bridge at the bar is adorable,  fun,  chatty and an excellent bartendress. I LOVE the cajun tofu tacos! Nacho Daddy's does breakfast too!

Food was ok. Drinks ok. Service ok. As a breakfast joint, there are much better. 

Came in on a Sunday morning for breakfast. One of their signature drinks is french press coffee. Hot water was broke, so no coffee. You'd think they would boil some on the stove next to the refried beans. Not that much culinary creativity in Vegas. 

Had a bloody Mary that was fine. Checked into Yelp and got a coupon for a free house margarita. There's a reason it's free. Lemonade would have been better. 

Smoked wings were tasty, but rubbery. They need to fry them after they are smoked to crisp them up. Breakfast slider, tacos and enchilada rancheros were good. 

Glad I came, might try the nachos if I come back.

Solid place with plenty of vegetarian options. They make their own chips and salsa. Margaritas were huge and very nice. I had an awesome plate of vegan nachos which were fresh and plentiful. I also enjoyed the guacamole with my chops and it was tremendously magnificent. Our dishes were wonderful and we plan on revisiting. It's reasonably priced in an ideal location and recommend it.

Awesome supreme tostada nachos and enchilada combo, and I'm sure everything else is just as good. Great atmosphere around late lunch time, and definitely worth coming to for the food. Brittney was wonderful with suggestions and very attentive. If you're not feeling super hungry it's worth it just stopping in for Daddy's Margaritas and amazing house chips and salsa. Five stars.

A friend had warned me this place was bad, but I was excited to it because I love Mexican food and try to support locally owned businesses, and really- how can you mess up nachos? Well, they did. Bland, tasteless, and wtf is that cheese syrup? It reminded me of velveeta but not as good! At the end of the meal, I was hit by a case if burning indigestion so bad, I had to sprint to the nearby Walgreens. The only reason I didn't give it one star is because my guava margarita was pretty good.
Really expensive. Staff not restaurant trained. like a take out style Super low key

It smelled like puke inside, so we asked to move outside.  We got our food and drinks pretty quickly, but then all of the staff (hostess and wait staff) disappeared for 20+ minutes.  By the time we saw someone who worked there to ask for the check (not our waiter), we had finished our food, drinks, and waters several minutes prior.  The nachos were good for bar food.  The michelada was pretty whack.  We may try another location, but we aren't in any hurry to.

Nice atmosphere; very nice waiter and good food. Mikey our waiter was awesome and made our visit even more enjoyable; very friendly, gracious and professional. We'll definitely be back again. Only reason I did. It give it a 5 start is that the portions are a bit small for the price. Similar places give you more for less money. Still recommend it for good food and atmosphere just off the noise of Fremont street...
If you love nachos this place is awesome! Better in late afternoon. Get a better ambience. So much to choose from. Hard not to get two or three different ones..
10/10 would recommend this place to anyone in Vegas! The food is great, drinks are great, and the service is even better! Love it!

Great place, great food, cool staff!! Ask for Jason, he rocks!! He's there Tuesday's and Thursday's. If he's not there, ask for his brother Kevin. Either way it will be a great dining experience!! Angie the manager is awesome too!! And if you need a good laugh, Kalli can tell you a good story :)

Street tacos are really delicious! Loved their chips and trio dip that included hot salsa, queso and guacamole, all of which tasted very fresh. We ended up there at happy hour and had margaritas for $3! Great deal and the blood orange flavor was great.

Went here last night with the kids. Cannot fault the food. Highly impressive Mexican on offer. Friendly staff, kids menu is also tops.! Had a great time and also tried the scorpion shot! Smooooth as. Would recommend this place and definitely go back.

We went here on a Friday night in late January. What a wonderful highlight to our Vegas weekend.  We were there for Happy Hour...great service, amazing food and perfect cheap prices!  The waitress even let us preordered our next drinks before Happy Hour expired...and delivered when we were ready for another.
Good place to eat. The sea food is amazing! Our waiter Jovanny was very attentive & provided good service. Go to him !

Awesome spot !! Cool vibe , easy service with smile and the food was delicious !! 
I had a business lunch and we walked over to Nacho in the blistering heat , but it was worth it! I ordered the fajita salad and it was just the right size and price ! The chicken was plenty and the tortilla bowl was fresh , which is huge .  Slot of places use stale "bowls" too often and it ruins the taste of the salad .  I was impressed all around and our waitress Ally was great! I would definitely go back to the DTLV location that we patronized today!!
Our first time here, Ariel was wonderful we really enjoyed our time! Thank you SO MUCH! I will definitely come back and enjoy my birthday once again and many more here !

Street fish tacos are to die for. So flavorful!

Great top shelf liquor choices. I loved my Patron Silver shots!

I also loved how dark it was inside.

Overall a nice, bustling social vibe. Friendly and energetic staff. Highly recommend.

This is definitely one of my favorite places to eat! Love the vibe when you walk in with good music, everyone having a good time, and the games on every tv! I got the Cali burrito and it was amazing! Also definitely get yourself one of their famous margaritas! You won't be disappointed.
Convenient but not what I imagine when I think of good Mexican food. Great service and no wait times just super average food

My husband and I stopped in on Thursday night at around 7:30p. We were staying at the D so my dad recommended this place to us. 

It was a short walk from the D. When we got there, there wasn't too many people inside. We wanted to watch the TVs so we decided to eat at the bar. The bartender was very nice (I don't remember her name) and the bar was very clean. My husband ordered a beer and I had a Daddy's Michelada which was really good. I also ordered some mojo pork street tacos and my husband ordered the wings. He said the wings were good and my tacos were good but not great. I've had way better tacos in California so my standards are pretty high. Maybe I should have ordered Nachos since that is what they are known for. Overall it was a good experience and I would go again. If my tacos were amazing I would have given it 5 stars.

I have been to this location a couple of times and usually the service and the food are all A+...however, today it was a little different..we arrived at the restaurant a little after 9:30pm on a Monday night...it took about 5 mns to get seated...no problem...we finally get our table and within 5 minutes, our drinks and food have been ordered....again, no problem...

After about 20 minutes, the food arrives....still no problem...the food was good, reasonably priced and well seasoned...BUT once our food was delivered, no one came to check on us, offer refills, or anything at all...until the check came...and then we had to wait another 20 mns for them to pick up the bill...they weren't even busy..I would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the lackluster customer service...maybe next time will be better
Worst service ever! Food took a long time to come out. Waitress was very slow and rude. First and last visit here.

Of all the places we ate at during our trip to Vegas, we encountered the nicest waitstaff here. We came super late around midnight and they were semi crowded but the waiters were attentive and sat us right away. They were also super friendly and helpful with the menu. Just an overall a good vibe and great dine-in experience. Thanks guys!

Chill atmosphere, great service, delicious nachos. We stopped by thinking this was the shark tank location, but that one is actually located at the strip. The Fiesta Nachos, which come with shredded chicken, are huge. More than enough for two people to share. We also did the Yelp Check-In deal and got a free house margarita. My boyfriend normally hates margaritas, but he loved this one. Our server, Kayla was awesome too. Super friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back.

Came here on the night of St Patricks Day after going around Fremont for a while. When we had arrived around 12ish 1am, the hostess told us it was about a 45 minute wait for a table but seeing there was room at the bar, we sat at the bar immediately. As with most places in downtown, the establishment is kind of old and dirty and it being a bar, it was kinda dark too.

The bartender tended to us almost immediately after we sat down, giving us food menu and asked us for drinks. We had ordered some margaritas as well as use the check in offer for a free house margarita. We ordered 2 items of food to share as well. 

Supreme Tostada Nacho - seasoned ground beef, cheese blend, yellow queso, refried beans, pico de gallo, fried jalapenos, lettuce, avocado lime salsita, sour cream & guacamole on top of house made corn chips - despite the price of the nachos, it is probably one of the better if not best nachos ive had. Granted i don't normally get nachos but with the few places i have, this is much better. Lots of toppings. Ground beef seasoned well. If anything, there was more toppings than chips. After the first initial chips, we started having to fish for chips. By the end, we asked for some forks to help eat. Lol 

Grilled Mexican Corn on the Cob - basted in seasoning, cojita cheese, cilantro, garlic mayo and fresh lime - small pieces of corn. Maybe 1/3 the size of a normal corn. 2 per order. Expected more. Flavor wise was pretty decent. Would have been nice to have more cheese. 

I personally ordered the Blood Orange Margarita whereas a friend ordered the White Peach version and another had the free House Margarita with yelp check in. Apparently mine was the strongest? but since i drank mine first, the other ones didn't taste much different. LOL except sweet :3 I'm a fan of blood orange drinks, be it alcohol or non-alcoholic (San Pellegrino). 

Service was pretty good. Got immediate attention as soon as we sat down. Got waters. Got drinks. Food came pretty fast. Pretty attentive staff. Not bad besides the location.
After you get past the weird location and order a drink and some amazing nachos you will remember why you came to this little gem.

Excellent food and the best service in Downtown! Loved my margarita and the chips and guacamole was fantastic as well. I had the rib eye nachos fantastic. My wife had the lobster and crab nachos. Sister in law had the beer battered lobster tacos. We will be making Nacho Daddy's a regular stop!
Good food and good service. Justina and Debbie we the stars of the night. The street tacos were great, the filet mignon nachos were awesome,  and some of the best fish tacos I have ever had.

Catchy name for a place, so I had it on my list to try during this visit. Plus I like Mexican food in all forms, so hanging out here should be easy. 

Turned out to be a good place to grab a solo lunch. I came in around 12:00 pm on a Monday and was just about the only customer in the place (save for the woman on her laptop at the bar, I really was it). Surprising, so I was instantly concerned the food must be bad. Or you'd need to be liquored up with a bunch of tequila to be happy here, which wasn't on the menu for me. Fortunately, the food did not disappoint but more on that in a moment. 

Let's talk 'bout yo daddy...

Nacho Daddy is larger inside than it appears from outside. There is a spacious wraparound bar and a separate dining area with plenty of seating. There is also outdoor seating with umbrellas, although they had to take them down while I was there due to excessive winds. 

Server Nicole was down to earth and cordial. She was training a new guy and he seemed to be catching on quick. The manager came over to say hello to me, his sole customer. : ) Nice touch. 

Oh and the food. I had the chicken taco and can honestly say, it was one of the best taco's I've ever had. They mix some kind of pesto sauce into the taco that complements it very well.  I commented upon this just before leaving and they weren't sure what it was, but were glad I liked it. Well now, I'm glad too. 

The manager's cool. The staff nice. The food excellent. The environment very comfortable. I'm not sure why it was empty both before I arrived and after I left. Maybe it's just a quiet Monday. I'll bet the place lights up at night. 

Definitely worth a visit if you're downtown. Lots of options on the menu. And if you like tequila, this is your place.
A must do when in Vegas.  Excellent food and super service.  Had the Filet Mignon Nacho's and great to the last bite.
Came in for breakfast. Had the breakfast taco which was unique and delicious (queso + scrambled eggs and bacon = a winner). Great food and fantastic service.
I'm a fan of the henderson location. It's the first time I've had the food here. The huevos ranchero is definitely bettern than the nacho daddy bowl. It was pretty good after a night of libations.
Service was excellent and food was amazing!! So glad we chose to try this place out for a late night meal!!

The addition of Nacho Daddy downtown will offer another great place to watch sports and enjoy great food 24x7.

They could have the best coffee menu options downtown as well.

Great vegan and veggie choices.
Been here many times. The our last view was a real treat!
