I had been craving a chimi for years and the sweet server said he would go back and ask if they could do a vegan one....of course they could! I ordered a bean and cheeze and avocado chimi :D I wish I took a pic of it it was soooo yummy and gooey and ridiculous :D I asked for black beans with mango salsa on top as my side. 

Anyway, this place will make you just about anything you want. I even requested the kale salad be put into a wrap before and yep they did it.

Service is slow sometimes but always pleasant. The owner is a sweetheart, glad he left what he was doing to open his Nacho Daddy's ;) 

We had a Yelp event at the one at Henderson and after that we tried Hendo location again after that....ummmm we are not a fan. 

We have had some yummy veggie fajitas here also (don't know if they are a menu item). You can't beat their nachos. I wish they had a cauliflower buffalo vegan nacho like I have made at home then I would truly be in heaven. My fav item is still the kale salad. It's that dressing, that grilled corn, delicious. 


That spicy tofu burrito is out of this world but wow it's freaking spicy I don't know how my bro in law nor my hubby eats that. They always inhale theirs.

I'm not a fan of adult drinks and hubby is allergic to tequila (in an oopma loompa turning orange type of way) so not really sure about their margs etc but my friend said her special tooty fruity marg was super yum and super strong. 

Nacho Daddy IS the Nacho Daddy.
I've been meaning to try this place for a long time. Was out late and decided on the enchilada nachos with green sauce.it was surprisingly good. More than enough for r
Great place. Nice chill atmosphere and the service was great! Food was wonderful with fresh bottomless chips and salsa for just 2.95.

Catchy name reeled my friends and I into this restaurant.  Just happened to be in Downtown on a sardine packed can of people kind of night. Decided to give this place a try. It's hidden a little bit off of the Downtown Vegas path. Dark on the outside a little hard to tell where to enter. We found it and were greeted and quickly seated. It was busy, so the servers were running around trying to keep everyone happy. 

Got our drinks ordered, and asked our server for recommendations.  He told us to get one of Nacho choices and the 2 most expensive were their most popular ;). 

Thanks to checking in with Yelp I got a free margarita, although in retrospect, I think it was virgin, because it just tasted like mix, no scent or taste of liquor. 

The food arrived in the expected amount of time. I got the Enchilada (chicken) Nachos. The portion was big, more than enough for two people. All of my buddies also got big servings and soon we would all be full, and feel like adjusting our belts to a more forgiving notch. 

The service was good. Like most places in Vegas the restaurant itself had dark floors that were a little sticky. The food was good and plentiful. Considering bang for the buck and without a 30 minute wait on Presidents' Day weekend we were satisfied.  If the buffet you wanted just can't be had or just looking for a quick meal, this is a good spot to fill the void.
Great place to start or finish the night! I visited day after day and enjoyed every day. From soup to just sides to entrees! Great food and wonderful service

Came here on my trip to Vegas from Miami, went off the strip specifically to check out this awesome little spot and it lived up to every expectation!

Not only was the food delish, but the staff was also top notch, our bartendress Anya is the best in the business- sexy, cool, attentive, and knowledgeable. 
The drinks were fantastic, she hand crafted the most delicious mango margarita, that I'm flying back to Vegas for more.

Oh and did I mention I did a scorpion shot?!!;)~

A really nice way to start to drink, we order the wings and the filet mignon nachos... they're really good, the churro sundae was good but it was just 2 little pieces and they tasted a little old, I was hopping for something better for the dessert
Great atmosphere, lots of variety on the menu. This place is also great for vegans and vegetarians. Service was on point. Got a free margarita with the yelp check in!

Came in for a drink on Easter Sunday. We sat and the bar and did not order food as we just finished brunch. The drinks were strong! I have had the nachos at the other location in Henderson and was not impressed. I did like this location vibe a lot more. There is a cute outdoor seating area as well.
The food is good here but they don't pay attention to certain details.  The queso is to die for though!

Absolutely awesome place to eat and drink at the food was great the environment was fun ....Ingrid the bar tender was amazing and made the best drinks we came in for lunch and wind up staying for dinner . The margaritas were amazing and very very well made. Monday night football on every tv in the house did not want to leave !  A LAS VEGAS MUST!

I was impressed!  I didn't think a restaurant just off Fremont could be so good.  I had the Thai chicken nachos and they were a bit spicy but I like spicy.  If you don't, you probably shouldn't order them.  The cucumber and jalapeño margarita was excellent and not at all spicy.  Other friends with me liked their food a lot as well.  They are large portion sizes.  The Fiesta chicken nachos are crazy big.  Waitress was great and made spot on recommendations.  It was a wonderful cap to a nice partial day spent hiking.

My wife had the shrimp Nachos and I had the pulled pork. Large portions and both were very good. We both had a margarita they were decent about what I expected. The bartenders were very helpful and knowledgeable. We definitely will stop by here again when we are in town.

Yummm!!! Was craving chips & salsa and came into this fun little spot. Super chill atmosphere and delicious chips & salsa.... Ordered a big daddy burrito with pulled pork and red sauce. So good!! Will definitely come back!

Yo nacho daddy is the best place ever!! I love their strawberry margaritas and their green enchillda nachos!! Y'all so go try them out I give them thumbs uppp!! Also their house margarita are bomb I always order them frozen so much better and refreshing for the summer this year!! Their customer service is very excelente their all so friend and nice!!
The tacos were wonderful.  Great spicy salsa.   A nice find a little off the beaten path .

Ordered the traditional nachos and they were awesome. Just the right size for 2 to share. Loved that they had the pop machine to dispense the multi flavors

Will definately be back next time in Vegas
Love this place, great for solo dining or as a group. Definitely hit Taco Tuesday, and sit at the bar. Bartender Courtney is just the best, always upbeat and helpful.

Nacho lover!!! Do stop here!!!! I'm a big fan of nachos and I was so happy to see a page dedicated to nachos! I visited this location twice while in Vegas. The margaritas were delicious. I wish this company had locations in California. Service was good. I would go back just for the nachos. Tried the enchilada and supreme nachos.
if you wanna pig out and don't mind the calories and carbs, Yes this place is really good and better with some beers!
Great service, great food, fun experience!! We had shrimp tacos and 4 cheese nachos were fantastic!! Pitcher of margaritas were good as well

Tried to call in this place for delivery to my hotel room, asked to pay for it over the phone and was placed on hold for about 10 mins until another person answered not knowing what was going on, so I was placed on hold again for another 10 mins. The last person answered again, I said I wanted to talk to the manager, places on hold again for another few minutes. The manager answered, I spoke with her about how ridiculous it is to have to wait that long to try to pay for my food over the phone...the order vanished, however she knew it was supposed to be a bbq chicken nacho and a chicken fiesta nacho. She was basically having to retake the order, "the computers are down" I was told. I ended up just canceling the order because the amount of time it took for me to be on the phone, I could have walked down to Fremont street and eaten something by the time the order and delivery would have even happened. The only reason why I'm giving it a 2-star rating is because the manager offered me a gift card if I should decide to order with them again.  I can't even base my review of their food, it is purely all based off of customer service. ALL I WANTED TO DO WAS TO PAY FOR IT OVER THE PHONE...WHO SERIOUSLY DELIVERS WITHOUT ASKING FOR UPFRONT PAYMENT OR ASKING IF IT'S CASH???? Oh wait, they do.

Service was something to be desired. Sat for about 20 minutes before even seeing a waitress. Food was good. Had the filet nachos. Once food was served it took another 5 minutes to get silverware. Which was fine for us nacho eaters. But some others couldn't start. Drinks are good too

Not as great as the Strip location, but food is average. Love the check in offer they have for free house margaritas!

They also offer the scorpion shot for the daring. My friend and I both tried it, but the scorpion is a lot smaller than expected.
I really enjoyed the food & vibe at nacho daddy's. Food was good Loren ,Angie & staff are top notch!

If you use Yelp! Nacho Daddy has a free house margarita! Their food is great and the homemade guacamole is amazing. It's a smaller venue then the other location but you are downtown Vegas. Aerrick was our waiter and was really on the ball and friendly. If you at a chance, ask for him.
So good!!! Loved the burger nachos and fiesta nachos best! Enchilada nachos are really spicy! Great service! A fun place for munchies while you're partying on Fremont

It takes a lot for me to complain at any restaurant and it takes even more for me to not leave a tip! Being in the restaurant business for over 10 years I value customer service... That being said thank the food gods for the the amazing Filet nachos they were simply amazing from the presentation to the very last bite I was thoroughly impressed and mad at my stomach for being full... Skip the wings tho lacked anything that would make wings good! My biggest complaint was my waitress, blond never got her name and barely had her attention the entire time! Don't ask her for anything she gives you this smile with I don't really don't wanna be here or talking to you look... I ordered a traditional margarita took a few drinks hated it but hey I ordered it I'll finish it, but as I continued to drink it I noticed that I had the dirtiest glass Ive ever drank out of... Showed my husband he said it has to be stained I took my finger and wiped the glass it was filthy it was disgusting! Did the manger care?!? Oh no she didn't... Said would you like another I said no and she never apologized she did agree it was dirty but the way she acted it was like normal... I'll never go back to that location... Not a good way to send off guest! Customer service wouldn't have gotten any stars but the nachos were bomb!!
Came in for a nacho but decided to get the Buffalo Hot Wings and that decision was great most of all was was the free margarita

We visited Nacho Daddy for lunch today and it was super tasty! Was it the best nachos I've ever had? No. were they tasty? Yes! Ultimately the price was right and it was good, but nothing to write home about.

Very busy and hip atmosphere. Fun but a bit cramped. Located in downtown it's surrounded by lots of fun things to do. 
The food was good enough, but the 4 cheese nachos were a waste of money, over half the nachos had no cheese on them. The traditional huevos rabcheros were a let down too, flavor was mediocre. 
We didn't get napkins or forks until about a minute before the main dishes came out. So appetizers were messy LoL! 
The tortilla soup was excellent and service and house drinks were good. The grilled hot wings were phenomenal.
We do intend to go back and give it another try.  There were other dishes that people seemed to love. We want to try the filet mignon nachos and it was good enough. Closer to 3.5 stars for this visit. Will update after the next trip.

This is our third time time here in two days. The food is awesome. The best breakfast and nachos I have ever had. The best part is the staff Jovanny is the best....fun, personable and so good at what he does.  We will be back every time we are in Vegas. Thanks Jovanny  for taking great care of us.

Dang!!!! Stopped in after all the crazy of Fremont for something fun to snack on. Ordered the Spicy Shrimp Nachos and wow really delish. 
Some bites definitely had some serious "heat" and though we've never had spinach tortilla chips they were yummy. 
Mark, our server, was super friendly and attentive. 
Will be back for the scorpion shooters!

Greeted promptly after sitting down at the bar. Tara our bartender helped us through a menu of unlimited options, and walking us about the all fresh ingredients and freshly made margaritas. We settled on Thai chicken nachos and strret tacos to share. I can't adequately describe how fresh and wonderful everything tasted. You really want to stop by here. It's amazing.

Great place to eat on the strip! They have tons of vegetarian and vegan options! We ate here twice and both the times the food was great! We tried the triple dip appetizer, chimichangas, fajitas and tacos. Everything was great except the chimichangas that were a bit dry. Definitely give it a try if you're on the strip, they even have multiple locations.

Brittany took care of my kids and I.  There nachos are delicious.  I had the crab enchiladas.  They were yummy.  Next time I have to put límon on them.  Raza knows what I'm talking about!  We tried the churro sundae.  Ejole!  Luis made a mix of hot and medium salsa.  Freaking dynamite!  I will come back again!
Nothing special, food was OK, service was good, don't see myself going back honestly.

Mark has been SO good to us. We are here for a bachelorette dinner and he was so upbeat and loves us even though we are sort of a drunk mess. He treated us so well and is having a TON of fun being our server! We love Mark! Also, the food and margaritas are top notch. Come to this location!

Decided to check this place out because we thought the name was funny.  Ambiance was fine for a bar/restaurant.  The menu has great options for vegetarians and everything is coked to order. I ordered the spicy vegetarian burrito. The chef took extra care to prepare tofu perfectly! Food was really tasty and unique. Fresh guacamole was really good!

Best part was our server. I didn't catch his name but he was great! Super helpful and attentive. Suggested items for each guest (8 of us). We all loved our dishes! I'd go back just because of how he presented the menu items and the chefs attn to detail!

Great place!
G
Food is incredible and so are the margaritas. Thank you Jon and Mikey for an awesome experience.

After strolling around Fremont on a rainy day, we were ready to dry off and get a bite to eat. At the suggestion of our friend and local Las Vegas guide, we headed over to Nacho Daddy. I honestly think that had she not suggested it, I never would have noticed it. Not only is it off a side street near Fremont but it's also not flashy like many Vegas restaurants and we almost walked by it.

The inside is simple but what the restaurant lacks in decor, it seems to make up in quality of food. Everyone was pleased with their dishes, from quesadillas to burritos to nachos.

While I was tempted to order the nachos, I knew that I could never finish a plate of nachos on my own. It's too bad that they don't offer half orders of the nachos. Instead, I chose the chicken quesadilla. It was one of the best quesadillas that I've ever had. It was filled with gooey cheese and juicy shredded chicken and served with a side of sour cream, guacamole and pice de gallo. Had I not been on vacation, I would have been content to eat half and take the rest to go but instead I forced myself to finish the quesadilla and was pleasantly stuffed for quite awhile. 

Two of my friends shared the Fiesta Nacho and managed to clear the plate between the two of them. These nacho plates are definitely something to share with a friend though, unless you're a super heavy eater. Another friend ordered the vegan burrito and I was impressed that a Mexican restaurant offered several vegan options. 

Compared to places on the Strip, prices at Nacho Daddy are very reasonable. My quesadilla cost about $12 with tax and tip, which isn't much different than what I pay in San Diego. The nacho plates ranged from $7.50 for cheese nachos to $16ish for nachos with meat and lots of toppings.

Burger nachos and buffalo nachos!! Yum! Mango Thai basil margarita is my favorite and everyone should go there and try one! The pork burritos are delicious! The also have a vegan menu for all the vegans out there with some really yummy healthy selections! Breakfast is so yummy too! I'd recommend if you are cousin downtown Las Vegas to check out nacho daddy! The owners are amazing people as well will make sure your experience is 100%!!!
I've only been to this location twice and kimmi has been there both times and she's always great! Very fun environment and the food is good too! Will definitely be back to see her!
Awesome nachos!!! Will make this a regular stop when in Vegas.  Quick service and great cheesey nachos.

It's a bit on the pricy side but it's definitely good. I appreciate that there's a decent selection for vegetarians too. I had the Thai Chicken bowl and I definitely recommend it. It's labeled as "Spicy Hot" but the label is probably meant as a warning for those who don't eat spicy at all. The spiciness came from some jalapeños so it wasn't actually hot at all.

I came for cinco de mayo no happy hour what so ever and then a waitress drops a salsa on the ground and it gets all over my hair dress and legs and on the entire side of my arm and they legit didn't comp any of my food but a damn michelada that was only 8 bucks they are so pathetic I just can't believe what horrible service I encountered and they tell me a manager will be at my table which no manager ever arrived never coming here again

This was my second visit a few months apart.  Was ignored when I walked in, Bartender just looked at me.  I should have left.  Waited another 5 minutes to be seated, took a long time for the waitress to come back...only a few tables were occupied.  Ordered nacho's they were cold and not very good.  I will not return.  Mid week slow night = crappy service and bad food.

Good- not great.  Good place to keep the buzz going. 
Cheese nachos were the best.  The scorpion shots-meh
Certainly better then most other Fremont options.
Filet mignon nachos were awesome. Not spicy.  I had to order a side of fresh jalapeños. One order was enough for two people to share.

The owner of this location should be embarrassed.  As a frequent customer of the Eastern location until it closed, it was night and day.  

Walking in on a Saturday evening we figured it would be busy.   There were seats open at the bar so we snagged them up.   I wish we didn't.  The service around the bar was absolutely horrid.  First off it took them ten minutes to acknowledge our existence to take our drink order. Since we already knew what we wanted to share, we put in our order right away before she left.  That was the last we saw of our original waitress.  45 minutes later our food comes out.  It was delivered by another waiter and he asked if we needed anything else.  I politely asked for hot sauce as well as our plates and napkins.   Did we see him again?  No.  Was our waitress in sight? No.  So we are sitting there with our drinks empty for the last 25 minutes without regular place settings to eat.  My friend actually went back to the kitchen to see if we could get any assistance. He got their attention.

As we started to eat our so called Nachos, it was abundantly clear they were inedible.  The flavor was way off.  The entire bottom of the plate was water.  I would like to refer to these plate of nachos as nacho soup.  As if those weren't bad enough, the fajita sandwich tasted as if it was made the day before and sitting under heat lamps.  Was I in the twilight zone?  I just want to also mention we did not see our waitress during this entire time.  

Eventually we were able to flag down another person to pay our bill.  We wanted to get out of there and never look back.  Just a disappointing experience.

Food is good but the service sucks! Definitely need to teach the staff to be more attentive to the customers. The hostess are not at all worried about getting people in and seating them. Had to ask a couple times to get a table.

Amazing nachos! Had the filet mignon nachos and my fiancé had the vegan nachos. Both were to die for! Full of toppings and every chip was covered. Service was also great and definitely would come back next time I'm in Las Vegas.
I like this place they give good amount of portion on food. Not your authentic Mexican place but food is still pretty good. I would good back again.
Way too much cheese in the burritos. Cheese also not melted.  Tortillas borderline stale.    They also have hamburgers on the menu...which was the first red flag.  Do yourself a favor and stay away.

We stumbled on this restaurant while walking The Fremont Experience. We didn't feel like casino food so decided to try it out. This is obviously a locals kind of place. Nothing fancy just delicious well prepared Mexican fare.
As a side note...I ate in Guy Fieri's at the Rio the night before...I thought that the food at Nacho Daddy was better tasting and definitely lower priced.

I love their food the first time i order but....the second time they never delivered my food i waited more then 2 hours before i canceled through grubhub they just keep pushing my delivery time over and over till it said the food would get here till 5am so im pissed off they could of called and said the couldn't do my order or something instead of making me wait for nothing
If you are a nacho person at all, this place is worth trying! Different styles of nachos with crispy chips and delicious toppings. I'm a sucker for elote so I also had to try that!

The only reason they are getting two stars instead of none is their amazing staff. The food was horrific. How in the world do they manage to screw up nachos.... It's in the name!! The enchiladas were atrocious too. I always take my leftovers home because I hate wasting. But this is the very first place I didn't want anything to do with a to go box. None of my friends were impressed either except for the drunk ones.... Which I mean, just plain toast tastes good then. And even that would have tasted fresher than the food we received that was extremely over priced. Never again. Maybe at a different location it will taste different.

Came here by recommendation of my husband's friend. Walked right in and was greeted immediately. We waited by the bar for about 10 minutes for our table. Once seated,  our waiter came. He was awesome! Helped us choose out the perfect nachos. 
Food came and it was amazingly DELICIOUS! We both ate our entire entrees. The service was great and so was the food. I'll definitely be returning for more!!!!!!
Aerric was our waiter. Cool guy, great food, highly recommend. Been to Vegas a few times and make it a point to come here. Also get a free margarita for a yelp check in
This bar is one of the best ones around! More bang for your buck...food, service and drinks. I will have to come back...most definitely!
G-love was amazing!! She was so sweet and took great care of us, not to mention a great tequila selection at good prices for downtown Las Vegas coming from a local!

The apps...ceviche and Mexican corn was delicious. We enjoyed the crab & lobster nachos. It was enough for 2 to split. There was plenty of crab & lobster on it. The service was good too. Especially, enjoyed the 80's music playing. The only negative is the fly we kept having to shoo off

I live just a couple of blocks down from nacho daddy so I have eaten here multiple times. Last night my friend and I decided to go here for dinner. It was his first time trying it so we were looking forward to this. Luis was out server and he did an outstanding job. He was able to describe the menu items in a way that made our mouths water. 
Food and especially derived were excellent and I am excited to say that I will be going back.
Lobster tacos are amazing.  Great service and friendly atmosphere.  A must when downtown.

As far as late night bites after drinking your way through Fremont st goes,  Nacho Daddy is killer.  The portions are huge,  the menu is simple to understand,  and the atmosphere is welcoming.  

With a location a few steps away from the Downtown Grand,  you can stumble your way here with ease,  and then catch your Uber home.  

They have a lot of non - traditional Nacho options,  a little something for everyone.  My friends and i tried:

Golden knight Nachos- more of a traditional loaded nacho

Buffalo chicken nacho - fun and novelty kind of nacho

Pulled pork bbq nacho - interesting but delicious flavor combo.  

I would definitely be back when my cravings get out of control

Here tonight with sis and fam visiting from U.K. Had Fiesta and Supreme Nachos. Food and service were excellent! Convenient location and fast serving. Next time in LV, will come here again for all things nacho....

Wow. Just wow.  The lack of service. Attention to detail and general lack of quality are just stunning. Bad service. Poor food. And just general malaise rule this place. 
Del Taco or Taco Bell have this place best hands down.

Tried this place at life is beautiful and since I'm vegetarian I got the vegetarian nachos and they were the worst I've ever had! All the ingredients were dry I had to eat the chips separate and the dried ingredients would keep falling off the chips. I mean at least melt the cheese or get some real salsa. And for $10! What a ripoff.
Enchilada nachos were bawm, A+, just Prefer their red sauce over the green. Our server was awesome too thanks guys!

This place was hopping but we were seated quickly and waited on. The person who dropped off our menus was a bit rude, but I am not too miffed about it as they were super busy.
The chips and salsa were not free, which was a bit surprising to me, as that is what I am used to, but they were only about 3-4 bucks, so I wasn't too upset. Also, the hot salad was HOT. (I know newsflash, but it was like super hot.)  We also had a free yelp coupon for a margarita. I didn't have one, but my friend did. She had the strawberry, and said it was way to sweet. She didn't finish it. The beer selection was OK. I would have liked more local beers.
Our food came out quickly, and it was good. The beans and rice were not too salty, and they had a nice flavor. My tamale was delicious. I had it with the red sauce..wow, was it good. The enchilada I had with the green sauce, and I was not a fan. It was bland, and I didn't even eat half of it. If we were in the area again, I would give it another go.

The service was scarce a few waiters called out but, the ones that served us were nice. We ordered the chicken tortilla soup two thumbs up! Fiesta Nachos that fed three people worth the wait. My husband had the Mexican burger and loved it!!!

Would recommend this place! They have great margaritas & even better nachos. Best place to get a tower of nachos! They also offer scorpion shots which is an experience in itself. Great food, drinks & environment!

Very cute place! I'm in town for my 21st birthday and needed a good place close to Fremont street, and found myself at Nacho Daddy! Love the enthusiastic atmosphere, the look of the place, and the food and drinks were great!
Food was lovely but what made it the best was our tireless and energetic server Aerrick, he was like a nacho angel. Ask for him and he will set you up

AWESOME nachos and all other tex-mex food. Good service and friendly staff!! Had the texmex burrito and it was delicious!! I highly recommend this restaurant!!
Ric and the gang were terrific an he also has some AWESOME tattoos!! Check it out while visiting Vegas!!

I love hanging out downtown the casinos and the nightlife are the best in Vegas when I'm downtown and want something to eat I come here! It's off freemont and doesn't look like much but you have to try this place the food is amazing!
Pork nachos had very damn little pork. This little piggy was disappointed.
The carne asada nachos were great. The "daddy" margarita was really damn good. Would've given 4 stars if the service was faster. Gotta buzz going and in need of some food, this place will do the job.

I encourage you to sit at the bar ! Look for Tara at the bar she so funny,! & extremely helpful w suggestions on both food & drinks. Chips & guac we're a must! YUM ! I had the chicken philly & it was very tasty (too hungry to take a pic, sorry!) :D they also have great happy hour specials. 5 stars for fresh food and amazing customer service !

Great place for food and drinks. Guac could use some help. Didnt taste fresh and was bland. Love the vegan menu. Love the tofu nachos. Salsa was on point. Friendly staff too. Theres a coupon inside for a free margarita.
Overall a great experience, a must for veggies and vegans.
Good food, the enchiladas were small taking into account their price. Near of one of the best Vegas's street

Food - Just okay. Bland. 

Drinks - We ordered 2 margaritas, both were terrible! They tasted like we were drinking sugary syrup. 

Price - Overpriced for what you get.

Overall - Disappointed.

Place is mediocre at best. Got a chicken burrito for $11.95, it was super small. Didn't get served with rice and beans...I got chips instead. Lame!!! Only reason I'm giving two stars is because server was nice and they had dogfish 90 on tap. Won't be returning. I'd be way better off at robertos.

I came here because the nachos looked yummy on the pics but when we received our order the nachos came in a smaller portion than it looks on the pics. The nachos were ok nothing great. I also didn't like how they only had ground beef not real steak. The price was $17 for basic nachos. The food wasn't horrible but definitely not worth the price. If you are in Vegas everything is over priced so it was ok wished they had better meat selection
Great service great food would definitely come back here anytime. Food is incredible I hope to be back before I go to so cal
Great customer service...  Bridget is awesome, funny, if you can dish it out... Be ready to take it...
The food was brought out very fast, drinks were refilled promptly, and we even got two free margaritas by checking in! I thoroughly enjoyed the food. A+
I only come here for the vegan food. Worth it every time. The vegan chick'n nachos are too bomb. Don't forget to order a margarita, they're huge and delicious!

Nacho Daddy is definitely known for their amazing nachos but when visiting Vegas, we ALWAYS make a stop here...me for the vegetarian crispy street tacos (deep fried avocado tacos). My dad loves the fish tacos...check out this fish taco! We have tried a variety of things on the menu including the vegan nachos....every time We come, we are all happy with our meal. They have it all...breakfast, lunch and dinner and anything you try, is good! Makes this vegetarian happy! They have meals for vegans and of course, lots for the carnivores! And I cannot forget the bar...it has a good variety of spirits. Service is always good. We usually go on a Friday or Saturday by 6:00 pm to beat the crowd! Nacho Daddy is a must try when you are in Las Vegas!
Dean was our server and he was the man. Been here a couple times and they've always been great. Good food & good service.
Opens early for the early morning drinkers! $3 bottomless chips n salsa... great food! Great price! Great atmosphere!!!

Best Margarita !! I loved the service and  how clean it was.....the staff was very attentive. Food was delicious, I'm not a fan of chimichangas but it was good. And it didn't come apart when I cut it in half...the portions are just right and full of meat. They also have wide variety of Tequilas.

I would give 0 stars if I could. After planning our vacation for months we were most excited to visit Nacho Daddy, as we had seen it on the Food Network. Everything started out fine, but after ordering our margaritas and food we waited. This wouldn't be a problem but we were 1 of 2 tables in the restaurant. I happened to look over at the bar and saw the bar tender standing there. Then I saw our drinks sitting there. Our waiter passed our drinks at least 4 times that I saw and never brought them to our table. We also ordered 3 street tacos as an appetizer, I;m not sure how long those were sitting there, but it was a huge let down. Obviously, we left and felt bad about not paying for our water glasses. As we were walking out, the waiter had the nerve to say, "thanks for coming in". Thank's for not serving us. Upon complaining we were offered to come back, but we are on vacation and have everything planned out. You lost that chance when you treated us like dirt. It sucks that we have planned on eating at this place for months and we were treated so bad. Save your money and go somewhere that wants you there.

I'm addicted to this place! The Daddy's Supreme Chicken Tacos are to die for, every mouthful makes me say mmmmm.
 One thing I didn't expect at a place called Nacho Daddy, was the best wings in town!! I LOVE them, they're huge and meaty, with lots of extremely tasty sauce on them. Seriously, try them!
 Another favorite of mine is the chips and salsa. So very fresh, obviously made to order. Plus, they're bottomless! Can't beat that!!
 Literally every thing I've had here is amazing. The only thing that gets iffy is the service. Last time I waited about fifteen minutes before I even got to order a drink, and they weren't that busy. But, I'll deal with it to get the amazing food!

aight.  service was attentive but a bit slow, and the food was...aight.  the margarita was my accompaniment as i awaited my food. I was fond of the Mexican corn, which while it won't satisfy a  elote or esquite craving, it suffices for that moment. the flavors in my nacho order were just fine. the chips were a bit thin to handle the weightiness of the acoutrement. my chips kept breaking under the pressure of ground beef and veggies.
Great food. Vegan menu fajita tofu salad is one of the best salads I've ever had.  They play some cool music videos, just hate when the hip hop crap comes on.

Good, fun place to hang out.  Good bar drinks, and their street tacos were very good, any variety, we had them all.  A bit disappointed with their nachos though.  Some of the chips were soggy when first delivered to table, and not enouth spice to make them stand out, but otherwise tasty.  Good service and very friendly staff.
Amazing food! We got the pork tacos and the Nacho Daddy Average Nachos. Both have great flavors and huge servings. Our service was amazing, the bathrooms are clean and well kept.

Great chips! We got the trio of queso, salsa and guacamole. It was delicious! I could've just eaten that. Probably the best queso I've ever had. They make it fresh daily. So good!! The free house margarita you get with yelp check-in was not good, but hey, it was free! I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

Excellent. The nachos were perfect!!!!! They delivered to our hotel. (The D Hotel) we ordered and it was dropped off to us within 30min! It was still hot and the price was very reasonable for a delivery. They did have a  delivery $20 min.  But worth it! I hadn't had nachos that good in a while. 
Washed it down with a sprite.  Thank you all for the fast late night service! I can't want to come again.

We stopped by here for the nachos night one- got a enchilada nacho plate which we shared and then my friend got a super yummy mule and I got the beer flight. We were both so satisfied and full (but not gross feeling full upon leaving) we even came back the next morning for breakfast burritos and the churro pancake! 

The atmosphere is so cute and the wait staff is really sweet.
Great nachos! Margaritas are yummy! We loved the churro sundae, ended up ordering a second round of churros. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Thank you Perla and Jose.

We love Nacho Daddy! They have a great variety, even for those of you who aren't in the mood for Nachos (amazing fajitas!) We've gone here for birthdays, as well as recently for St. Patrick's Day. It was packed, but the service was on it! They were constantly bringing us drinks, clearing our plates and staying attentive. Even though it was a full house, it was only a 20 minute wait. 

Also, Nacho Daddy is vegan friendly! I was a little nervous showing up with my best friend, who's vegan, and another who's dairy free since it can be hard to figure out where we can all be accommodated. I had no idea there's a whole Vegan section. She ordered the vegan chicken fajitas and loved them. 

I, on the other hand, am a meateater and always order the Filet Mingnon nachos to share with a friend. The portions are huge so sharing is caring.
Great scorpion shots, a completely new drink that is a must . Yes a tequila or your favorite liquor shot with a real scorpion inside .. must try it .!

I came here with friends for my bachelorette party. The food was so good that we came back twice in one weekend. The nachos are amazing. I tried both the fiesta nachos and the supreme tostada nachos (my fave). Also, the micheladas and margaritas are delicious. Good food, good service. Also, they had a really good selection of vegan food which was surprising. Don't hesitate to try this place. You'll love it. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Friendly service, happy hour has great deals for food. And I'm always a fan of places with lots of vegetarian options. Must try the Cajun tofu tacos! Street corn was also delicious

Horrible service, didn't get our table waited on 10 minutes after being sat. Once we got our food, don't get me wrong it looked delicious but I was given the wrong plate and instead of letting me keep the plate same charge they were going to charge me more to keep it. So I changed it. During our meal, my friend ended finding a long blonde hair in his food. We immediately stopped eating. And his food was taken off but the manager didn't even offer us a discount despite what we saw and she even saw that we were disgusted with our food. Never going back again.

Amazing food and drinks! We got the chimichanga and fajita bowl, both were amazing. The portion sizes were great, not too big, and our waiter was extremely accommodating about our dietary restrictions. You must order the endless chips and salsa, it's under three dollars and worth every penny. I've given this place a 4/5 because service was very slow. A must to eat in if you're in downtown Las Vegas!
Awesome chips and salsa and queso! Received a free house margarita, too, for checking in with Yelp (and they don't chince you on the tequila). Big, high-def TVs for your sports viewing pleasure.
Perfect nachos and great service! Variety of nacho options that are unique and delislcious.

What's better than just Nachos?? Nacho Daddy!

This place has such a colorful menu. Sloppy joe nachos, tostada nachos, burger nachos, filet mignon and so on. My choice for dinner was Enchilada Nachos.

This dish was made up of refried beans w tender and juicy chicken breast, jalapeños, sour cream,salsa(red or green) and crispy tortilla chips. Let me tell you, the green salsa had a spicy bold flavor that just seeped into every bite of this dish and made it ohhh sooo good! The serving size could easily feed 2 people but did l share???...Hell No! I cleaned that plate with ease. 

A friend had the ground beef enchilada dinner with rice and beans and she had no complaints. Street tacos along with chips, salsa and hot queso were amongst other dishes at our table and all were equally delicious.

Liquor was good. Try the scorpion shot or the buttery nipple. You won't be dissapointed. 

* l was so excited and perhaps a little liquored up, l forgot on both visits to take a picture of the nachos! Lol

Will l return, absolutely..l returned the very next day!
First time I came and food is absolutely amazing! Vegan menu is perfect  Jovanni is a great waiter 5 service

Nachos were ok. When they say no chip untouched they mean it. Chips are so overloaded they get soggy really quick and I hate a soggy chip. They messed up my husbands order and he decided not to eat so the bar tender was nice enough not to charge him for his beer or the food.

The setting: 9:30pm, Monday, Christmas Day, 2018. 

Fam: We're hungry! 

Me: Ooh, it's going to be hard to find a non-casino restaurant open at this hour on Christmas...

Fam: That doesn't change the fact that we're hungry.

Me: Well, I found this place nearby that's dedicated to nachos. Y'all want some nachos?

Fam:  :-0   Uh, fuck YEAH!

Boom. Nachos for Christmas dinner. Not just any nachos, but damn good nachos. Nachos supreme, cheeseburger nachos, thai nachos, and vegan "chicken" nachos? Double-fuck-yeah!  

This spot is owned by a few former Zappos employees, and while it borders on cheesy (in the figurative sense), the (literal) cheesy goodness overcomes all of that business. The nachos here are seriously tasty. Each portion is sized for one very hungry man or two moderately hungry people not my size. Eminently shareable, these platters are a crowd pleaser. Easy to order a few different styles and throw down on a table full of goodness. 

They have numerous non-nacho options, like burritos and enchiladas and such, but why bother? Come here for the nachos. Or the surprisingly robust vegan menu. Usually vegan items are an after-thought, but any vegan would be very happy with the selection here. 

They have a check in offer for a free house marg with purchase of an entree, which is cool, but the main specialty marg is where it's at. They also have corny "scorpion shots" and merch so you can boast about eating a scorpion. But we didn't go there. 

5-star nachos, excellent service, fun atmosphere... if the whole thing weren't so cheese-ball this place would get a full 5-stars from me. I mean, it's a half-block off the Fremont Experience so they're obviously playing to that crowd. So good on them for that.

First time at nacho daddy and I very good the food and the service is great Jess was very helpful. I recommend the spot especially if your looking for something late nite. Thank you Jess for the great service.
Yum.  Stopped for a quick brunch and was not disappointed.  Whoever said breakfast margaritas were bad?

Omg!  The only person that makes nachos better is my mom (once when I as 13 at a pool party and I was starving). Loved every bit of this place...  Cherry pommagranite margarita is the bomb, Ric is the bomb and the shrimp tacos were fab!

This place was pretty good. It's worth going for lunch or a quick dinner. It's a casual, fun place with tons of different nacho options. I got tacos and my girlfriend got nachos which were both good. The margaritas were way too sweet though, I wouldn't recommend those unless you love really sugary drinks.

First off very GREAT service from Mark ask for him
when you go ! Second very awesome nachos I tried the enchilada nachos with chicken and red sauce it was super delicious ! They have a cool deal also with the purchase of a entree you get a FREE HOUSE MARGARITA  and it wasn't just a whack margarita it was still very strong even though it was free. We stay a The D hotel so if your staying there or golden nugget it very short 5 min walk this place is very good and kid friendly also !

We saw the billboard on the highway for the Henderson location, but it took us 2 months to stop. I wish we had stopped sooner. What a great lunch meal. Prices are reasonable (except $2.95 for a pop). Good service, and lots to eat.

Looking at the exterior, I did not have high hopes for this place, but I had some of the best nachos of my life here. Everything was so good we actually ate here twice while on vacation. Would highly recommend the Thai nachos as well as the chicken fajita. Skinny Margarita was the worst thing we had, but we hardly cared because the food was so good. Cucumber mojito was great though.

I was a little afraid that this place was going to be a tourist trap with mediocre food, given it's location.  It was of course a tourist trap but it was also super super tasty.  I had the huevos rancheros (breakfast all day!!) it was so good I ate way beyond full.  They serve it with gauc and salsa, both were great, but totally unnecessary-the huevos were perfect as is. Oh, Oh, Oh! They made my eggs perfectly over medium.  I don't know if you've ever ordered over medium eggs before but it's quite the gamble.  Kudos to the cooks!
My partner in crime ordered the Nachos and walked out with a food baby as well.  He had some super tasty raspberry margarita which totally trumped my guava daiquiri.  

On a side note:
Our server was pretty much MIA during the meal but this was obviously due to the fact that she was in the weeds.  I think she may have been the only one on.  The food would definitely bring me back but not having anyone check on us until we were almost done eating would keep me away.  Hopefully it was a fluke and not standard practice!

Second time I've been here with friends and we had to sit at the bar because there was no where else to sit. The food is good, the service is good....but this is the second time at the bar that we've ordered something that we never got but we were charged for it on our bill!

We had tacos and beer for brunch, the service was excellent and super helpful. I'm not very good at picking beers but the waitress knew her stuff and got me a very tasty one. 
Food came out from the kitchen in a reasonable amount of time and the food was filling and tasty.
We love this place!! It's a go to every time we visit Fremont Street! Best. Nachos. Ever.

The best Nachos I have had in my life.  The tacos and tequila specials are great.  

Dinner consisted of:
Fiesta nachos
3 steak tacos

One of our favorite places to eat Tex/Mex.
We always come back for the margaritas. Some of the best in Vegas. 
Atmosphere is always busy, but we've always had a good experience.
Special thank you to Alexa for always being a super friendly hostess.

This place was pretty good. Actually the best part about it was the staff. They are VERY enthusiastic about what's going on, and very attentive to what you need. 

I had the nachos and a taco. Let's start with the nachos:

The only reason I cant give this place 5 stars is because there are a LOT of bare chips on the pile of nachos they bring you. In fact, when I received it I was quite surprised to discover how many NOT covered chips there were. They could have done away with about two thirds of the chips, but they basically use the chips as a way to present you with a pile high plate, even though the good stuff is not as plentiful as it could have been. Still delicious. Just not as "Oh my God" as I was lead to believe.

Now for the taco:
I had the barbacoa taco - Now this deserves the "OH MY GOD!!" It was DELICIOUS!! In fact, I wish I had ordered a couple more and NOT gotten the nachos. The meat was seasoned PERFECTLY!! And the tortilla was a thick one, that had been slightly grilled and delicious.

A good time was had and it was a really fun place right off of Freemont street.
Amazing Mexican food. Our waiter Yovanny was amazing as well. I suggest everyone close to the area to come and experience this restaurant.

My biggest gripe here is the service. They need to get it together regardless of whether they're having a bad day or not. Literally everyone working walked around without a smile on their face. I'm not expecting a welcome choir when I come in, but at least look like you wanna do your job.
Our server was Debbie, I joined my party late and had to wait five minutes before leaving my table and going to the counter to get a menu. And then I waited another three minutes at the counter while two employees looked at me and kept moving. I stopped someone and asked if I place my order there or if my server does it for me, and as if my question inconvenienced him, he said my server would do it.
Then Debbie comes to the table and without saying "hi, welcome to Nacho Daddy" or "hey, how's it going" or even "hi", she says "what can I get for you?" She REALLY made me wanna pay 15 dollars for two tacos.
She brought me water but didn't bring me a place setting. It'd be one thing if it was busy, but she had two other tables.
And then when we asked someone else for the check, because 4 out of the 6 people had been done with their food for a while, the guy said, in a hurried tone, "she's gonna get it, she's doing something right now."
Even if Debbie was legitimately busy, there still wouldn't be an excuse for the wait time of things & her attitude on top of that added to the not-so-great experience.

I don't know how my group was acting before I showed up, but even if they were some what of a hassle because they took too long to order, or couldn't decide or were constantly talking over each other, you're still in the service industry and your job is to put up with it and you deal with it every day, so buck up and deal with it. We all do things we don't wanna do.
I love this place! They have something for everyone. If your vegan you have the plenty of options! The food is tasty and the staff is awesome. Priced a little high but worth it!
The Nachos are awesome! Really cool environment to kick back, chill, and get your grub and drink on. Can't wait to come back!
Great food & even better service!!!!! Eric was cheerful & started our day with laughs!!

Eh... I was a little disappointed, which made me sad because this was my birthday dinner AND I'd heard so many good things about Nacho Daddy!

I made a reservation two weeks prior for 20 people. I called that afternoon to confirm the reservation. ("yep, we have it, no problem!"). When we arrived, no one seemed to know what we were talking about! Luckily, they weren't super busy, so they were able to set something up for us, but that definitely put a sour taste in my mouth to start.

Secondly,  the menu is NOT the same as what is posted online (only the Henderson location  posts their menu). This was especially disappointing because I'd already planned out what I wanted, but lo and behold, it wasn't on their menu. The menu of the Downtown location is much more abbreviated. 

I ended up ordering the BBQ nachos, which were good, but the sauce was very strong, and there was a lot of cilantro. We also had chips & salsa. The chips were great, and the salsa very hot. 

I also had a Raspberry Margarita, which was super sweet! I like sweet drinks, but this was even too sweet for my taste.  

We also got an order of the s'mores nachos to share and sing Happy Birthday to me! They were okay. Just beware that the marshmallow sauce is REALLY sticky! Just passing it around the table, a girl got some of it stuck in her hair, and I know I got some  on my face and it was hard to get off!

The service was very friendly and casual, but I think they were a little strapped for servers (it looked like they might have only had 2 and 1 or 2 bartenders?), so they didn't come back to check on us and our needs too often. 

I do want to check out the Henderson location, but I don't know that I'll return to ND downtown.
Nacho are the bomb. Must come here every visit. Service is great and the atmosphere is even better.
Love this restaurant. Great tex-mex grub! A must try is the buffalo nachos and the banana bread beer! Such a fun place to hang with friends with a great atmosphere right off Fremont street!

Good nachos and good margaritas. Great deals for HH. Not sure I would come here otherwise. The HH food offerings are cheap and tasty. Definately not authentic or high quality. The place has a "fast food" feel to it. Good for a quick late night meal.

Epic fail....speciality is nachos??? Maybe tequila and over priced at that.  100% filet nachos are not filet...skirt steak steak at best.  No cheese and the salsa tastes like prego pasta sauce.  This place is cool for a beer or tequila but nachos yeah right!

Thoroughly enjoyed my lunchtime visit to Nacho Daddy. Went with the Chicken Burrito. Reasonably priced, very tasty. Server was pleasant. No complaints about this spot. 

If you're looking to feel like you walked off of Freemont Street and into Mexico City for the most authentic Mexican experience ever, you won't find that at Nacho Daddy. But it's still great food. You'll enjoy!

I had a great time here , the atmosphere was chil , the food was excellent the folks that worked there where nice & courdious . Service was promoted , but most of all the food was really good , I will be back soon

This was one of the most enjoyable breakfasts ever. The kale and chicken scramble was incredible - very unique. Good service, although the place was pretty much empty early morning. I was miffed we were charged $9.95 for the $6.95 item but let it slide because the food was so impressive and I just didn't want to deal with it. 

A few days later we headed back and tried the Street Tacos which were decent and the Nacho Average Burger Nacho which didn't impress. I wish we'd have ordered something else.  I would go back solely for those breakfast scrambles.

We stopped by Nacho Daddy for a late night meal and drinks. My wife and I ordered the Thai Nachos and a couple margaritas. 

The Nachos were great. If you love Nachos, they got Nachos here. Lots and lots of Nachos to choose from. Not only were the combinations unique, they were super tasty! The cheese sauce was simply divine. Not even close to the jarred crap you find in the super market. The flavors blended together nicely. It also was nice that you got a heaping portion of these tasty treats.

Speaking of tasty treats, the margaritas were very good too. Once again, nothing was just plain and simple. I had a Sriracha Blood Orange Margarita and my wife opted to try the Pomegranate Margarita. Full of good liquor and juices. 

I almost got the courage to try their famous scorpion shot, but then I chickened out. Oh well, next time =)
Breakfast in Las Vegas is a favorite thing for us to do.   The Anaheim taco served at Nacho Daddy is the ultimate breakfast treat.  Loved it.
Highly recommend! The margaritas are to die for! Food and service is great too! Fun and friendly staff! Will definitely be back again and again!

They claim world famous nachos......I haven't been around the world, but these are the best machines I've ever Eaten.  Perfect ratio of toppings to chips. Perfect crispy chip. If ur tipsy and hungry stop reading other reviews now, order of the nacho menu and thank me later.

The food was fantastic, but I left my bag here (just bought a few things from Walgreens) close to closing time, and somehow it got stolen the second we left. Super shady, I highly recommend keeping your belongings close to you. I'll say nothing else.

This is located just a block away from Freemont street, but seems a bit quieter -- at least on a Sunday afternoon. However, the service leaves much to be desired...We sat at the bar and had chips, salsa, guac and margaritas. It took FOREVER for EVERYTHING! It took a while for us to even get menus, then for the bar tender to take our order, and then the bartender forgot our drinks order, so we had to ask someone else, and then the bartender didn't put in our whole order (even though we only ordered 2 things), so they we had to wait for them to bring out the salsa... The salsa was mediocre and the guac was underwhelmingly plain. The chips were actually pretty good. The margaritas were also mediocre. 
And then we had to go through this cycle again of trying to find someone to give us the check. We were going to pay with credit card, but it took so long that we ended up just paying with cash and leaving. 
Ambiance-wise, this seemed like a pretty mediocre Tex-Mex/Americanized Mexican joint. Also, they had some interesting choices for their TVs surrounding the bars. One had infomercials, just infomercials: vitamin supplements, prostate issues. Another TV had cartoons. If you're going to make your customers wait indefinitely, at least put something interesting on TV to keep them entertained.
Food was pretty good as always.  Nachos are good, burritos and tacos are good.  I dont think you can order something that you won't like.

TL;DR
+ Killer mexican grub, great portions, delicious drinks, good atmosphere, great service
- Seating area can be a tad cramped, maybe a wait YMMV

Órale!!!  As if the name wasn't enough...this place is no joke.

Visiting LV and some friends and I were deciding on dinner.  Tossup between here and somewhere else. Glad we chose Nacho Daddy.

Service:
Seated promptly, served quickly.  Mark was our server and he was incredible.  Great recommendations on margarita flavors, food options, checked back often enough to make sure we had all we need but was never overbearing.

Food:
Food was great.  Friends had vegetarian nachos, a HUGE burrito that looked like a baby swaddled in a blanket smothered in sauce, and I opted for the street tacos.  Started with chips and queso.  Queso warmed at the table via candle and that was a nice touch as who the hell likes cold queso?  Other restaurants, step it up! I'm tired of slamming my chips and queso because you serve me lukewarm cheese that turns to Lake Placid before I'm even halfway through the chips.  Lock it up, ya'll!!

Portions, needless to say, were huge.  Street tacos were *la bomba*.  Nachos looked to be delicious and although the burrito was massive, my friend finished it, so plus on not having to lug a to-go box around.

Bevs:
Got two pitchers of margaritas, the mango and blood orange.  Both had equal portions of flavor and booze.  For sure thought we'd get shorted on the tequila, but after the first pitcher I knew that was a lie.

Overall this place is a huge win.  Will definitely make it point to come back next time I'm in LV.
very dark. i had to pull out my phone light just to read the menu, the food was good. nothing crazy, very regular. i would go back but i'm not crazy about it
Tiny nachos! Are you kidding me?! If you want to spend $15 and stay starving, you should definitely check this place out.

$12 tequila shots? Mediocre and overpriced food? Yes. You have come to the right place to lose money... no, not Vegas - this joke of a SoCal ripoff. Actually, I can't remember the last time I paid $12 for a shot in LA. Avoid, and avoid DT in general.

Ok...  so lets preface this review by saying we rolled in here at 2 am, completely annihilated.  We didn't order any drinks.  We were WAY past that point.  We did, however, need sustenance.  So the 4 of us split some wings and a plate of nachos.  Both were hits.  Service was grate, they were well accustomed to our kind and we're funny and didn't get annoyed with the drunken antics.  We sat outside so I can't really speak much to the inside except the bathrooms.  They could have been a bit cleaner but at 2am on a saturday in Vegas, beggars can't be choosers and I was just happy they were functional. The guys actually wanted to come back the next night for drunk food, it was solid.  If you happen to be downtown late at night, you should stop in.

I was staying on Fremont alone solely for the vegan food and booze. I didn't only bar hop...I appetizer hopped. I had a method to my madness though: it had to be on happy hour or have a yelp check-in free drink. 

And free drink they did. I got the house margarita with my check in offer and the vegan quesadilla. When I ordered I was surprised to hear a fellow next to me say, "I'll have what she's having." To which the bartender said, "you know she got the vegan quesadilla right?" 

*cue 30 minute conversation about every Netflix health documentary*

We both enjoyed our quesadillas and margaritas. As the drinks flowed, the less processed/fake it tasted. By my second strong margarita, I was convinced. 

Would I recommend making your farm-raised cheese loving grandma try the vegan food here? No, it's not that convincing. But to be drunk and able to indulge in vegan Mexican food is one of my highlights of 2017. Fortunately grandma can order off of the regular non-vegan/vegetarian menu.

First time in Las Vegas and Nacho Daddy made a lasting impression. I will forever dream about their Queso! Stopped by here after walking down Freemont Street with my friends and I'm so so happy we did. This is a stop you must make while visiting Las Vegas. Service was pretty good and the Nachos and Queso were AMAZING! Nachos were a huge and the three of us weren't able to finish them.

Having been to the Henderson location a few times I guess I expected better at their vegas location. Service was very slow but friendly. Took a loooong time to be served. I had the steak supreme tacos, I rate them as a 2 star taco. The meat had a very strange texture. The rice was nasty and the retried beans were runny and tasted flat.

Margaritas are on point and the enchilada nachos are hitting the spot. I was a little worried about the service when we walked in. Last time I ended up walking out but our waiter Aerrick is fantastic!!  I will definitely come back and sit in his section.

BEST NACHOS I'VE EVER HAD.
If you love seafood, let me recommend the Crab and Lobster (seafood) nachos! They were sooooo delicious and came on a cookie sheet sized tray. It was definitely enough for both of us to share. Also, the chips and salsa as an appetizer was perfect!! They bring out 3 delicious salsa flavors (mild, medium and hot). We can NEVER come back to Las Vegas and NOT eat here. Easily my favorite restaurant here. Also, Aerrick was the most energetic server working last night. His service was soooooo amazing!!! You're lucky if you get him as a server. I would've tipped him $1,000 if I could've. Thank you for the amazing service Aerrick. I'm sure you get complimented on your service quite often.
Giustina is on the short list of best bartenders in all of Vegas. Makes outstanding margs!! Place has some of the best chips and salsa around. Must try!
This place is on point. BBQ pork nachos were amazing plus I got my free Margarita, so worth it! Recommend this place to everyone and I will be back! And thanks you our server Mark, you rock!

First time at Nacho Daddy downtown location and I have to say it wasn't great. We sat at the bar which was a little dirty and sticky but bartender was very nice and attentive. The restroom smelled and the floors were wet, at least the men's side. 

We ordered the Vegas Golden Knight nachos which feeds  about two. It tasted real good but it was very skimpy on the meat. There were plenty of peppers, onions, and cheese sauce but just lacked the filet mignon. It tasted a lot like fajitas. For $20 I expected more meat. Anyways, I don't see myself going back due to the high prices but at least I can say I've tried it.

I have been to the on the strip! 
But this one nice too! 
The best Skinny Margarita and very good food and the service is nice but they forgot about our order and didn't check on it! 
It was about 11:00 A.M and very slow and we waited about 30 minutes for our food
But, she gave us free chip and salsa on the house to make up..!
I love this place..!

Place was packed for Cavs Warriors game 3 (prolly packed all the time) and we got fairly quick service. We sat at the bar. Got the queso dip (v. good) and a nacho plate that is escaping my memory right now. Possibly from the recreational activity that is now legal in Vegas. Anyway I would suggest this place if you're looking for nachos. I checked in and they gave me a free house margarita with joy (16 oz).

Allie made us some delicious margaritas for Cinco De Mayo! We had house margaritas with some Jalapeños in it! I had fish Tacos and my vegetarian wife had the vegetarian chicken fajita bowl. Both were great, I even liked her veggie chicken! Great service too, thanks Allie!
El resturante fue muy bueno porque sus burritos y fajitas fueron delicioso. Filet Mignon fajita was so good! Best choice on Fremont street.

Came with a large group and they easily accommodated us. Food was great and large portions. Margaritas were AWESOME! My groyp couldn't get enough of the spicy cucumber margarita. Aerick was the best server ever. Ask for him if you go.

One of the nicest place to visit when around 2 blocks in this area. Ordered thai nachos which I must say was hesitant to order but our server told we won't be disappointed and he was totally right. I enjoyed the nachos so much..it was different and such a great combination (mouth-watering just thinking about it). Fish tacos was good too..I cannot remember what fish it was but I loved it. No complains at all about the food or the service. Got couple of margaritas too...(thanks to yelp checkin got them for free) however found them a little bit sweet. After finishing it half I reached a point where I felt I am having sugar syrup so a bit disappointed with the drink but food made it up for it.

Love Nacho Daddy!  HUGE plate of nachos and pitcher of margaritas!

What's not to love?  :)

It's a great place...

Nacho daddy don't know how to make no nacho I got the nacho lobster & crab nacho didn't have enough cheese. All my little bit of cheese was stuck burnt on the tray. I also got filet mignon nachos they also didn't have alot of cheese I also order cheese & jalapeño nacho they we're the only ones where you could actually see the cheese. Then we ordered the churro for dessert & they were to hard.

This place opens at 8:00 am. The bartender asked if we would like the bloody marry bar and my husband said sure... Oh wait it was not set up yet. I took her (Alex) over 15 minutes to bring us our drinks - did I tell you we were the only one at the bar. Guess I need to stick to the one closer to my house and not the tourist one downtown. Won't be back.
The food is about Del Taco quality and the menu is all over the place and I get the feel this is a restaurant without direction.  Hopefully a decent restaurant will move into this space.

After a couple days of buffet & casino food, bf and I were looking for a nearby spot for lunch that offered something a little different. Thank you, Yelpers for leading us to Nacho Daddy, right off the beaten Fremont Street Experience path.

I'm kind of wavering between 3 & 4 stars here, service was lacking, but the food was good. 

The place feels a little divided, with the bar & bar dining on the other side of the wall from a more open, "brunchy" feeling dining area. We sat away from the bar but I wish we hadn't, it was much livelier over there!

The menu offers tacos, burritos, chips, guac... I honestly didn't look over it too long because we found what we wanted right away. We split the guacamole, chicken street tacos and pork burrito. Everything was very tasty and reasonably priced.

Our server was a bit inattentive, forgetting things here and there, taking awhile on the drinks, etc. We weren't in a big hurry though so it wasn't a huge deal.

Glad we stopped by!
Kind of a weird place but their chicken quesadilla was pretty good. Wings are good but if you can't handle your lips burning get wing sauce on side and use minimally. Drinks a little pricey.
Great margaritas, amazing food, do not miss this excellent place!

I absolutely loved the nachos here. I consider myself a nacho connoisseur. These are some of the best I've ever had.  Big enough for two people. Interesting variety of nachos available. I love this place so much if possible id open a franchise where I live, in Virginia Beach. A MUST VISIT for us from now on when we go on our yearly Vegas trip!!!!!!

Stopped in because walking by I saw they had a couple of great craft beer IPA's on tap...ordered one and sat at the bar. My bartender was Bridget, and she made me feel like a regular in no time. She was friendly, fast and played a great host. In a visit that was going to be one beer stretched into three. Like I said, great host. When I tabbed out I learned that if I brought the receipt in during the morning, I got a free breakfast.
WHAT??? I love this place. Of course I ordered a couple bloody marys with it...so it was a win/win for everyone. The breakfast was a great skillet with eggs, potatoes, cheese and chourizo...pretty awesome. I'll be back next time in town.
The service was the best! Very outgoing, easy going, and entertaining staff and place. I wish I'd taken the scorpian shot. Next time!

If you love nachos you have to try this place. There are so many options! And they are SO delicious! The enchilada nachos were amazing and the sweet chili nachos were so unique and delicious. We also had a fireball margarita which was fantastic! Nice location near Fremont and great service
mark was amazing!!!!!!! best waiter so far and the food was delish! Good sized portions enough to feed two people.

CHECK YOUR RECEIPT BEFORE YOU PAY!

Classic tale of how bad service can ruin your entire experience.

I frequent the Nacho Daddy in the Henderson area, to the point where the servers pretty much know what I am having so I was eager to try the downtown location. I went in on a Saturday afternoon. The menu is completely different than the Henderson location, but they have an awesome happy hour and everything tasted good. I was with a party of four, and we decided to split our checks. I offered to pay for our appetizer, and didn't think too much when my check came in a little higher. When I got home later that night and cleaned by bag, I realized that I was charged for than double price for my entree. I called the next morning hoping that the problem could be corrected via phone. I was told that I had to physically go downtown, which is a hassle from Aliante. I asked for gas for the inconvenience. Anthony, the manager, proceeded to call me a liar among other things.. just completely unprofessional.

I was later allowed to come collect the difference. The server confirmed her mistake. The assistant manager was just as rude as Anthony, and not once did anyone offer an apology. 

I can say with great confidence, that I will never step foot in another Nacho Daddy. If you're in Henderson, check out Zabas or Chipotle nearby. Downtown there are plenty of substitutes that won't try to rip you off.

Been to ND several times and it never seems to disappoint!!!  Best Margaritas around. And don't forget to try the Filet Mignon Nachos.....you won't regret it. Aeerick took care if us today and was a stud.  His personality, sense or humor and enthusiasm is what makes us want to keep coming back for more.  He made our stay well worth it!!!!  Can't wait for our next trip to Vegas just so we can stop by our favorite Mexican Joint. Thanks ND!!!

Amazing!!

Had our first lunch in Vegas here. It's about a 15min walk from our hotel the Monte Carlo. We ordered the enchilada nachos and the buffalo chicken nachos. Both very good, but the enchilada one was amazing. Consist of Green salsa with pulled chicken refried beans and of course cheese. We ate it so fast I didn't even take a picture. 
The buffalo nachos needed more queso blanco, I had to order a side of it because it felt like I was just eating chips covered in buffalo sauce. 
The strawberry margarita was very tasty. I def recommend. 

The next day we wanted to come here again but wanted to give other restaurants the opportunity. Now I regret leaving Vegas without visiting this place twice. Back in Texas we are searching for something similar.

Disappointed! I've had nacho daddy in my bookmarks for a while now & this location let me down. Service was horrible. Host sat my friend & I at a table and it took about 5 minutes to get any service. There were 3 servers just standing around not doing anything until we called one over. The waiter Jon was rude & everything we ordered he kept clarifying the prices. Like HELLO there's a menu here with prices when you do that you make it seem like we can't afford it, that's so unprofessional. I heard another group complaining that they didn't have any server help them either and they were waiting for about 10 mins. The tacos were ok...margarita was ok... They have scorpion shots which is cool just to say you ate a scorpion. But yeah, very mediocre. Wouldn't recommend.

Wow and wow. Just off the strip and amazing in every way. Fresh and filling. Not your $6.99 all you can eat but that isn't what we were looking for. Huge flavor and cleaner than anything we have seen in Vegas to date. This place will be a tradition for our family. Great find in every way.
Our server Mark was great!!! The seafood tacos weren't what I expected.....but the service was awesome!!!!!
Pretty good. One nacho plate easily feeds two. I guess this place is cool.?.?.?.

Okay, it's near Fremont Street, it's a sports bar and it's a tad divey and it was perfect.  Watched Hockey and football while enjoying a pile of nachos.  They have a varied menu but how could I not do nachos at a restaurant with a name like this. Our server was great and our team was winning...
Who knew nachos could be so amped up? They do not skimp out on anything! They give you so much cheese, every layer and chip was basically drenched in their oh so creamy/well-seasoned cheese.
Fun place, great food, awesome employees  (especially Evan!)!  The Happy hour is amazing! We'll definitely be back!

I come here at least once a week. Im usually here for lunch and its never too busy which I like. Not sure what its like at night. The food is good and the staff is great! I haven't sat at the bar yet, again, I'm only there for lunch but it looks big and fully stocked!
Excellent vegan beer battered tacos! Black beans and vegan cheese. Outdoor seating and courteous waiters.

Came here on the Pub Crawl and came back after for the food. I had the cucumber, jalapeño margarita-so good! Food was really good as well, but it took FOR-EV-ER to get it (at LEAST 30 mins). Server was OK, not overly friendly.

Fiesta Nachos were amazing! Great environment to swing in off of Freemont Street and enjoy a meal. Our waitress Alex provided great service, all-around great dining experience and will always make this a stop when I come downtown.

First of all, the food was AMAZING!!!  But the service was the worse I've had!  I'm not a complainer by any means, but this waitress  was terrible.  Our food didn't come together, 1 person in our party of 6 didn't even get their plate at all.  She said she was going to take it off the bill, then proceeded to have her co worker come over and have us pay for it.  It was a cluster fuck.  No one apologized or owned up to anything.  I forgot to mention, the rest of the service our original waitress was hiding out from us, bizarre!!!  
  But let me tell you, the food is well worth to come back to.  Every time we'll be in downtown Vegas, we will definitely be here to dine!  Hands down, my brothers Loco Moco nachos were the best!  And don't forget to try the Mexican corn as an appetizer.  Prices were good for the quality of food you get!  A must try
I have eaten several times and always have received awesome service and food that is incredible.. Highly recommend this place.. Taco Tue? 3 for $5.. All are good but pork is my favorite!!

This place has the best Mexican food ever. The corn and flour tortillas are made from scratch and you can taste the difference. The nachos are balanced and hearty, the crab enchiladas were great, and have the best fish taco I've ever tasted.  Our server was great. 

I'm from Texas and visited California, eaten Mexican food all over, and this is still the best. 

I would award a Michelin star if I could.
Brittany and her trainee were great and professional.. food and drinks what can I say are always great and tonight again amazing and tasty.. will always bring guest and friends here..
Amazing food, huge portions! Our waiter was fast and friendly! Highly recommended! Very cool layout!

This place is banging. Homemade everything. Chips, dips, guacamole, salsa, and this heavenly queso that I basically wanted to drink out of the bowl. Our server was awesome, attentive, made sure our drinks were just as full as our bellies.  I don't think that any of the nacho plates would be bad, they all sounded great. We decided to eat the Supreme tostada nacho's, which was basically a classic with some surprises. The beef is seasoned perfectly, and they serve it with something they call avocado lime salsita, it was perfect. 
The day we were there, they didn't have the corn-on-the-cob, it was off the cob, but for real, it was the best tasting Mexican style corn ever. We could eat here every other day, no joke, I can't wait to go back and try the BBQ pulled pork nachos!

This location has been open for a couple months, but this was the first time we were able to go for lunch. This restaurant has the fancy Ferrari designed Coca Cola machine so I indulged in a Cherry Coke. We decided to share an order of nachos, tostada style, and an order of grilled mahi mahi tacos. The tacos turned out to be one in the case of the fish option, but our server insisted it would be enough food. Our server and the others seemed very young and not supervised, but were all very smiley and all kept busy even though the restaurant was quiet. 
The food came out very quickly and was really good! The taco was my preference, I will totally order it again. A fresh flour tortilla, slightly crisper and loaded with two small tender mahi filets, cabbage, chipotle cream, salsa cruda. It was so delicious I almost couldn't stop eating at the halfway mark! The nachos were very good as well, loaded with seasoned beef, refried beans, Pico de gallo, queso and shredded cheeses, sour cream, guacamole, lettuce, fried jalapenos. 
I highly recommend this place for quick lunch or late bar bites. Really accessible menu for picky groups. I'll have to try a burger next time for sure.

Make sure you have a reservation at 6. because they will have all 15 tables open and still tell you it's an hour wait. Host was an absolute rude girl . would not go back to this place just because of her. She stated everyone must be 21 and older at 6 p.m. at night ridiculous

The food here is exceptional, but the real reason to go is the bar.

FUN, FUN, FUN!!!!!

Where else on earth are you going to get a "Scorpion Shot?"
--- Yes a real scorpion is in the bottom of the glass, and you get to keep the glass.

HAVE NO FEAR -- THE FUN IS HERE

food is good, and feel good about the service of mark(server). price is also resonable. 
visit here!

The service was amazing!!! Our server was Alex and she was amazing. She was very attentive and always replaced my margaritas. The house margaritas are amazing. BUT they are STINGY when it comes to meats with your meal. I ordered ceviche and It had only 3 small shrimps. My friend ordered a tostada and it had lots or cheese but only 4 shrimp. It was very disappointing. The taste was yummy but the portions are ridiculous for the price. I would definitely go back to have margaritas but for the food go some where else.

This place has a huge vegan menu which I love! The tacos idk what breading they use to make the vegan taco tortillas but omg they were delicious!! The guacamole was good too! Actually everything I got was amazing my man got the chicken fajitas and he ate most of it. The drinks are good and heavy which I like!! I felt I good buzz after I left this place.
