Cool industrial grungy interior, friendly service, and a vast variety of nachos. We settled on filet mignon nachos and they were tasty and perfect for Super Bowl Sunday!

Found this spot while walking down the Freemont experience.  The name caught sister's eye as she is an authority on nachos,  so we decided to stop by for a  snack before dinner. We decided on the Tostada nachos, and they were something delicious.  I really like the medley of red onion, tomatoes, and jalapeño that was diced perfectly atop nachos that were kissed with fresh beans, cheese,  and seasoned ground beef. Our server, Brendan was a bearded lil cutie who was very nice and took care of business. I noticed several people taking shots with baby scorpions in them (which is a specialty of some sort there). If you're brave enough   give it a try, and If you want a quick bite, this is the place for you.
Jovany is the MAN! Great spot, awesome atmosphere and good food! House margaritas are a staple and must try. Tvs all over the place so nothing is missed. And great walking distance to Fremont

I felt compelled to login into my yelp account to give a well deserved 5-star review.  A member of our party needed food badly and ordered before the rest of us. Unfortunately, there was a mix up and those who ordered later somehow got their food first. The waitress and manager were extremely apologetic and remedied the situation by providing our party with chips, salsa and a round of shots! How great are they? The food was fantastic (pulled pork nachos, ceviche, chilaquiles and shrimp tacos.) We also enjoyed a pitcher of their house margarita which was delicious. If I could give this place 17 stars I would. Thank you for the hospitality Nacho Daddy!

Any menu that has street corn gets 4 stars in my book. The food is always good and the service is decent. The prices are a little high but the portions are HUGE!!! So overall it all works out. :)  BTW: If you don't like tomato soup.. don't get the tortilla soup. It was tomato soup with chicken in it. I would not reccomend that. The buffalo chicken queso is AMAZING!

Ok these street tacos are BOMB. 3 for $5 if u get chicken or pork or 3 for $7 if u get shrimp or steak. I got pork & they were amazing!!!! 
Yum!

Ordered Chicken and steak fajita servings where very good.Fajitas came hot and sizzling and tasted Great!!! Also ordered side of Queso that came with warmer to keep cheese dip hot! Chips we're light and crispy hint of salt but overall the meal was Good services was Good. But the prices of food was expensive for Mexican food.

This place is delicious and our bartender (Griffin, I believe) was great. Chill but on point with service. We were staying at the Golden Nugget and visited this place 3 times in a 24 hour period. Had 2 different kinds of nachos, breakfast taco, huevos rancheros and lots of beer! Definitely our go to place from now on!

This is a great place for vegan nachos!! I loved going to the Henderson location and was so bummed when they closed. This was my first time visiting this location and it didn't disappoint. The food and service was excellent. I was glad that we had the night to walk the Fremont Experience after eating! The portion of food is more than generous here. I will be back and would recommend!
They get 5 Stars just for the Lobster and Crab Nachos. Establishment is nothing special but service was 4 star so I left pleased.

Freak'n Fantastic Nachos !!!
We split the Supreme, Golden Knights and the Thai Sweet Chili Nachos .......OMG ......Sooooooo Good !!!!
You have to check this place out if in Vegas --

Today, was our first time at Nacho Daddy. Everything seemed fine. Food was amazing and drink were bomb.com! The only downside to this visit was the restrooms they were disgusting  and dirty! If that's how they have the restrooms just imagine how they have the kitchen. 
Changing Table had poop all over!!!!!!It was so gross!

I am so very impressed with the service I reviewed at Nacho's.  The food was good, but the bar staff/servers (Anya was ours) is what made the experience memorable. My husband and I visit Vegas often and going forward the service that we received will bring us back to Nacho Daddy's every time. Make this a place to stop on your list of things to do in Vegas! And ask for Anya she will not disappoint you in her attitude and ability to fix any issues with food, atmosphere, and of course having a great time!

last trip to Vegas we wanted to check this place out but didn't have time but definitely made some this time around and it was everything we thought it would be my girlfriend being a vegetarian wanted to try it she loved her  nachos and I had the enchiladas good food I would definitely recommend it. Huge menu definitely something for everybody to choose from

We started our dinner with the queso as an appetizer, it was sooooo delicious I had to make myself stop eating it because I didn't want to fill up before my actual entree came. For dinner I  had the fish tacos, and they were so good and fresh, especially the hand made flour tortillas. They were amazing. I was so full but I had to have the fried ice cream. Everything was wonderful and delicious.

Very good food, good service and nice place all around. I got the BBQ nachos and really liked them. However, it's kind of expensive (as is most of the food in Vegas, I found!)- I never thought I would spend $15 on nachos. Still, it was very good food for the downtown area. We ran into quite a bit of bad food on our trip, this place being the big exception.

My husband works nearby (they offer free chips and salsa for "neighbors" btw) and he goes to lunch here a lot. When were in the area around lunch time, he thought this would be the best place to bring our kids. Not all the restaurants downtown are very accommodating to families, so I was worried.  Despite my fears, they were very accommodating. They had high chairs and kids menus out for us in no time at all. They have kid cups which seems minor but I can't tell you how many times down waiter had attempted to hand a big, open top, glass to our toddlers. 

The food was amazing, the kids loved  the chicken fingers and BBQ nachos. My husband and I devoured the dip sampler, he has tacos and I had the Mexican burger. It was excellent.

My only complaint is that we had to move the chairs a few times for people to get through because the seating area is small.

Randomly came upon this place while walking the Fremont Street experience! We ordered a skinny Margarita and a blueberry margarita and they were both really good! Great prices especially for the area. I got huevos rancheros which was really yummy and my bf got pulled pork street tacos which he really enjoyed! Great attentive and friendly servers/bartenders! Will recommend this place for sure : )

We had seen the giant sign outside many times and I finally talked my wife into letting me try this place.  It's bigger and nicer inside than I expected it to be.  I asked the server what the specialty was and she said the burger nacho so that is what I ordered.  The portion was very large and the chips were great and the cheese sauce was pretty good too.  The burger part was a chilly type sauce that you would find on hot dogs.  It wasn't bad but could have used a lot more flavor and some spice.  To kick it up I had to use a lot of hot sauce.  There were also no jalapeño peppers. 

My wife had the vegan tofu nachos and loved them but this is my review on what I had.  The bottom line for me is if you are a nacho place and some gets your signature dish it should be oh wow.  What I had was ok not oh wow.  Average ok place.
Just do if you are in Vegas!!!!  Great happy our and the bartenders' energy are on 100.

The biggest waste of money.   Had been hearing about this place for a while and finally gave it a try on this past Friday (9/4).   We got the buffalo chicken nachos.   Mostly covered in ranch or blue cheese dressing, we are not sure which.   Service was slow, atmosphere was nothing to brag about and food was awful.    They state they make the chips, they must make them weeks before.  Ours were incredibly stale.      Won't got back any time soon, the pear margarita was ok.   However, there are plenty of other bars to drink at with much better food for the price.    I can't even give this place one star, however it made me in order to post this

Hands down best queso appetizer I've  ever had.  Filet Mignon nachos were super tasty as well. The nachos are big enough to share. We couldn't eat all the queso or nachos we ordered.  Loved that when we checked in we got a free house margarita as well. Service was great. I'm so glad we ventured the short walk off Fremont street to eat here.

Horrible service!  I'm a patient man, but seriously! It's seems that out servers were more interested in drinking with each other and having social time then making sure we had drinks and food.  Then getting napkins was like pulling teeth.  We asked for forks 4 times ! It's wasn't until the food came that the food runner brought us some. He should have been out server.  The food is good and it's sad that service sucks!  So many places downtown up and coming and this could be a great place if they get their act together.  Tables should be attended all the time and when you have a large party ordering shots , drinks and food you would think they would want the business.  Very disappointed !

Nacho Daddy downtown on 4th St is really cute. Loved the decor and the servers were very nice if not a bit slow.  I ordered the steak burrito with red and green enchilada sauce on the side. The presentation was nice but the burrito was just okay.  The enchilada sauces were tasty though!! I might go back to try something else as I always like to give places a second chance.

Had the huevos rancheros and the after feeling was just not great; however, the food was good. The pricing was decent and the portions were pretty dope. Probably my body not so used to all the grease but it's a decent spot to check out in the vegas area

Great prices, great vegan menu, great nachos!

Can't wait to go back and try the Pad Thai Nachos!

Wow. They have great food and great service. The staff there are very friendly and it's a great place to chill.  They give you a time and when they are ready they text you which is pretty cool. They also have a great choice of housemade queso.

I came here on a Friday night during March madness to meet some friends and sat at the bar.  Service was good even though it was crowded.  My friend and I had never been here before and the waitress recommended the Fiesta Nachos as one of the popular dishes.  I thought they were just okay.  The chips could have been hotter in my opinion.  Considering this place specializes in nachos I guess I was expecting to be blown away.  I don't see myself coming back here unless it's another invite type situation.

Amazing tacos and nachos! Nachos are large enough you can split with 2-3 people. I personally thought the chicken nachos were better than the beef nachos. Salsa was fresh and great as well. Atmosphere was welcoming. Service was outstanding. House margaritas are strong and tasty!
G (bartender) was uhhhhh.... awesome! Food and margaritas were good as well! I would recommend this place if you are craving Mexican food.

Love the food but I'm pissed at the fact the that our bill was 33.29. I put a $20 bill and a credit card down and our server charged the credit card the full amount. The manager noticed our anger when w looked at the bill. She came over to see what was wrong we told her. She handled the situation better than we could ask for by telling us don't worry she'll take care of it but I told her that I put a $20 bill and the credit card in the folder and that she needs to look at the security camera above us because that employee is scamming us and she said he worked for her for 5 years and he would never do that and I insisted that she check the cameras and she refused. WATCH YOURSELVES! The managers could possibly be in on this scam!!!! Always check your bills!!

Definitely a good place to get a meal. It's close enough to walk to Fremont St., but not right in the midst of the crazy. Great selection of food and drinks. Our server was top notch and the food came out quick. It was tasty and we walked away filled. My wife got the burger with the mango salsa. That salsa is delicious.

Sitting here drinking my beer, ordered chicken bbq nachos and I've been waiting for 55 minuets and counting waiting  for my food to come. I did order it to go since I have work to do back at my hotel. Reason it took so long was because they put my order on the other side of the restaurant... really are we playing hide and go seek with customers food now? Thanks for the waist of time.

Came to Nacho Daddy for the scorpion shot. Ended up getting food and it was so good. The nacho starter plates are HUGE and the queso burrito was so good.



Our server was pretty awesome.
Loved nacho daddy great nachos so many different kinds. Also did a Scorpion shot This is a must do.

Fun place to go with really good nachos. We tried 2 different type of nachos here and grilled shrimp tacos. Everything was good. If you are adventurous take the scorpion shots. We got tiny scorpions. You just throw it back like an oyster shot.

I was not impressed by this venue.  First off we weren't greeted.  Secondly, it took a very long time before we were acknowledged by a server after we sat ourselves.  It was a slower Wednesday night.  

Our table wasn't cleaned off and we had to ask.

The nachos were really nothing fantastic.

At best,  the Mexican corn was pretty good.  One star for the Mexican corn.
Just on point with all aspects. Amazing food, big portions quality product. Ambiance is lively but can have a conversation. The staff is just incredible and genuine. This is a must!

Great atmosphere! The margaritas were amazing and good sized. We had chips, salsa & guacamole, all were super good and authentic. The Vegan loaded nachos were also outstanding. For someone never finding good vegan cheese, this was a treat for me! Definitely would recommend.

These guys are great! Very service oriented, good is fantastic the flour tortillas have some crack in them I'm sure of it! The roast pork is crazy good the nachos are awesome and the daddy margaritas live up to the reputation of being the best in town!
Also my girlfriend wants me to mention the wait staff is the best

We started at the Nacho Daddy's in Henderson and ended up at this location because the one in Henderson had a weird vide to it. We are glad we came to this location instead because it is very lively and it is in the heart of downtown. Ric was our server and he was very attentive and provided great service. We ordered the mango and peach margaritas and were delicious ! The nachos were also amazing! Will be coming back to this location.

The food here is amazing, the drinks are pretty good as well. This is a little hidden place in old Vegas strip off of 4th street. Our server Jose was awesome! Got our drinks order as soon as we sat down, that that started the night. Between my friends and I we split a couple of different dishes. We got a chimichanga, supreme nachos, quesadilla and a corn on a cob. Everything tasted delicious, it is the best drunk food. Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free house margarita and the drink is STRONG for being free. Music is on point and the environment is a cute little dive bar feel. 

Must try this place when you're in the area! Definitely the best nacho place I've had in a while! 
Service: 10/10
Food: 10/10
Drinks: 10/10
Price: 10/10

Nacho Daddy is a good spot if you're downtown and craving some Mexican fare. We came on a busy Sunday night, football and Life is Beautiful festival happening, and we were greeted quickly.  Our server really made the experience 4 star, always checking on us and fast service! Thanks Mark M. :)

The food, I'd give 3.5 stars. It's was fresh, but lacked a little on taste. I got the enchiladas, and the green sauce was barely present. I like my enchiladas pretty saucy.  But they had enough sour cream and sides to keep it from being too dry.  The Daddy's Margarita was pretty tasty though.

There are better places for Mexican food in town. But if you're looking to satisfy your appetite for a good price Downtown, Nacho Daddy didn't disappoint.

First of all, I had a group of 6 coming to eat a late night meal, we looked on yelp and it said they were closing at 3am, which was perfect, we walk in around 1:45am, staff was awesome! Got us a table right away, service was fast, food was DELICIOUS!! I ordered the Tostada nachos, super tasty! portions are pretty big, definitely big enough for two people to share!
Would absolutely go back, I've been to nacho daddy before but not the downtown location, and so far it's my favorite! Thank you ND!

Of course I had to check my Yelp Bookmark to see what I had on the list of To Do's...and lord behold look what I Yelped. If I recall correctly, I think I found this place on one of those eat shows! :-)
Alright, so my old school mate friend & I hit this up! She said she had heard of it but, never had a chance to go so she was all in and as excited as me to get our Blaxican girl palate fulfilled. Sweet deets Indeed!!!!

This I would say, is the better location out of the 2(other closer to Las Vegas strip) but, the ratings on this are legit. I can solidify this now as this is steps from the "new Downtown street-front nicely decorated boardwalk look"!

Don't forget to use your Yelp Check in for a FREE House Margarita as this is sincerely "the best house margarita I've ever had in Vegas"!!!! It was so good I think we had 2more and was buzz. 

Customer service was attentive, offered recommendations and all together on point. 
Food...omg they damn supreme nacho's was the **it! This will be my spot from now on everytime I'm in Vegas as I've been craving Nacho Daddy Nachos & that yummy wet burrito every since...

I'm actually jealous that, my girl stay in Vegas and went back the very next night w/her dude. :-0 and has daily access to this spot unlike myself. :-( being miles away. 
She's went 3 times in just a week, since her 1st visit with me. You already know...she's on my **it-List because, she been more times than me now & WITHOUT ME! This is just not right! Laughing out loud 

PSA: @Nacho Daddy please open up a location in Atlanta, GA. Atlantic Station, Downtown ATL, On Edgewood, Cucumber-land Mall area would be a great place to look into. Please please please come to Atlanta.

I really like that they have a great vegan selection and you can eat there until 2 a.m. last night the waitress was horrible her name was Anya V. I asked her to show me the vegan menu. When I made my decisions amd ask for the Vegan chicken fajita salad. She told me with a very shocking voice:"but you know this is not real chicken". I'm asking for a vegan menu I'm also ordering a vegan item and Iam wearing a Vegan  T-Shirt and Vegan hat. Why Anya do you have to tell me its not real chicken???.  The food was ok as usually. I wish they used gardin chicken or beyond meat chicken. I might remove this review. When I visit this place and the staff is respectful to Vegans.

BEWARE: your eyes will be bigger than your stomach! The white queso appetizer was my favorite item we got, and a little goes a long way. The chicken tortilla soup almost had an enchilada-type base-I wish it came with avocado chunks. The quesadilla with chicken had the biggest, most tender chicken-I had to use a knife and fork! I wish it had a spice to it though. The boyfriend got the tostada nachos with white queso. It took all he had to try and finish them. We were STUFFED. I will come back to Nacho Daddy for sure when we come back to Vegas!

Terrible thought by coming in here with such a diverse atmosphere that I would be welcomed but instead was embarrassed and humiliated and not allowed to have a drink and was cut off but the rest of my party was yes u guessed allowed to party when it came time to pay the lady had no problem taking my money since I was the one hosting and paying but would not serve me! Never again and I don't recommend it to anyone!

So let me start by saying I LOVE Nacho Daddy. It is my first and last stop of every trip to Vegas. I feel like a regular even though I live hours away...The supreme tacos are the best thing about Nacho Daddy aside from the margaritas, even though they are called Nacho Daddy. I went today as my first stop to Vegas and ordered nachos. We asked for some extra cheese sauce, and after waiting awhile never received it. The waiter continuously checked on us, and at the end the manager took our whole nacho order off the bill. It was such wonderful customer service and after already loving this place, I can only say this MUST be a stop for everyone in Vegas. Love love love this place!!

Not sure if we will be back. Ordered the lobster tail tacos but received something else when I asked aerik about it he said he didn't know. I dont know what's worse a waiter that doesn't know the menu or the fact that you just brought me anything like I wouldn't notice. Very disappointing

I'd give them zero stars in terms of customer service. Horrible horrible horrible attention to customers. We had only chips and salsa as it took so long for the bartender to even approach us to order food...she could have cared less...Evan at the bar was the only friendly person here and he could not serve us food. Too bad.
Get some new staff who care.
I wish I could rate the food but we couldn't even order....

Theeee best nachos I've ever had! Got the filet mignon nachos with added spicy shrimp... also if you use yelp they really do give you the free house margarita which is 895 and you can put that towards any other margarita you would want if you don't want the house margarita.....my husband got the chimichanga which is pretty good he added spicy shrimp to it as well....all in all great food great drinks worth the money

Came to nacho daddy for my husbands bday and it was amazing! We are from tx and this place is just as good as the Tex mex from back home! Plus the drinks are awesome! I definitely recommend this place to tourists and people looking for good food! Jio was a great server!
Had the tortilla soup it was yummy, service was fast. House Margarita too sweet n didn't taste an ounce of tequila. Meh!
They have high quality ingredients and that made for tasty nachos. Great tv watching at the bar. They have Pacifico on tap.

Just arriving into Vegas my family decided it was time to eat. We've looked around for something different, and came across Nacho Daddy. Based on other patron reviews we figured to give it a try. 
We were not disappointed! 
We were greeted as soon as we walked in and offered a table immediately. 
Our server came over to our table just as we sat down and had a super awesome attitude. Grabbed our beverages quickly and took our order without delay.

Once we did get our food we were surprised by the amount of the serving! It keep me full for most of he day.
My son ordered the Nachos with cheese and jalapeño and to be honest, he ate every single last nacho on his dish. He was in heaven. I had the bbq pork and it was surely on point, the bbq sauce and pork were perfect.
My wife ordered a chicken chimmey changa and it was massive. With the size of that order the chicken was perfect and the crispyness of the changa was perfect.

Overall I would tell anyone who wanted to try our something more then your average run of the mill eatery to give this place a try. It was welcoming to my family and the food was delicious.

Ordered the peach margarita in the jug. Pretty good. Husband ordered a few shots of tequila to spike his drink a little more. I liked it as is. Nice buzz afterwards. We ordered the chicken quesadilla and spicy shrimp nachos. Substituted the cheese for the yellow nacho cheese on the nachos. One word amazing! Have to eat em pretty quick so the chips aren't as soggy but they were still good. Probably have light salsa on em next time too. You will not be disappointed

Very overpriced for the quality and presentation of the food. I got the spicy shrimp nacho that didn't have much shrimp on it. The spinach chips kinda killed the taste.. I also got the triple dip. The salsa taste like water tomato paste, and the chips were WAY over salted. The queso was super good though. If food tasted better I wouldn't mind the price at all. But I feel like I wasted calories on a less than mediocre meal

After going to the Henderson location with friends I couldn't wait to take my hubby when I heard they opened one by us Downtown!! The wait wasn't long but OMG to get a waiter over was! We sat there for a good 10-15 min before anyone came to take our drink order. They sat us by the door which was freezing. There were 3 homeless people who hung outside the place and one came in to ask for money and cigarettes!! We finally moved to the bar when no one was still coming over. We got street tacos which were good and the bartender was nice. But I definitely didn't want to have my date sitting at the bar top. I give 3 stars because the food was good. We haven't been back since though.

Amazing food!  Make sure you use the Check-in on Yelp for a free Margarita.  You will want another! The margarita choices are great.  The food was amazing.  The portions are huge.  My sister and I shared the nachos and got salsa and chips on the side simply for more chips WITHOUT cheese and yummy goodness.  We used them as a second layer.  Oh, the TEQUILA choices!!!

Vegan nachos oh my god!!!!!!! Can't believe how amazing these were! So many vegan options! So happy we found this place! My boyfriend had the vegan spicy burrito and that was delicious as well. Would definitely come back here if I am in Vegas again!

OMG, this place is a hidden jewel. If your ever in Las Vegas this place is a must ( trust me  on this ). Our sever "Jose" was so cool, he made us feel very comfortable and welcomed from the beginning. He was friendly, funny and very honest, he told us that if we check in on YELP that we get free house margaritas. And let me tell you that they were so delicious and tasty. I order the lobster and crab nachos and they were so good ( plenty of meat ) I would definitely recommend. My other family members had a variety of different foods and they all enjoyed it. We did not spend a whole lot of money on all of the food that we had, this is a plus because the strip in very expensive. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be back!! This review would have been a little longer and more detailed but I'm kinda intoxicated. Please give these guys a chance I promise you won't regret it

This is the second time I have been into this particular location, the first time back 2014. I noticed a nice sign voted best restaurant. Walked in just like the first time, sitting ourselves then waiting 10 minutes to get drinks and some chips. Finally we order and wait another 30 plus minutes for our food and waiting on drinks. The waiter was all over the place as if maybe he was busy but there were plenty of other waiters to help. I have been to the Henderson location and that one is amazing. I will never recommend this site to anyone. This PLACE BLOWS  such a waste of my money...  I am next to another couple where his wife just finished her meal and the waiter JUST brought out her husbands food and the waiter JON SPENT more time behind on his tables. This place is a joke.... A year ago I have them the benefit of the doubt... A year later same result.
Really good food. Good service. Small proportions for a hefty price. Ordered the filet mignon nachos.

The atmosphere is amazing here the food was delicious but what blew my mind was the fantastic customer service I got from our waiter it was my 21st birthday and jovanny was super friendly, amazing, and just a great server over all I will definitely be back

Shot out to Rebecca our server/bartender for being great. Enjoyed some "naked" buffalo wings that were delicious, and washed them down with $4  16oz Dos Equis lager beer (happy hour 3-6 M-F) Also tried the bbq chicken mini nachos on the happy hour menu, which were great. Definitely a chill spot with good food and drinks, and on top of all that, they had the BEST playlist with 80s, 90s, and today's top hits to keep everyone happy.

Came here for my birthday dinner - food was great! Portion sizes are generous, I split my order with my husband and still had leftovers. They even brought out dessert nachos with a candle - love it! Would definetly recommend.

I was shopping around yelp for Mexican restaurants when I found nacho daddy. I saw some of the reviews talked about a free marg for a check in, so I was sold. All you have to do is show them that you checked in and you get a free margarita on the rocks! It was served in a Ball jar and was one of the best margs I've had. 

I wasn't very hungry, so I just ordered the trio of guac, queso, and salsa. The queso was sooo good. I also am a baby when it comes to spice and I could eat the medium salsa just fine. Guac is ok and kinda bland, but if you mix it with the cheese it's better.
Great food and great service! The house margarita is delicious! We had the nachos, the shrimp, the daddy's wings, and the quesadilla and YUM to EVERYTHING!!!! I will definitely be back again!!!!!

Back here again. With another friend who haven't try this place and wanted mexican food. So we got here and got to be seated in the same table as last time. I ordered my same drink Coke soda, but instead get the spicy grilled wings we got the triple dip it comes with queso, salsa & gaucamole. The slasa was hot tasting but it really wasn't all that hot. The quseo was runny cheese but flavorful but I dont like the gaucamole so my bf and friends ate it.

Our waitress was nice got our drinks and friendly with us. I wanted to get different nachos this time. So I got the chicken enchilada nachos. I love enchiladas so I wanted to try as nachos again it comes avocado I don't like avocados so I got extra sour cream. My bf got supreme tostada nachos. I really like my chicken enchilada nachos the refried beans, cheese, red sauce and jalapenos really great. My boyfriend like his supreme toastda nachos. 

Another great time being here at Nacho Daddy. Nice place to chill, drink, & eat nachos. Will recommend this place to people who will be in Vegas near Fremont Street.

I live about a block or two from this location and love coming here for their happy hour. It's on their website for Monday - Saturday from 3-6 pm. I bring some friends with me today and then we wait for 10 minutes for a single waiter or waitress to come get out drink order. When she finally comes to the table we ask for the Happy Hour menu and she informs us that they stopped doing happy hour on weekends. When I told her that it is still on the website her response was "oh well."  Sad to say, but Nacho Daddy has lost my business for not honoring their own advertising and consistent poor service.

We went a while back and I wasn't sure what to say about our experience. While the food was good it wasn't worth the trouble. 
We came up to check in and were quoted a 50 minute wait. No biggie...from all of the great things my husband had read we figured it would be worth the wait. My husband had literally been talking about Nacho Daddy before we even got to Las Vegas. 
Shortly after we checked in a flood of people also checked in. Really. So. Many. People. Multiple small and large parties. Great I thought! It's going to be AMAZING!
40 minutes goes by and I'm pretty annoyed because ALL those people were sat before us. But whatever we were quoted 50 minutes. Then 50 minutes goes by.. an hour.. so we check in again with the hostess. She informed us that she was waiting for a larger table to seat us since we needed a high chair. Okay fine. We finally get seated an hour and a half after we checked in and we were seated at two tables pushed together. One table so wobbly they had to overlap it with the other table to sort of stabilize it but it would slowly inch apart and be wobbly again. The hostess said the manager would be over to fix it. He or she never showed. I was literally seated between the two tables and couldn't even keep my plate level. 
We waited a good while before a waiter and a trainee come to ask about what we'd like to drink. We order drinks and appetizers and then wait even longer to order food than we did to order drinks.  Our queso came out wrong (we asked for the toppings on the side) so it had to be remade. 
The food eventually came and it was good but didn't really satisfy us after such a sour customer service experience. 
Then it took forever to get a check and leave.  
Overall I wouldn't go back.

Everything we had was good, even the guacamole, which is rare for even authentic Mexican restaurants. I got the tostada nachos with no meat and they were delicious. If you're vegan, they have a whole page of delicious options so definitely give it a try. My bf got the smothered burrito with filet mignon and green enchilada sauce and he said it was also very good. By far my FAVORITE thing we had was the queso! I scraped the bowl just to get one more chip full out of it. Best queso I have ever had. We will be back!

What an experience, this place is great ! Incredible food great wait staff comfortable atmosphere definitely going to make this a regular spot.  Special shout out to Mark M. for providing such great service.
Jovanny was awesome from start to finish!! Thank you!! Great atmosphere and the best salsa ever!!

Located near Fremont Street, Nacho Daddy is a good way to get away from the madness. I stopped by here on a whim for a weekday lunch and was glad I did! They have plenty of healthy options, which can easily be evened out with their delicious queso. (I can never say "no" to queso!) Anyway, the tacos are HUGE and come on homemade thick tortillas that are to die for. We ordered 2 and couldn't finish them. My entree was the kale salad and it was also delicious! Lots of different flavors mingle to create a healthy and fresh lunch. 
Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get your free house marg. It was pretty good!
Best nachos ever! Only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the service was not good! Great food and atmosphere tho!
Aerrick was the bomb, full of energy and fast with a smile. Food was delicious, Margarita were made very well, I will come back next time I am in town.

My husband and I came to downtown for our 1 year anniversary. Id heard great things about this place and told my husband I wanted to try it. We came in today around 2 in the afternoon, it wasn't too busy and we sat at the bar. I don't know the bartenders name but she was a young woman with red hair passed by us multiple times not taking our order. One time to ask for ids then walked away. A few times after that finally asked what we wanted and when my husband ordered a dos Equis she said sorry it's frozen and walked away. Another 5-10 min passed by and she didn't come back to us until we started walking out of the restaurant pretty annoyed that we had been there for 25 min and didn't even get a drink order in. The service is terrible. I can't comment on the food or drinks due to the fact we never got to order anything.

Great place to stop in for happy hour! I originally found out about it because they are known for their scorpion shot (a tequila shot with a scorpion inside the glass). I decided against it and instead ordered a margarita. Very refreshing and "paired" nicely with my queso dip and tacos.

Whose your daddy?! Nacho Daddy! We walked over not expecting a dim, bar like atmosphere of a restaurant. Our server was super friendly! He seemed like he was the only waiter but he worked the room well. Hubby and I ordered chips and salsa, the naked grilled wings with BBQ sauce, and the trio street tacos: crab and lobster, shrimp, and the pork.

Pretty much everything was spicy - so we kept drinking water. The waiter couldn't refill our drinks fast enough - not his fault, but the food was delicious!!! I highly recommend the lobster & crab and the shrimp street taco. I wasn't expecting it to be so good, but it was. Our check arrived and it was less than $25- not bad at all. 

Loved the atmosphere and vibe, the food, service and prices - I definitely recommend visiting if you are in the area!

My group was hanging out on Fremont Street and people were hangry. So hangry in fact, that after attempting to find a place to accommodate 10 people, most of the group headed back to the hotel.

That left 4 of us to get something to stuff our faces with. We went with Nacho Daddy which turned out to be an awesome decision.

It was not crowded at all on a Monday night, so we were sat quickly and placed our appetizer and drink order. We went with the pulled pork BBQ nachos, which turned out to be phenomenal. The pork was good (not the best I've had but this ain't dixieland), but the sauce and queso made this spectacular. Their BBQ sauce was very tangy, with just enough sweet and a little kick at the back end. The white queso was interestingly underneath the pile of chips and toppings but it works well as it keeps the slimy chip situation to a minimum.

Our margaritas took a while to obtain but were good. Mine was the house rita, which was a tad sweet but mixed strong enough and with fresh lime juice.

Everyone at the table ordered various iterations of Gringo and Street Tacos. I personally got the steak filet ones which were great. I would have preferred shredded cheese to queso, but it turned out ok. Others in my party were really impressed with the shredded pork tacos. Refried beans were on point as well. The Spanish rice was unimpressive, it was a bit overcooked but had the right flavor.

The only reason I gave this only 4 stars was because the bar was a little too slow in getting drinks out. Our server was awesome! We were given great recommendations and he took a few pictures of our group since we learned he's a serious photographer!

Should we find ourselves hangry or even hungry on Fremont Street again, this place will be in the short list for sure!

Came in super late after a night of drinking. I was really surprised by the service. The bartender was nice and attentive. We got the fillet Mignon nachos and it wasn't was I expected. It was more like fillet mignon chili nachos... not my thing at all. But it wasn't bad
Went for lunch with hubby real authentic Mexican food!  Nachos were the best ever!Combined with a cold beer it was excellent!

We had high expectations for this place and was a little disappointed. We waited 15 minutes for waiter to find our table . We paid $20 for not so good nachos. They were not bad but not worth the money. The restaurant was dirty. The floors and tables were sticky. The service was poor and that's being kind. So after drinks and the nachos we were over $50 definitely not worth it. So many better options. I would say skip this place.

Krystal was our bartender today. She was very nice and made me a michelada that I greatly needed. The Golden Knight Nachos are delicious- nice place to chill out near Fremont Street. Well definitely stop by again.

We walked in intending to spend whatever we wanted. It was late at night.. 11:30 PM. We walked into the bar with a group of 5 and the girl behind the bar (for a place that is open until 3AM) was acting like a rude you-know-what. I have been a faithful customer at Nacho Daddy for years and this was really disappointing. Because of this bartender alone, I and my friends will not attend this establishment. She worked at least from 11:30 to midnight tonight (11/25) pm, because someone in our group had to use the restroom, this bartender felt the need to attack us as we walked in the door. We will explain to our friends that this bartender alone is the reason that no one should feel welcome to this establishment. After an attempted explanation of our friend going to the bathroom, we were attacked and criticized for using the establishment for that reason and immediately left.  We will recommend to our friends and relatives that the location in Henderson is the more welcome location in town.

I love the food here. You have to order the cheeseburger Nachos, they are amazing. 

It's a great little set up in down town last Vegas. Great place for a drink & food.

This place was packed when we got there and we had a table of 15. They couldn't seat us all together, but we didn't mind. The wait was an hour and 45 minutes, but ended up being less than an hour. Several people had put their name in for tables, but then weren't there when their table was called - awesome for us! The margaritas were great and if you check in with the Yelp App you get a free one with an entree purchase! They were very fresh! We ordered the bottomless chips (chips were still warm) and salsa. We ended up getting all the sauces, but I steered clear of the hot bc of the amount of sliced jalapeños in it. If you're in to heat you might like it. The medium had enough kick for me. Someone also ordered the lobster and crab nachos. I'm not a seafood fan, but they were good! Their queso is awesome! I ended up getting the Signature Soft tacos - one pork and one chicken. I could only eat one! Tortillas were fresh too. Huge portions, but extremely delicious and decent prices too for Vegas and really anywhere. Other people got enchiladas and loved them. Someone else in our group got fajitas and they lit them on fire at the table - super cool. Overall awesome experience and excellent food. I would definitely go back!

Good place, right in the center of downtown.  Large portions, nachos were great. Gets crowded so try to make reservation.  Service was good and menu is large - all you traditional Mexican food.  I did not try the scorpion shot. 

A good choice for larger group, not a romantic dinner.   

I recommend, you will not be disappointed.
Chicken tacos are average, but the nachos are pretty tasty.

I had high expectations coming here because I heard about them on the morning blend. I was highly satisfied with the food and service. We got the nachos as an appetizer it was a perfect Mexican American blend of taste! The burger my boyfriend got was good as well as my enchiladas,  although I preferred the red sauce over the green, it had more flavor. Overall great place. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to get full!

Since we were in the area, my friend and I decided to eat here again. This time I tried the Chicken Enchilada Nachos. They sounded like they would be tasty from the menu description. My expectation was that the chicken would be shredded, since that's how it always is in enchiladas. Instead, there were little cubes of dried out chicken. I expected some enchilada sauce to be mixed in with the chicken, but instead the nachos were a wet, greasy mess. Enchilada sauce had been dumped over all of the chips. I ate about a quarter of the food. That was all I could stomach. I ended up having a "sour" stomach for nearly three hours after the meal.

My friend had what she always has - the Big Daddy burrito. She loves it. When it came, it was obviously smaller than what it had been in the past. She stated that they must have changed the recipe because it just didn't taste the same. In the past, they always had brought a small plate with sour cream and lettuce on it, too. She asked to speak to the manager who came over after we had completed the meal.

The manager insisted that there hadn't been any change to the recipe and that the burrito had never come with the small plate of lettuce and sour cream. She seemed uninterested in inquiring why most of my food was still on the plate. Eating here really seems to be a crap shoot.

We were highly disappointed in this establishment, especially after pointing at it all week and thinking that it might be a cool spot to have dinner.  Sigh, more fools us.

We came in on St. Patrick's night and the place was quieter than every other restaurant on the Fremont Street Experience, which should have been our first warning.  We ordered a pitcher of White Peach margaritas and the "average burger" nachos for me, Daddy's Supreme chicken taco for him.  Then we waited patiently, expecting the drinks to come out first.

No such luck - here comes the food.  I look over at my husband's plate and see this really sad-looking taco shell with a bunch of filling in it.  There was more plate than food, and I had a nasty feeling that the rest of the experience wasn't going to be much better than this.  My nachos, at least, had some substance.  But... they were just okay, not great.  The cheese sauce tasted like reheated Cheez Whiz, there was no bacon whatsoever to be found, and the onions were minced so finely that they just disintegrated the moment they touched my tongue.  I was bitterly disappointed.  

To make matters worse, the margaritas came when we were nearly done with our food.  Bad, bad timing.  We were pretty much ready to pack up and leave by that point.

Once the drinks came, the experience was slightly better - but, hey, I got drunk.  If it takes getting me drunk to improve things... (and my husband will tell you that he has never seen me tie one on like that, ever)

Final insult:  the bill was 53 dollars, making it the most expensive meal we had in Vegas over the course of a week.  It wasn't close to being worth that.  My husband honestly didn't want to leave a tip at all, but I convinced him otherwise.  

It never did get any busier while we were there.  I see why it didn't now.

The only reason why 2 stars - the food was edible and the drinks packed a punch.  But that's it. Servers were polite but in the end did nothing to improve our experience here.

Not recommended.

Started with house magaritas and queso which is a combo to be reckoned with.
Rico was our server he made a few suggestions but we had our minds set.
Wife ordered quesadilla and daughter ordered enchiladas and I had american tacos.  My wife and daughter ended up swapping entrees after their first bites.
I wasn't too particular for the seasoning on my beef tacos kinda reminded me of taco bells beef.  I decided to finish my daughters quesadilla and tackle the tacos later.
Overall experience was great the chips were homemade and were awesome with the queso and the side of refried beans served with our entrees. Our server was attentive to our wants and needs and offered great hospitable customer service.

Came to this place specifically for the scorpion shots. And of course. They were OUT OF SCORPIONS. I was so disappointed that we traveled all the way downtown just to be told we couldn't get what I wanted. Oh well, we ordered food anyway.

The food itself was pretty good. My cheesy nachos had delicious queso, though it was lacking the amount of jalapenos we would have liked. We asked for a side of them extra. But, our server/bartender forgot and we had to ask again 15 minutes later.

My boyfriend also ordered one of the burritos. He really liked it, and it was a generous size. He gobbled it all down. I didn't try it myself, but I trust his judgement.

We also had to ask for refills for our water, which was challenging because she spent most of her time talking to a couple and group on opposite sides of the bar.

I'm pretty set on trying these scorpion shots. But next time I will call first.

EDIT:

Just added another star to this review because I was immediately contacted by the restaurant owner to apologize for my experience. I was offered a comp and to be contacted when scorpions come in. I'm very impressed. And I am hoping very much that I can give them another try when I come back to Vegas next year! :)

EDIT AGAIN: Bartender just contacted me to apologize to me too. Seriously, this place is wowing me with their customer service. I just have to give another star. I'm going to be back next year and will definitely come here.

The wait was a little longer than I expected but the food was delicious I had the lobster and Crab Nachos and they were soooo good! I checked in on yelp and got a free house margarita. Our waiter was Jonathan and he was good and fast! Defiantly coming back, just not on a weekend.
We love this place!  Whenever in Vegas, Nacho Daddy is a must.   The drinks are good, the food is good and the atmosphere is good!

I had breakfast here this morning and I didn't want to have a large breakfast.  I ordered the Anaheim taco which consists of Anaheim chilies, sour cream, sautéed onions, a blend of three cheeses, a slice of avocado all placed on a taco with scrambled egg.

The taco was not a flour one.  It was more like a pastry crust rather than a flour tortilla, but it was very good.  The menu says that all breakfast tacos are served with potatoes or refried beans and rice.  I was offered neither.  I did have a choice of mild, medium, or hot for the salsa and I chose hot.  It's mildly hot if that's not an oxymoron.
Breakfast was good and the server refilled my coffee when he saw I was getting low.

This place just opened a month ago and they're still doing work on it.  This morning, they were installing a garage door in the bar area that can be raised in good weather and serve from a counter on which the door rested today.

Part of the fun of eating here today was watching my server change the Coke cartridges.  The syrup now comes in super concentrated containers that look like copy machine cartridges and it was interesting watching him switch out two of the cartridges. The change in technology was interesting.

I parked underground in the Neonopolis garage and there was no charge.  I don't know if it's because of the time of day or that I was there less than an hour, but this is the second time that the cashier at the pay station just wished me a good day and opened the gate.

Nacho Daddy is worth a return visit when they get the kinks worked out. And gentlemen, aim for a field goal!
erica is super sweet and awesome! I love how down to earth she is and her service is amazing!! i loved her! the food was great and the atmosphere is super relaxed. will definitely be coming back:)

We are return costumers- this time we brought along 6 friends- they haven't stop raving about how delicious the breakfast style nachos were...Bingo!
Love that Nacho Daddy is local and within a short walk of many of the downtown hotels.
 Really, if folks are looking for a quick -in and out type meal- may not be your place- this place allows you the time to enjoy your meal and mostly the company you are with,  This is what we dig about Nacho Daddy- 
 This time we jumped into the Photo booth- breakfast and photo booth - great combination! starts your day off right--
we will return..
 Only bummer about our visit this time- Bartender wasn't in yet.. just missed my morning Bloody Mary...
Absolutely love nacho daddy! Where the service and food are always great! I'm so grateful for the free margaritas too! Lol I'm so ready to eat some chicken nachos!!!

It was our  last night in Vegas and we were looking for a place to have dinner on the strip. So I used my Yelp app to find this restaurant and noticed that it was on the Food Network. This place has a great atmosphere good for watching sporting events they have huge TV screens. A great drink selection and even food and appetizers. They're known for their shots that have a scorpion on the bottom of the glass I didn't try that because I was too scared. I'm giving five stars for the food not really for the service that could have been better. Maybe it was kind of busy but our server hard we came to our table and if you have to request something it took a long time. If you use your check in on yelp you get a free house Margarita so don't forget to check in. This is a good place if you want to get some Mexican food. Have a few drinks and watch the game. I wish they had one of these in Hawaii maybe one day they will ,they also have a really good happy hour if you go to the nacho daddy near downtown the prices are actually cheaper just the tip. So next time in Vegas check them out.

Open late. GREAT bar food and excellent mixed drinks. As someone who is vegan and gluten free, it's nice to have a latenight option. The staff is always super friendly. The Vegan Nachos are really good...

Visited Tuesday to grab some lunch to-go.  I've visited before, back in August and had their delicious vegan loaded nachos, so this time I tried the vegan chik'n quesadilla.  It comes with guac, sour cream, and pico. They put the same cheese sauce from the nachos in the quesadilla, so that's a nice change from traditional vegan cheese. For the cost, $12+, it could have included a couple more triangles instead of 4, but it was satiating at least.  I will return again, but will most likely just order the nachos again, because you get more for your money with that dish.
Had to eat here twice this month the food is not only delicious but the service by Eric and Alex was exceptional!!!
Excellent open air bar near Fremont! Reminds me a lot of Austin and the food is excellent.

So came back for a second chance .....cause I always do...we all have a bad night. .....got their special for the night and was almost non edible. Tuesday Nacho Extreme or something.  Again staff was great but whoever is working the menu and recipes should be fired.  Corporate gone amuck.... there's nothing here but really good folks trying to make a bad restaurant good. Sry.
Can't beat a free margarita by checking in on Yelp!  Food was good, the filet mignon nachos were awesome.  Good food, good vibes.
Like Mexican comfort food!  Did not expect such awesome Mexican half a block from Fremont street!

My friends and I came with a rather large group, but our waiter was very accommodating and helped us all out by seating everyone within each other's area so it helped socializing amongst our friends a lot easier.

We ordered 3 pitchers of margarita and 4-5 nachos to share with our table of about 7-8 girls. The seafood nachos were a little spicy, but it was SO BOMB. It might be my favorite one from all of the nachos that we ordered. There's something about the sauce with the lobster that just satisfied my nacho cravings. Another one of my favorites was the pulled pork nachos... love that they don't skimp on the meat! 

I typically don't love Mexican food, but I'm digging this place!
Pretty much the best nachos I've ever had! Great place to stop for lunch near Fremont St.

Great great nachos! They are huge, definitely able to share with someone. Great vegan options and the waiters are pretty nice. The filet mignon nachos had a lot of meat, which was pleasing. Great stuff!

Food was good and fairly priced. I'm gluten & dairy free and they made it super easy to order since their regular menu showed what was gluten free and/or vegan. Just be careful that you state you want gluten free chips with your salsa or guacamole. My friend forgot to specify and I had a reaction (luckily it's just an intolerance for me).
Great food,great service,great atmosphere! Great selection! Wings Where GOOD AND THE Nachos Where huge! Kids eat free on Mondays!

This experience wasn't bad, but it definitely could have been better.

My wife and I were going to a concert nearby and wanted to grab a bite to eat before the show. She was in the mood for nachos, so coming here was a no-brainer. 

Upon entering, we were thrown off by having to seat ourselves. It was kind of packed, so finding a table in the back took a minute. There was a large party in the center that seemed to be taking up everyone's attention, so it was about 5 minutes before we even got menus and another 5 before we got to speak with our server.  Fortunately, that gave us time to decide what we wanted to order, so we ordered as soon as he arrived. 

It took nearly 45 minutes to get our food, but again, that was due to the large party in the center. The food was fresh when it arrived, but was mediocre at best.

 Her nachos were over-saturated with this extremely spicy salsa. The amount of cheese on the nachos gave the impression that ANY cheese on there was merely an accident. It was primarily a plate of chips and salsa, garnished with chicken and a few vegetables. 

 I ordered the fish and chips. The fish was amazing. The fries were great while they were piping hot. However, as soon as they cooled down, they became hard as a rock and hazardous to my health. I couldn't finish even half of them (and there weren't a lot to begin with).

 The part that gives this experience 3 stars (and not 1 or 2, as the food was quite a disappointment) was the service. Our server was Danny, and the little amount of service the party in the center allowed him to give us was excellent. 

Overall, it was a decent experience. Not one I intend to repeat any time soon, though.

Cool little spot downtown Vegas! 

We stopped in for lunch on a Monday. Wasn't busy at all. We were greeted & seated right away.

We ordered Nachos of course! They were served with colorful chips. The nachos were a good choice!

Our waiter was super friendly & attentive. He came back often to make sure we were good. 
 
I enjoyed the chill laidback environment. I also enjoyed the prompt service we received. If I'm ever in the area I would for sure stop by again! 

Food was reasonably priced. 

Cool side note. We got to see someone take a scorpion shot while we were dining!

We visited here recently and enjoyed the nacho plate. The vegan cheese is delicious. Our server was terrific. The kitchen was a bit overwhelmed but she was able to handle the tables and keep everything running smoothly. Even though the food took a bit longer than expected she got us some chips to tide us over which we appreciated. 
The place is warm and welcoming and the menu is diverse so both vegan and carnivores can be satisfied.

Nacho Daddy is exactly what I expected from the name and location: Overpriced pseudo-Mexican food. 

I dined here with 3 other adults and one baby on a Sunday evening. The dining area was pretty busy, we were told to seat ourselves at the only available table and a server came over fairly quickly to inquire if a highchair was needed (it was). 

We started out by ordering drinks, I had a moscow mule which was served in a silver mug (I should dock Nacho Daddy one star just for that BS). For an appetizer, we got the triple dip which is queso dip, guacamole and salsa. The guacamole was chunky and looked great but lacked seasoning, and queso dip came with sliced jalapenos in it however no heat could be detected by anyone in our group, which became the standard for our evening. 

My husband got a combo which was a 1/2 a sandwich and a bowl of the ghost pepper chili. My brother in law had the ghost pepper chili nachos. Both commented on the lack of heat in their meals. The shrimp bowl I had was fine, as was the quesadilla that my sister in law had. Nothing was exceptional though. 

For me there are too many good places to dine downtown for me to go back to a place that was 'just okay' anytime soon. Sorry Nacho Daddy, you just didn't do it for me.

My husband and I here for a quick bite to eat upon arriving to our hotel on Fremont Street. We split a Fiesta Nacho which was fantastic and filling for two people. It was super busy so service was not the greatest. We would go back though!

I had the PLEASURE of finding this restaurant (after searching Yelp) while in town for the NASCAR race. Not much to say because I start drooling if I think about it too long. The food was amazing. The staff was awesome. The decor and atmosphere was very comfortable and entertaining.

Nacho Daddy really needs to expand to other parts of the Las Vegas Strip because it is now the only reason I would go to Fremont Street but I definitely will go again every time I am in town.
It is pretty good.  I think the nachos selection is great.  I didn't try any drinks really but they did look tasty.

Wow.  I had the best vegan nachos ever. Like ever.  And ive had em all over thr country for the past twenty years.  Flavorful delicious.  Ugly green chips but who cares.  So fukkn good.  Miserable server did a shot with us then charged us for her shot.  Then didn't come to pick up the check. Left a zero tip for the first time in three years.
Tried the vegan chicken nachos and they were amazing! Nice little hidden gem downtown

Exciting environment filled with joy and possibility. Love coming downtown because of this spot.

Get the dip trio

Vegetarian choices my girlfriend loved

If your feeling daring get the scorpion shot on $20!
Rick was an awesome server and Justin rocks!   Best service and nachos ever.  The filet mignon nachos were piled up high,  wings were good too.   Highly recommend this for all your nacho needs.

This place is great it's right off Fremont and centrally located. All the staff is super friendly. When I was in they were super busy but still had great service. I will definitely be back for happy hour. I had their chicken burrito and it was great. They also only charge a dollar to add guacamole and I'm pretty sure that you can't find that anywhere anymore especially not in Vegas. They have a deal if you check in on yelp then they give you a margarita with the purchase of an entree, they even do it on to go orders. The only downside is my food was ready before my margarita. I will be back again.

A friend was celebrating her birthday and chose this new Nacho Daddy location for dinner. I was so excited because I had been to the location in Henderson and always had good food andxservice.

I was a little disappointed as the downtown location is much smaller and the decor is super urban. There is a small seating area of 2-4 person tables (about 10) and a wall that seperates the bar area with counter height seating. It fits the downtown scene but I don't find that seperation comfortable. 

The menu is not the same as what's online or what is at the Henderson location. This menu has less items which was disappointing because I was raving to all of my friends about their delicious quesadillas and it wasn't there. We were also told by the staff that there were items available at the bar were not available on the menu. In the end we got our quesadillas but it was confusing. 

Our party was about 13 people and the servers were very good at getting our food and drinks without too long of a wait. I had the burger nachos which was delicious and a raspberry margarita which was a little too sweet but good. My boyfriend had steak fajitas and a skinny margarita and was very satisfied. We ordered the smore's nachos for dessert and that was epic! I recommend it to anyone who loves marshmallows and chocolate. 

It was a really good meal and I would go again now that I know what to expect.

I watched March Madness at the bar in this place which has 8 TVs facing 4 different directions around the bar and it was a good environment to do just that. An okay amount of drinks options and some great menu options as well.

I came here for their happy hour (3pm-6pm). I wasn't a fan of their drinks. The House margarita had way too much sour mix, and the strawberry margarita was too flat. I did try their happy hour food menu and the sliders were AMAZING, and the tacos were average. The service from the bartender was EXCEPTIONAL and she's a real sweetheart.
Horrible food, dry burritos with no sauce/salsa, slow service took about 40 -45 mins to get our food and there was only a handful of people ,and on top of that it's overpriced

I love this place.

The atmosphere is super chill, the staff is attentive and friendly. My favorite is the hostess Kylie, she's so sweet. 

I had the four cheese nachos and two micheladas. Both were so flavorful, so delicious. 

The only thing I don't like about this place is that there isn't one in California.
Awesome vegan menu (nachos, quesadilla, burrito, tacos, quest dip, guacamole and more) and super friendly staff! Plus the bar has a good selection of beers on draft.
Had breakfast here and the first one was amazing!!! Jay the night manager was working the morning shift and he was awesome
Say yes to the nachos. They are incredible! The food isn't super healthy but it is delicious.

Went to eat here today and the hostesses looked at each other and said it was an hour wait yet it looked empty inside. They claimed that there was 2 parties coming that would take up all the tables. I felt very suspicious as if they were lying so I called nacho daddy and asked if there was a wait. The man said there was no wait. Then I explained the story and he said let me find out. The manager "Kelly" gets on the phone and says yes there's an hour wait because you have a minor with you. That was never said by the hostesses. The manager never said there was a big party coming in either. Not really sure why the manager would lie but never coming here again.
Nothing too much to write on just wanted to stop in and do the scorpion shot. The bartender was very polite and courteous
The place is very cool. The nacho were yummy and the beers were cold. Would go back for sure.

Located right off busy Fremont Street, Nacho Daddy gives the feel of a dive bar right off an otherwise crowded street party. You may have to wait a few minutes for a table, or if you're like us, score a couple seats at the open bar. Bartender is attentive and gave great service. We had the nachos supreme (I mean, c'mon, who goes to 'Nacho' Daddy but doesn't have nachos??). They were PHENOMENAL. I'd go back just for those. The margaritas were great, made fresh, not premixed. Grab one to go when you're ready to head out!

excellent service all around espcially from brirtany she's the bomb best service and food I've had in a long time, highly recommended will be back for sure great quest and great Michelads.  highly recommend it

Great breakfast.  A little dark inside for a morning breakfast but well worth it.  The pancake topped with churro pieces and presented in a skillet was fantastic.  Very unique and delicious No syrup needed.  Also the coffee was fantastic for some reason, best coffee I had in a long time.

First time trying this place and I am glad I did! Plus I checked in on yelp and got a FREE margarita They have delicious food and drinks! Giovanni our waiter was awesome...he was friendly and attentive. The wait time was just right!

Oh Mr Nacho Daddy, you please me every time.  Friendly staff, good food and good libations.  If your feeling darning a must try is the scorpion shot.  I took mine with the scorpion on top and chewed it first, yeah I was feeling crazy.  I found the scorpion salty and earthy tasting, lol.  Sure it's just a gimmick, but its fun, especially when they announce it and start ringing the bell.  Fun atmosphere.  I'm not a tequila expert, but they have so many different types it's amazing, if your into tequila this place is a must stop.  Always a favorite when I'm downtown.     
Everything comes down to the right combination.  You have to have the right food, beverages and most importantly service. I'd like to add a shout out to Tara, she made the whole experience.  Great service and funny.  I'd love to share what we joked about, but we need to keep this pg people.   Awesome service Thanks Tara.

Definitely a yummy place for quick eats. I grabbed the barbacoa pork street tacos. Now I rarely eat pork but by all means we're these tacos worth it. You can get chicken or shrimp or steak too. 

They specialize in the nachos duh- and I did see plenty a plate towering with dem nachos. However idk if I want a plate of cholesterol with a side of high blood pressure and diabetes. They surely looked good and definitely smelled good. 

The staff is very personable and service was quick. Not bad for a full restaurant and a Sat night. 

There's also several margaritas and tequilas to choose from. I eyed out getting either a guava margarita or a blood orange or the Thai basil one. But I copped out and got a Moscow mule as I was craving some ginger beer. It was good as well. 

So yes I would def recommend this place and yes I def can see me coming back. Nacho Daddy be my daddy.
I was looking for the mom pop Mexican across from the Cortez (guess it went out of business).  This place was pricey and the tacos were mediocre

Neat little joint, fresh food, incredible service, BLAH BLAH BLAH

Yeah yeah, you get the point.

Come here for one of their special margaritas. When it says they are hand crafted, I absolutely shit you not they are COMPLETELY TOTALLY ABSOLUTELY ONE HUNDRED PERCENT HAND FREAKING CRAFTED. Total love and care go into each special glass, in addition to decent mixed-drink tequila and house-made mixers. And they are super delicious! Totally worth the price you pay. Even the simple house margarita blows all others out of the water, by far.

Our bartender was a god among men. He never EVER stopped working -- from fulfilling table orders, to bussing areas, to restocking and cleaning the bar area, to serving our awesome drinks. Just a stud.

Yes, btw, I did the Scorpion Shot for a discounted t-shirt. LOL and managed to crack myself up scaring a few out-of-towners in the process.

OOT: Did you do that scorpion thing?
me: I sure did! I think I've got a good two, maybe three hours before the venom kicks in though, so I feel great!
Server was polite and nice. However, the nachos were not good. They were cold and soggy. Had higher expectations.
The BBQ chicken Nachos were fabulous.  So much flavor and so much food. The filet nachos were to die for. These are differently not you ball park nachos. Must do in Vegas.
Hostess took care of me for a to go order, nachos where very good but I think they are a pinch over priced. But it's Vegas.

This was a little hidden gem downtown Las Vegas. 
   We ordered a few of the happy hour items and an entree. The food here was delicious street tacos might be my new favorites. The shredded chicken BBQ nachos were a hit. So we also ordered the shredded chicken street tacos I really enjoyed those as well. 
    Sometimes when you order shredded chicken from Mexican restaurants it's a little to mushy but this was cooked perfectly. 
   Dh ordered the filet street tacos and finished the whole plate. 
    This little gem had a yelp check in for a free margarita but didn't use it. I prefer strawberry and it was for a regular margarita.  We happen to be here during happy hour so margaritas were 5 bucks. 
    Big thumbs up and I would definitely return.

Absolutely loved the vegan nachos and the vegan street tacos! Also had a decent selection of draft beers. I will be back a lot. Atmosphere was okay but the bartender was really nice and let us sample new beers before we settled on one.

The food was really good, decently priced, also have vegan options or can modify for healthier options (quinoa for rice). The drinks were nice and good price options for groups. Fun atmosphere. They had this weird scorpion shot you can take. But the service was VERY slow.

Stop 2 on the Holiday Progressive dinner tour: *stop one below at Double Helix* 

Criteria for the Progressive Dinner was 6 people 3 "couples" - 3 different restaurants/bars in 3 different areas of Vegas. Total bill for all 3 not to exceed 600.00 total or 200.00/couple. 

All 6 of us have been to & loved the Henderson location so when Nacho Daddy opened in the DTLV it was our 1st choice to go to for dinner. 

We arrived still a bit sated and slightly tipsy from our last stop. *not to worry we who live in Vegas make sure not to drink & drive* 

When we arrived *slightly late but we called* they had our table all ready & waiting. Our server was Chris who was amazing at keeping our glasses full. 
We started with a round of Lambics - just to clear the palate. 
Followed by a pitcher of perfect Margaritas. Normally not the best idea because for some reason in other places we've found that the pitcher method loses some of the quality of the actual cocktail. Not in the case of the Big Daddy's. consistent tot he last drop. 

For food - we decided on 3 different types of nachos

Florentine: Chicken Spinach & asiago cheese. 
very light & different from the nachos we've had previously. Excellent choice for a vegetarian as they will make them - the chicken. By far my personal favorite. Kind of like a nice spinach dip with the chips already in. 

Thai Chicken:  not my personal favorite but everyone else loved them. Basically it was a nice pad thai on nacho chips and very SPICY. it was very flavorful but I was enthralled with the Florentine.

Fiesta Chicken Nachos: Closest to what is expected in a traditional American nachos amped up with the addition of the diablo sauce. One of the "boys" tried to lick the plate. 

Speaking of "boys" the urinal block is hysterical. yes I looked. 

We each had an order of corn on the cob & shared 2 bowls of the queso dip. 

Food:  consistent with the Henderson location. 
Service: Exceptional. Chris gets 5 ***** (for vegas, someone that attentive to a large party is very unusual) 
Fat Friendly:  All seats were armless so no hip issues. also spaced far enough apart that we didn't have to sit back to back with our neighbor. Maybe because it was a Tuesday night in off season, but there was ample room. Doubt that would be the case during Life is Beautiful or EDC. 
Ambiance: much more cosy & conducive to conversation than the Henderson location. 

Total bill including tip: $206.00 

It was a great choice & w've been back since and still consistent with the food & the services!

I was here with a friend in December.  We had a great meal.  I had the buffalo nachos and my buddy had a veggie burrito.  We shared chips and i had soda.


Our server Christin was fantastic.  She kept filling up our drinks and chips.  She recommended my item from the happy hour menu.  She was sweet and cute and just a great personality.

Our bill was $35 with tip which I thought was not bad given the quality of food and awesome service.  If you are concerned with prices, try the happy hour menu...my nachos (which were plenty big) were only $6

I'll be back!
Great food but it is a little busy and unorganized! Be prepared to stay for awhile waiting on your food but it is worth it!!

I'm a bit of a nacho snob and the Moco Loco breakfast nachos were amazing. It was a bit different than I'm used to, with the eggs and the brown gravy (I know! -- brown gravy on nachos -- WHAT?!) but it worked so well with the queso and ground beef. 

We sat at the bar (that's where the best service is anywhere) and the bartender was fast. She recommended the skinny marg when I told her I wanted something less sweet. The skinny was great -- just sweet enough with no fake sweeteners. 

Cool place on the inside. Perfectly located downtown.

Love this place. The options are great, they even have vegan meals, their margaritas are delicious also. If you're looking for a quite place this isn't it, but if you're looking for yummy food this is the spot.

After visiting First Friday for the time, my friends and I wanted to try a delicious restaurant close by. This eatery is located right off of Fremont street.
Upon arrival we were told that the wait would be thirty minutes but it was more like 15. 

With your yelp check in you receive a yummy free house margarita. 

We all order some type of nachos and they were all good. My favorite was the delicious queso dip. My daddy wings were a little small and too breaded for my taste but the nachos were delicious.

I recommend sticking to Nachos or something on the menu with a star by it.

This place has decent food but the speed of service is mind boggling. Came in for a quick bite with some friends. Drink order was taken after about 10 min. Drinks came almost 25 min later, food order taken 15 min after that. That's 40 min to order food. Food came 30 min later. check was dropped off and then we waited 20 min for someone to pick it up and run a card. Eventually we had to go to the bartender to run it. About to leave now, we have been here over 2 hours?  This is the 3rd bad experience I have had here, Never again.

Sorry, don't know what all the hype was about. I love nachos but there better be a pony in it for me to call you daddy. 

We got something that was fine and very yummy. Where you're not sure if it's that good or if you're that drunk. Either way it does the trick for sure and I'll give it to them that they're BIG. 

I guess I just find nachos hard to elevate. I love em the way they are. Kudos to them all if they are not trying to be anything more than a nacho stop meets watering hole. That's right on. 

And hey! There's vegetarian and vegan nachos (I like this). There's also margaritas and scorpion shots (I like this a lot) and more alcohol so you can have a lot of fun here. Go with an obnoxious group. It's not hipster! 

I'd definitely take a brood of children here, they'd demolish the plates. Me not so much. I stopped in the middle, at the cold part. But I do eat slow and I love downtown and nachos and I stumble in here enough to really enjoy and anticipate any inconsistency. It's sooo good drunk. 

Sad to see so many bad service reviews since our guy was super great. He kept the jalapeños coming. And they were chill about the add ons...been accommodating so far.

Came here for dinner with my wife after hearing good reviews from friends. The restaurant was very busy but we were seated immediately. Service was fast and friendly and the food was amazing. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Nachos and my wife had the veggie burrito.

The Buffalo Chicken Nachos were absolutely out of this world. I tried my wife's burrito, but I had already tasted the nachos, so I was definitely grading on the curve at that point. My wife loved the burrito, so overall it was a win-win.

Our server was very "on top of it" during our entire meal. Checking in on us to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. We even got a table-side visit from Anthony, the manager who wanted to make sure we were having a good time. 

Overall, it was a great dining experience. I left with a full, happy belly and have been dreaming of going back for more Buffalo Chicken Nachos for the last week.
Nice location in Downtown. Had buffalo chicken nachos and everything nachos . Enjoyed the atmosphere but the food was just ok. For Nachos

Great food, friendly service and good atmosphere. We had dinner and some friends had breakfast and we were all impressed. Drinks were tasty too. Prices are about average for Fremont. The scorpion shots are a must try!

We were in Las Vegas last week and headed downtown to zip line. We came across Nacho Daddy and decided to have lunch, so glad we did!!! This place is great!!!!  Jalapeño marg was fantastic AND you can get a free house marg with Yelp check in!! I was watching plates pass by and everything looked amazing. I opted for the breaded fish tacos! BEST IVE EVER HAD!! 
Rico was our server and he was incredible!! 

Please bring one to Denver!!!
Food was great, drinks were great and service amazing. Kudos to Griffen, coolest server I've ever had

We've gone here several times for lunch and have ordered takeout as well. (We went to the original location in Henderson many times before this one, though; so imagine my excitement when there was one closer to home!) I must've forgotten to do a review on this place. This is one of my favorite places to get nachos, my favorite pig-out food. (I have a restricted diet monday through friday.) 

My favorite place to get nachos used to be Mickie Finnz but honestly, there is no other place to get nachos anymore. Out of the fifteen nacho types, we've tried about eight of them! Our favorite is "Nacho Average Burger Nacho."
