Doesn't look very big from the outside, but when you get inside, the bar is on the left side (probably bigger than the dining area), and the sit-down dining area is on the right side. The bathrooms are at the very back, right side. The counter (where to go for your takeout order) is to the right, front side, of the restaurant. Every server we've had has been very nice.  
Not much parking, but a couple spaces in front, if you're lucky, for the takeout order.

I have been here twice now, and both times the service has been more than stellar. Staff is friendly and very fast. Food is a great twist on original Mexican flare. Sports are always on TV so even if you just want to drink and watch some games it works!

These nachos are legit.. Our fav has been the Thai Chicken Nachos.. The Lobster Nachos are also yum.. Amazing queso too.. Service is a bit all over but they are always busy.. The food makes up for the wait.. Downtown location had better service!
poor service and food is nothing great. only nachos is good here. bar vibe so not really intended for kids. located in downtown
Service was amazing. Will definitely return! Nachos are amazing, definitely recommend the supreme tostada nachos. They are delicious!

Great food, a little expensive for nachos but they were good so I didn't mind paying.  We went to downtown location which was nice. Waitress and good and attentive she checked on us many times and made sure we were taken care of.

note: this review is in regards to the Nacho Daddy stand at Life is Beautiful 2015. Friendly attractive man serving nachos is really fundamental to good timez. Wish I could call him my nacho daddy. At the very end of the second night we came back to again exchange cold hard cash for hot crispy chips, we were told, "sorry, we're only have free chips and salsa now." How dare they.

Chips are quality. salsa is fresh and a little hot. vegan nacho options = ***** (5 stars, not a 5 letter word). That never happens. 

BUT they don't have beans? I don't eat meat but friend ordered gringo nachos and chicken nachos and both times said the meat was rubbery. no star for meat/lack of beans 

so **** overall. but high fives all around.

I'm a huge huge fan of Nacho Daddy's first location down on Eastern and was beyond stoked when I saw they opened one downtown. The new location definitely lived up to my expectations. The bartenders and servers were nothing but helpful. I was a little bummed that the nacho selection was missing some of my favorites (Enchilada Nachos), but overall the food was on point and the service was perfect. The girl with the treestar tattoo rocked!.

Yummo! There's a vegan section on the menu - not just a couple of options. The portions are large - plenty of food for my husband's healthy appetite. The omnivores we dined with were pleased as well. One requested non-spicy chicken tacos. Everything else has a kick. This is perfectly located right off of the Fremont Street Experience in downtown Las Vegas. This place will be on our lunch spot list every time we go to Vegas.

Very tasty food.  

I like to TASTE my food, not suffer for it, so if you want to know if it was spicy, not very. You can certainly have it be very spicy, but that is not my thing.

We went for an early dinner, so it wasn't crowded, but it did start to fill up by the time we left, mostly around the bar.

I had trio ground beef enchilada plate with rice and beans. The meat was good, no gristle and very flavorful without being greasy. There happened to be a photo of this in the menu, and for once it was an exact representation of what I got!  Overall it was a very tasty meal.  

The menu is large and varied for a Mexican place, and if you like Tequila you should come take a look at their liquor menu.

I would definitely go back.
Had a great experience!!! Guistina was really nice she was our waiter!! make sure that you guys come a take your scorpion shot!!!!!!

Slow service. Food is okay but totally oblivious if you sit outside. Happy hour specials are ok but we ordered 20 minutes before it ended and it was well after before we received it despite they were not busy at all.

Service at the bar is awful!  Two of us sat down and got a drink and ceviche.  The drinks were ok and the ceviche was good but small.  We finished the drinks and food and wanted more drinks, but when we tried to get the bartenders attention he completely ignored us.  Sat there for over 20 minutes without anyone coming to get another drink order.  We even pushed our empty glasses and plate in his direction and still ignored us.  Politely shouted over the music and raised our hand, still ignored.  Awful awful awful service but it wasn't just to us, three groups on our side of the bar all experienced the same thing.  Maybe the bartender just wanted to keep serving the dude who he fist pumped since he got two rounds before anyone came our way.

Full disclaimer: I was really under the influence so my memory may be a little hazy but at the same time, it wouldn't be fair if I gave it a 3 star if I can't remember everything. After wandering around old Vegas for the night we all got pretty hungry. 

We are in town for a bachelor party and had a party of about 12 guys. We were seated pretty quickly. To my recollection, our server was able to get everybody's drink order and brought them out fairly quickly. The margaritas here were a little on the sweet side. 

I do remember scarfing down our monster loaded nachos and moved on to my buddy's pulled pork nachos. We were in and out pretty quick. My brother in law grabbed the bill so we did not have to go through trying to split the bill with 12 guys.
Great atmosphere! Great food. Jovanny ROCKS! Very attentive and super friendly and down to earth.

What a gem! Came in this am around 10:37, and they were only serving breakfast. But our waitress asked the cook if lunch could be served and yes it could! Whew! 
I had the BBQ chicken nachos and it was delicious! Very generous portion but not monstrous! Service was great, food was great! This is a must spot!

Nacho Daddy should rule the world. There should be a Nacho Daddy in every town. Make this happen, Nacho Daddy! 

This place has it all! And it's obvious by the how busy is was on a Thursday at 3pm when we showed up for a late lunch. I was initially drawn in by the substantial vegan menu. Vegan queso is no joke and it is very hard to find. Like an Asian Crested Ibis, it is a rare bird. Guys... they have vegan queso! I rest my case (my case-o?).

But, don't worry, meat-eaters, they have plenty for you too! And a wide variety, I might add. My boyfriend ordered the Lobster and Crab Nachos that were served on a large sheet tray. Those bad boys were not messing around. 

The margaritas were lovely. The service was nice. And I really appreciate the garage-door style window that was opened to bring in some fresh air and allow us to people-watch the passersby. I can't wait to go to Vegas again to get my Nacho on!
Loved the Filet Mignon Nachos and Cadillac Margarita! Cool bartenders and fun atmosphere too.

I can't believe I just ate one of the best Mexican meals I've ever had before.  I had the Baja Seafood Combo.  The taco was on a freshly cooked soft corn tortilla with a huge portion of avocado.  Served with rice and beans on a hot skillet plate.  It surpassed my expectations considerably.

Well after waiting 2 hours for my wife and daughter to do the zipline, we were all starving. It was around 9:30 on a Monday night. So it wasn't too busy and we got seated almost immediately. The menu is pretty big and they have a vegan menu, which is great if you are vegan. 

My wife and son shared a bean and cheese nacho, which easily fed both of them. My daughter got the chicken enchiladas, rice and beans. I got the Baja seafood combo, which is a fish taco and a lobster and crab enchilada. All the food was excellent and the service was great to match. 

I wish we had one of these were I lived, I be there all the time. I am actually got a t-shirt also to remind me of this place.

Was more than pleased with this find. We had group of 8 people - all with different diet restrictions. The large selection of vegan options was impressive. The margaritas were good and strong (just like i like them). The nachos and tacos were to die for! Would definitely return and recommend next time i or my friends come to town!! 

Ps. Service was quick as well. Atmosphere and vibe was on point
Food is great and ambiance is nice. I had the street car tacos. Filet mignon and chicken! Absolutely great. Perfectly located in downtown Las Vegas and is within walking distance of Fremont street.

It is really unfortunate that this place isn't better than it is for the location. With all of the excellent food offerings in the downtown Las Vegas area, it is extremely important to put ones best foot forward on the food scene. There were several strikes for this restaurant in my opinion, the first being that as soon as my family was seated, we were ignored for at least 15 minutes. With the menu having been studied for at least that long, we were ready to order. The waiter breezed up, took my drink order for ONE BEER and left without getting the food order. The waiter breezed up with the beer, took the food order of filet mignon nachos and an order of shrimp ceviche. The sad nachos arrived to the table with very little cheese, drowned is a terrible sauce, low presence of steak, and sad looking guacamole. The chips were fresh. The ceviche was a no. All around...a no. No flavor, nothing, period! The avocado was fresh. Oh yeah, I wanted another beer, no one ever came back to the table. Once done with dinner, we waited, and waited, and waited for the bill. Finally it shows up and guess how much 1 beer, 1 plate of nachos, and 1 ceviche appetizer cost...OVER FIFTY DOLLARS! Are you kidding me!?! That's even unreasonable for Vegas! We weren't on the main strip. Not even on the Fremont Street strip. I do not recommend this place AT ALL.
Fun, great service and delicious food. Love that they have a Vegan and Gluten Free menu too!  I loved by Vegan Chicken Nachos. My husbands fish tacos were awesome as well.

WHAT?! What is this magical place? Why has no one told me sooner? This world where everyone's favorite food group (that's right, FOOD GROUP) is not only featured, but the focus of their menu. How awesome is that? Could it get more awesome? Yes it could (if they put one in San Diego) being in Vegas is pretty amazing! 

Located in Downtown Fremont, it is pretty convenient, especially if you're in the Nacho mood. Patio seating with an aircraft hangar style door, also a great centrally located industrial concrete bar, and warm sunlight. 

Because we seemingly don't know how to settle for a stock off the menu selection we went with the Supreme Tostada Nacho, but asked for the pico on the side and also a side of the enchilada sauce, but without the lettuce (cause that did seem weird, right?). First, how awesome was the bartender? They brought out our order and he immediately noticed the presence of lettuce and threw up the stop sign. All apologies, it was returned to the kitchen and a fresh prepped replacement was brought shortly thereafter. Second, these were the best nachos ever!!!! Ermergosh! Such a great blend of flavors and I was halfway through the order, before I remembered we had the sides. Unfortunately, I had waited so long that the enchilada sauce had cooled before I got to it, because I'm sure warmer would have been better (still pretty good). 

I digress, let me finish this thing. Aside from amazing nachos, the bar hosts plenty of tequila (as they should), some decent beer (some local), and a friendly, smiling, engaging, conversational, smart, fun staff. Who wouldn't want to be here, eat here, roll around in a pool of nachos here?

Somehow strolled into this bar...when we first came in it was just for "one scorpion shot"....well as it ended up the bartender was legit and her service was on point...as it worked out we closed the bar down which included several more drinks and several more scorpions 
The bartender, Brianna, had killer service and kept the drinks coming
Brianna's manager (can't remember her name) was awesome too
Had a lot of fun, good drinks, scorpions, and awesome service

As far as Nachos go, this is as good as it gets. I loved the diverse, unique flavors and options they have. Nacho Daddy is a perfect place to eat anytime of day whether it's a hungover lunch, dinner, or late night munchies. The place has cool aesthetic. I'd say it's the best place to eat if you're downtown.

Yuuuuummm!!!! The chicken Nachos were soooo... good! The Mexican Candy Margarita was good. I checked in and got my free house margarita and that too was good.  The nachos tho! Oh my! Yuuummm!! If you're into ceviche... bomb! Thank you!!!

Pretty damn good! Ceviche on point. Chicken street tacos are delicious. Good chips and salsa and margaritas. The only bad thing is the bathrooms! Try to avoid the women's bathroom! No locks on the bathroom doors and it was really gross and dirty.

I have lived in downtown for a little over 5 months and finally tried it!  They have great menu and services are great!  You will have to pay for parking and sometime hard to find parking.  Other than that I do recommend this place!

The atmosphere is great. And so are the big plate of nachos. I would definitely come down here again and I would most definitely recommend this to anyone I come across. The customer service is awesome. Very approachable people. Keep it up!

I love the vibe in here! Very friendly bartender. Just got some drinks but it was enjoyable. I've eaten here before and was please with the food as well. Has a more sports bar vibe with games playing on every screen. And they do 20 dollar bottomless mimosas on Saturday's and Sunday's
So this place is pretty awesome when Astrid or Alex is working. Otherwise its pretty much a three. Nacho Daddy your regulars demand these girls work all the time.

Ordered a Nacho Average Burger Nacho to go.  When I got back to my hotel room, the nachos didn't have the ground beef. How do you omit a main ingredient from your nachos?  I will never eat here again.  It was late and the choices were limited.  I would have rather had McDonalds.
Quite possibly the best Mexican food I've ever had.  Flavorful, good portions and the drink menu was outstanding too.  I'll definitely be back on my future trips.

Downtown off Fremont street, great hours to go after a long day - night of partying! 
It's a dark divey type of vibe, low lighting. 

The service was great! Prices were high, but food was nicely done. Caution: everything has a kick to it, spices are great for those of you that can tolerate a burning in your mouth type of sensation. I was happy that the pork wasn't so spicy.

And the fried ice cream with the churro chips now have a special place in my heart.

The Cycle Pub Crawl took us here as one of the stops but we wish they hadn't. For a chain restaurant, their prices are designed to gouge the nearby tourists. $16 for one Coke and one poorly crafted margarita. This is what you'd expect to pay at a nightclub, but not a crappy chain restaurant.
We all ordered drinks upon arriving and a couple of us had to flag down servers for a missing soda and margaritas. We watched the bartender keep dropping his drink recipe notes. The nachos were disgusting. It tasted like stale chips with what looked like dog food on top...I wouldn't feed this to my dog. The servers had no idea who ordered what and settling the bill was a monumental task for them. Make sure you count your change before you leave.
A very disappointing experience.  I wouldn't waste my time or money since there are plenty of other better places to go nearby.

First off I must say the staff here is amazing! Nice, friendly, and fun to talk with. The queso dip and the nacho dishes are all must haves!

Now for my 2 big gripes about the place. 

First, the worst margaritas in Vegas. They are so incredibly sweet, it's actually undrinkable. I can't believe they claim they are voted the best in town and I am shocked they haven't changed the recipe after the feedback I've heard from other people that have had them. 

Secondly, it seems they always have the giant front roll up door open even on extremely hot days. If your going there between may and August, be ready to sweat! Not the best environment for enjoying a nice lunch or dinner. 

If you stick with the ice cold beer they offer and go either at night, or in the fall/winter, you will have a 5 star experience!

Enchilada Nachos were the bomb!!! We got half red half green sauce and they were huge and super tasty.
The Margarita's needed some extra oomph...great service!!!

Decent Mexican food.  Draft cerveza and pitchers we're a decent value for our party of four. Pals had the carnitas street tacos and other two each had the breakfast burrito. They said it was delicious. I had the hamburger nacho - good too. Service was on it.
We ordered Mexi-Cobb Salad and Buffalo Nacho. My husband and I are very satisfied.   We will come back.

We've visited Downtown Vegas so may times, but never stopped at Nacho Daddy for whatever reason.  Big regret! This place serves up some great tasting nachos!  We also ordered the Mexican grilled corn, that was tasty too!
We ordered the supreme nachos with seasoned ground beef, Pico de Gallo, guacamole, cheese, and homemade chips.  The chips were so light and airy, almost like flour tortilla chips.
Large portion, fed the 2 of us no problem.  Bonus was the free house margarita when you check in on Yelp!  They gave us the option of upgrading to a specialty margarita and give us $8 credit (for each drink) if we wanted.  We stuck with the original House margarita, you're also given the choice of on the rocks or frozen.
When in the mood for some nachos, we'll definitely be back,

Out of all the eateries to go to Downtown -- I would not suggest this one.

My friend and I met up here after work for a bite to eat. The place is small and cramped, and I think they could have alleviated that problem by making the bar just a bit smaller and instituting some smaller bar seats, as the seats take up to much room in the walk-ways. 

Happy hour consists of $5 margaritas and $4.50 Mexican beers they have on draft. Not the largest selection for a HH, but not bad. There is food on the HH menu as well. I ordered the shrimp tacos and out they came as fried shrimp tacos, which I would have liked to have known and wish the menu would have pointed that out.

My friend and I also shared a nacho platter, ahem, since we were at a place called NACHO Daddy I had great expectations. They arrived in no time and were placed on our table. As I looked at this platter of nachos I questioned many things in life, "When a tree falls in the woods and no one is around, does it make a sound?"... "When I am at a place that specifically has Nachos in its' name and I am unimpressed with the nachos... are they really nachos at all?"

We got the Filet Mignon Carne Asada Nachos. I have reservations on whether or not the meat was actually filet mignon. I also have reservations now on ever ordering a $16.95 priced plate of nachos, which I expected to be bigger, and better.

Next time I want nachos I will go to Roberto's and ask for Carne Asada Nachos and I'll eat the &*&! out of those things and be happy I didn't pay $17 for them.

It going to lie, I was surprised that our food was as good as it was. I didn't expect much from a restaurant right off of Fremont Street. I was gratefully surprised. I have the green cheesy enchiladas, very good. The best dish was probably my friend's filet mignon nachos... delicious!  Also good was my husbands spicy shrimp nachos. Good late night food.  Our waitress was also great!
The atmosphere is inviting. The food is very good and it didn't take long to get it and it came out very hot. Staff are fun here. Great service....ill be back again.

Great place to hang out with friends. Friendly service. Large selection of margaritas. Known for the margaritas and nachos. Ordered the sloppy Joe nachos and is enough for 2. It's really good and they sure do not skimp in the meat. There seemed to be more meat than nachos though. Because the meat is in the saltier side, the fish can use more chips to balance the flavors.  Worth trying. It's a bit off of the main street... nice place to go with friends to share nachos and enjoy alcohol. Our server was really friendly to us even though we only ordered one item and one alcohol.
Enchilada nachos-delish! Great food, awesome service, and affordable. Did not disappoint this nacho lovin girl.

We were screwing around on Fremont Street and needed to eat.  After contemplating all that was around, we somehow stumbled into Nacho Daddy!  Talk about divey ... everything you want when you're in the City of Sin!

I think our bartender/waitress was Brianne and she was cool.  I ended up with the ceviche which was really good.  I honestly do not recall what I had to drink, most likely some sort of skinny margarita or something.  I did try my friend's nachos and they were good.  The chips stayed crispy .. probably the best nachos I have had in a long time.  This is on my list of "must haves" next time I'm in Vegas.

Was super stoked to come here but honestly the service was shit. Literally from everyone. Runners spilling food on our guests. Wine taking over 20 minutes to get to the table. The blonde bartender being so rude when I asked for something when my server was busy. The restaurant was not even half full. Erica was the only good part she was great and patient and kept a smile on her face after runners and bussers messed up food and drink orders. Some of the orders were wrong. Chips and salsa didn't come out before the food so we had to cancel. Blah blah I could go on and on.Bad experience. 

Erica gets 5 stars. Restaurant gets none :(

Love hanging out in Nacho Daddy. Staff is great and love it when you just chill with a laptop and soak up the vibe. The Street Tacos are my favorite dish and never disappoint. Bonus points for Urinal Games in the Mensroom.

We'll start off with the negative...you don't put sour cream on a tamal. But the stars don't drop for that!! The service was great, free Margarita for yelp check in, nice!!  We had the shrimp ceviche appetizer, crab and lobster  nachos and of course the pork tamal.  Everything  tasted great, we're thinking about coming back tomorrow...if we're brave, we'll do the scorpion shot!! Cheers mate!!
We picked a great place to stop for lunch while out exploring Vegas. Thanks to yelp and G for hooking us up with great margaritas! The service was great!

This place has good food with decent prices we spent 30$(not including tip) for two entree's and free water a little loud but over all a good experience. We had nacho enchiladas and chicken sandwich both really good.

Jovanny Jovanny jovanny as a manager  I'm very picky on customer service and the service Jovanny gave me and my family was out of this world as long as he is working here and the food stays amazing i definitely will be back

Hands down my favorite place to go to in Vegas.
Must try the Jalapeno Beer and the Filet Minion Nachos.
Had the Corn on the cobb and that was delicious as well as their fried ice-cream. Cant wait to go back :-)

Tore up nacho daddy! Good food...but amazing drinks...we got a margarita pitcher for the table. Fun, hip atmosphere. They have old 90s jams playing...just a fun place. Took dad on Father's day last year...he made sure to keep telling us..."I'm nacho daddy!"  Little on the pricy side fyi...
Enjoyed the Buffalo Nachos.  Mojo pork street tacos, just OK.  Not a bad place, but not really worth a special trip.

Menu hack provided by our waiter, we ordered the vegan nachos but substituted the vegan cheese with regular cheese and then added chicken. This provided a ton of toppings and made for an amazing nacho plate. One of our favorite midnight dinners on the strip.

Came in for lunch with my wife for the first time and sat at the bar. The Carnitas Nachos were so delicious, the white peach margaritas were even better,  but it was the service that made our day.  Our bartender Tara was amazing. She could have kept us entertained for hours. My wife and I had one of the best lunch dates we've had in a long time! Thank you Tara and Nacho Daddy!! We'll be back for sure. You rock!!!

The best servers... I always enjoy the games with a few good drinks a plate of bomb @$$ nachos. When u come to Vegas u have to come through the Fremont Street Experience and come see the wonderful crew at Nacho Daddy!!!

Is it just me or is this place a little odd?  We went in here today for lunch and the place is really small.  My friend thought they would bring us chips and salsa but no, it was $3.50 when the menu said it would be $2.95 so that is my first problem with this place!!  Then I ordered the Vegan guacamole and mango salsa tacos.  I am sorry to say they were very unpleasant.  I am not sure if it is not "mango season" or what the deal is, but the "guacamole" was a misnomer--it was not full of guacamole like you might expect because there were no animal products-it just seemed like an afterthought.  My second problem with this place is that a diet soda is $2.95.  Come on, seriously?  you serve it in a little plastic cup.  Nothing fancy.  I will not be back here.  Save your money for the other businesses popping up downtown.

I'm not quite sure how this place earned a 4/5, as it it very mediocre. Service was on the slow side. We got the wrong drinks. And the drinks themselves aren't particularly special - they don't seem to put any effort into presentation. Also their "World's Best Nachos" are no where near that good. We got the BBQ Pork Nachos to share. The BBQ sauce was strongly on the vinegar side, not very sweet at all. And it really needed more queso to balance that out. Bummer. There's too much awesome Mexican food in this city to ever choose this place.

I consider myself to be quite the nacho lover so when my friend decided to have his birthday dinner here I was over the moon with excitement. We basically filled the whole restaurant with about 15 people there for the dinner. It's a super small place. The parking can also be hard to find, but that's everywhere downtown. 

I was so excited to try some of their nachos and loved the variety of options like buffalo chicken, BBQ chicken, hamburger and enchilada. I opted to go with the enchilada nachos with green sauce. Overall these bad boys were delicious! I'm glad I made the green sauce choice and the toppings were definitely not sparse. The only thing I didn't care for was how quickly the chips got soggy. I'm not a soggy chip fan so that kind of crushed my spirits. 

I would definitely come back again to try some more of their nacho and entree options. Oh and don't forget to check in for a free house margarita!

This is the second time I have has lunch at this establishment.  Location is north of the strip (is actually in the old downtown section) so traffic actually moves and parking is pretty accessible. This makes any foray to this area much easier and and quicker.  Both times I've been here, I've parked within 100' of the restaurant's entrance.  Nacho Daddy is a pretty cool themed fusion nacho bar.  Portions are decent sized and reasonably priced.  Menu has variety that should appeal to most anyone's palette subject to Mexican type food.  The service was fast, personable and delivered with a smile. I am giving it a four star because the interior's seating is comprised of bar, high stool/table seating, or table seating that is in close proximity to each other, noise off hard surfaces is difficult if one has a hearing impairment.

Have been here twice and both times I've been satisfied with the food and the service.
Both times Anya was my bartender and took my food order. Great ambience, comfortable setting, interesting menu items. Had the enchilada nachos, and the shrimp starter plate, enjoyed both. Will be back.

First time I came here the nachos and beer were bomb. Came back two weeks later to show my friends and husband (out of towners) and it was a disappointment. Kitchen was behind 25-30 minutes according to the bartender. Which is cool whatever we'll get beers. Tried ordering a Dos and they were out so we tried ordering a Tecate and the tap was frozen. So we stuck with bottles of Tecate instead. I was bummed because the food, beer and service were great a few weeks before. Kind of looked like an idiot for talking it up to everyone. 

P.S. Picture I posted was from the first time I went

Off a side street from the craziness of Fremont, this place is a treat! We didn't eat full on meals because we just wanted something light and a drink but the food we got was great. I got chips and salsa (some of the best I've ever had) and my bf got one of the spicy nachos (I forget what it was called exactly). My bf ate almost the entire plate of nachos by himself, that's how good he thought it was! He even wanted to go back the next day. Only complaint is our server was slow to get to us and it wasn't really busy at all. However she was very lovely after that! Great place, I'd definitely return!

This place was cool, right off the old strip. I ordered the spinach artichoke nachos and they were out of this world. Green chips, Alfredo cheese sauce with artichokes and spinach. My friends daughter ordered hamburger nachos. This olace was very creative but mostly for happy hour or 21 over. Not family orientated.
Dean is the true example of excellence customer service, provided a warm welcome along with great food! Definitely will return

I wish I could echo all the good reviews but unfortunately can't.

We had the filet mignon nachos and they were meh at best. First, the filet was overcooked and tough. 

Secondly, there was so much beans they overpowered the other toppings and made the chips soggy. And although our waitress asked for extra cheese there was hardly any and it was all dropped in one spot, so basically on like three chips. 

Third the toppings are only on one layer. For this price point, and considering nachos are the main schtick, you'd think they could sprinkle and melt some cheese on the bottom layer. 

The guacamole and ranchero sauce were good and so was the service, but overall I left feeling like I had just had poorly assembled, overpriced bar food and not a specialty dish of a restaurant with a main focus on nachos.

This place gets four stars because:

1. VEGAN OPTIONS- nachos, tacos, burritos, salads on point. 
* I believe they use daiya cheese which is not my fave but acceptable :)

2. Great Service- I came in with my boyfriend expecting only him and I to be eating, I received a call that four other people were coming to eat with us. On the very busy night we went the waitress finagled us a table! This was highly appreciated.

3. Waitress(es) took chips and salsa off of our bill due to the business and semi-slow service, again much appreciated

4. The only thing that irked me was the lack of space! Nacho Daddy needs to expand that location. 

All in all I had a great time

My boyfriend and I stumbled across this spot and it was actually really good. We ordered the chicken enchilada nachos and they were very tasty! One order was filling for two people. The margaritas are also really good! When in the mood for nachos in Vegas we will definitely be back here!

Nacho Daddy delivered on all fronts. The margaritas were strong and tasty (although the original lime margarita was a tad too sweet), the street tacos were great, and the fiesta nachos did not disappoint. Our waiter Marc was by the far the best part of our experience at Nacho Daddy. He was friendly, prompt, and extremely helpful with recommending popular menu items. If you're in Fremont and looking for a casual bite to eat I definitely recommend Nacho Daddy. The prices are fare, the portions are large, and the service is excellent.
Good happy hour deals! Make sure you ask for the happy hour menu because they didn't wanna give us one

Service here was very very good. So friendly!  Their spicy cucumber margarita is awesome. Their queso is addicting; their fish tacos are fresh and flavorful. We also had a seafood enchilada and a pork tamale, which were solid too. Nice, laid back atmosphere.
Nachos were great as they should be for the name of the restaurant. Margaritas were well made. The reason for three stars is because of the price for the value of the food and our dumb server.

Happy hour consists of good food and drinks at a good price, what's not to love! My boyfriend and I came in and ordered off just the happy hour menu. We had the BBQ chicken mini nachos and the chimichangas. The nachos were actually pretty damn good. I love all things BBQ chicken! The chimichangas were good and the sauce was great. Free marg with yelp check in! Unfortunately my margarita tasted like lemonade..but it was nothing a couple shots of tequila couldn't fix. 

My boyfriend and I left here happy, full, and buzzed  they also deliver to your room if you are staying at the D downtown. We ordered delivery a few days later when we were too tired and hungover to get up.

Came in for breakfast with some friends after a 5k downtown. Waited 25 minutes for our food. Watched 2 tables who came in after us get their food before we did. When our food finally came out, our nachos looked liked it was sitting under a heater for 10 minutes. Buddy ordered his eggs scrambled, but his eggs came over easy. Another friend ordered 2 shrimp tacos, but only got one. Complete utter mess of a dining experience.

My wife and I were walking around Fremont Street and we were looking for a good happy hour place. Several places online recommend Nacho Daddy so we decided to check it out. 

We ordered a few house margaritas from the happy hour menu as well as some nachos and chicken tacos. It's always annoying when places advertise their happy hour menu to get you in the door and then the servers seem so displeased with you for ordering from said menu. After we placed our order, we barely saw the bartender for the rest of the time we were there. It took us about twenty minutes to flag her down and get the check when we wanted to leave. We were forced to hang around even longer because she "mistakenly" didn't charge us the happy hour prices for our drinks. She made sure to make several other customers drinks before fixing our receipt. If you aren't going to treat all of your customers well, you should just get rid of happy hour.

The house margaritas were unsurprisingly mostly simple syrup. The chicken tacos and nachos were fine but not particularly memorable. While I liked the bar setup and the country music playing through the speakers, the food and the service make this place somewhere I would not recommend.
Great Food - Great Service! We will definitely be back... adding Nacho Daddy to our list of Vegas favorites! Try the Spicy Thai Nachos... YUMMY!

I like this place because the people and the vibe are amazing. The servers and bartenders interact and socialize in friendly manner. Its open late and  it's right downtown. 
The last time I  was there I had a really young looking waiter by the name of Mikey. He was prompt in the beverage service and suggested that I try the Mexican cobb salad since I wanted something light. The dish was really good and had just the right amount of dressing to compliment the flavors. 
I felt the food and drinks are a little over priced for what you get. Especially since There are many other great places to get a bite and a drink in the area, but I will definitely come back in the future.

My boyfriend and I went to Nacho Daddy last night, and we loved it. The bartender sat us and was super sweet and personable. We ordered the grilled Mexican corn on the cob, which was to die for. We both could've had five more of those. The nachos themselves were fantastic, and huge! And for dessert we got the fried ice cream, which comes with chocolate and vanilla tortilla chips, which were probably even better than the fried ice cream. Service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great... Very pleased.

MEHk no MEHstake! Nacho Daddy's kitchen deserves the gold MEHdal for their MEHzmerizing Tex-MEHx dishes! Focusing on the MEH quality of the MEHnu, however, is missing the point-- Nacho Daddy is not about Michelin Stars, it's about FUN! So leave your foodie-badge at home, get some friends together, get yourselves sloshed, and scarf down the nachos for a killer good time in Downtown Vegas!

3   S T A R S

* NACHOS + BOOZE CAN'T LOSE
:::: The Nachos -- The perfect BOOZE FODDER! Nacho-greatest example of gourmet Tex-Mex, but PHENOMENALLY SATISFYING when you're 2 beers and 2 shots deep, and about to take a video of your poor homie chewing up and swallowing a dead scorpion on a dare. Please be courteous and vomit outside!

* PARTY PALAZZO
'Palazzo' means PALACE in Italian, as in watch your PALs get drunk off their ASSes! This is VEGAS BABY, so get STUFFED & get TRASHED, and this is a great place to do both! Rush in with your new crew of friends you just made Downtown & go 18-Dummy off their grande Tequila selection (60 varieties) while deep-throating MORE NACHOS (gross)! Watch the game on one monitor, or hilariously tacky old 70's and 80's music videos on the other, in between scorpion-shots and INSTAGRAM-selfies!

* THANKS FOR THE MEHmories
I will never in my life forget this meal. I walked into a big, fun space for lunch, was waited on by a super-cool server named Elicia, devoured one  disappointing MEH dish after the next, and finished with an unforgettably bad Las Vegas decision--the Scorpion Shot! My life on this planet has been made slightly more significant by this wacky bit of suffering.

2   M I N U S E S

- MEHlancholy MEHnu
Don't walk in by yourself as a foodie because you'll feel like a fool :) Let's find out why...
:::: Carnitas Tacos -- Utterly Bland. If you've ever experienced eye-fluttering ecstasy from expertly crafted tender-juicy-crispy-salty carnitas tacos then DO NOT order them here. It'll MEHk you sad.
:::: Battered Fish Taco -- Decent. Best thing I ordered. Great texture, good flavors.
... So then I tried to redeem the meal with what I thought would be a guaranteed winner, but it was even more MEH!
:::: MEHxican Roasted Corn -- Like a disappointing Tinder date. She seemed so hot until we MEHt. Too little mayo, too little cotija cheese, no chili powder, no lime, and the corn was wet roughage--not sweet enough. Complete fail.

- SCORPION SHOT: MASOCHISTS ONLY!
Probably the go-to hazing ritual of UNLV fraternities. On par with eating a rotten shrimp head from the bottom of a Panda Express dumpster. Chewing into the guts of the scorpion, realizing that its half-decayed organs were all over my teeth, and then washing it down with a shot of tequila was a 5-second NIGHTMARE. I almost threw up my entire lunch. So why did I do it? The server picked up on the gray glow of my meal disappointment and hit me with a brilliant up-sell. "You know what you should try that's pretty good?" she said with a wink, "The Scorpion Shot! Come on, you have to do it, you're in Vegas!" She smiled pointing to a black t-shirt they sold with '#GOTSTUNG' printed on it.

"Awesome!" was my innocent reply.

We tried Nacho Daddy extremely late one night so I'm not sure if it was really good or if I was just starving. 

We ordered queso and it was good and creamy. The red salsa was also very good. 

I ordered plain old cheese nachos and they were very satisfying. The right amount of cheese and very crispy chips. 

Next time, I'll try out the margarita.
Food was ok. The menu has a lot of options. The margarita is something I'll get again.

Courtney was our bartender,  and the service was very good.  We had the spicy shrimp nachos and grilled corn on the cob, off the cob at happy hour and they were outstanding.  This place may be classified as a dive, but there is a very diverse crowd in the bar.  I would suggest that anyone visiting Fremont St. make this place a must see.  I will definitely visit this place again next time I am downtown.
Best food I have ever had in Vegas!  HUGE portions on the nachos, definitely share with someone.  All three kinds of nachos we had were amazing.

I don't even know where to begin. We came in on Sunday around 11am. I was accompanied by 5 others. There might have been 8-9 other people in the whole place. I was so excited to try this place because I had watched it on the Food Network channel. MAN what a disappointment! We were greeted 5 mins after we came in by a very rude bartender. I kick my self for not asking her name.. She took our drink order which consisted of beer and 2 shots or tequila.. Then she was gone.. 15 mins later she came back and brought the tequila.. My husband asked where his beer was and she said I'm getting it.. Another 15 mins went by and this time another bartender came on shift and I asked for our bill.. I said all we had was tequila.. She said well it looks like you also had beers.. I said you are right we ordered the beers but were never served them.. So we got the check for our 2 shots of tequila, paid and left.. I honestly was very excited to try this place and I am extremely upset with the service and will never be back.. We should have listened to the hotel staff whom warned us about Nacho Daddy..

Fast and friendly service, food was enormous and so delicious and nutritious. This is now my new breakfast and place to come to if I'm drunk and need to sober up. I also love the fact that they have vegan options.

Ate here twice during our recent weekend in Vegas.  With a large party you were able to accommodate us. Always excellent food and service.  This will be a regular stop for us always when in Vegas. PS: the chicken tacos are amazing!!

The food was good. Service was good as well. Music is good, but not so loud that conversations are not impossible. They have a great selection of brews. Dress casual. It is very close to Freemont street so it is very accessible. Good time and good price. I would recommend this to folks.
We had the shrimp nachos and they were good. We shared one plate and it was plenty. Had a couple cocktails as well. I had their boozy horchata and it was good.

We were sightseeing in the Fremont area with friends and decided to eat dinner there.  We found Nacho Daddy's. Being from Texas we are sometimes a little hesitant having 'Mexican' food away from home.  Our waiter was amazing.  He explained the menu items we had questions about.  We began with an order of quesadillas and child and queso.  He even brought us an extra order.  The queso was blanco so that was a bit of a surprise but still good.  He brought my friend and I a Birthday shot of tequila since we mentioned we were in Vegas celebrating our birthdays.  Everyone enjoyed their dinner.  This is a must go to place if you are in the area.

Lots of great options! Unique nachos...good margaritas. I had the tamales. Portion size was appropriate, not huge and wasteful. Could get avacado on the side for $2  Kayla was exceptional, putting up with my smart alick father-in-law. Get here.
Great atmosphere, everyone had the supreme nachos and looks like they're really  enjoying their meal

First off... Our server Rick is AWESOME!!! He really made our night amazing.  He was funny,  cool and knew the menu very well. Shout out to Christina & Sarah they took good care of us as well.. super sweet girls. Service here is on point!  The food & drinks were bomb.com!  Taco Tuesday here is where it's at... but then Tequila Tues took over lol. I'll be back real soon!
Very good food. We had the BBQ nachos with corn . So bomb. We liked our server and the ambiance. Cool spot .non doushy clientele and fair prices. I'm assuming this is the location on freemont.

After getting in a car next door I came over here to sit on the patio and enjoy my stick and a good margarita I ordered some very tasty flavored spicy buffalo wings with blue cheese and celery quite tasty I enjoy the Ambiance watch the game and had a great time and more importantly quick-service and was left alone
Place is really awesome good food. Friendly staff. I forgot to ask for not cheese on my food and they were more than happy to fix my plate. I can't wait to come here again!!

Excellent service from Mikey. We had the spicy shrimp nachos and the filet carne nachos. Both where so of the best we ever had. Split 2 orders between 4 of us. Mikey real made dinner an enjoyable experience . Vibe is cool. Lots of draft beer choices . You can't go wrong here for a quick cheap bite.
Cool concept in Vegas! Who doesn't love crazy nachos and G was so much fun at the bar! We tried the Thai and the Fiesta nachos.

Another great experience at Nacho Daddy downtown! This location is always busy, yet the service is still fast and friendly. You must try the White queso with spicy beef dip. The white queso  is to die for! The tortilla chips are perfect, prepared nice and thin. Also the margaritas are great. The white peach is my favorite. Try it on the rocks instead of frozen though,  just a suggestion ;)

I didn't care for it all that much. I was really looking forward to it. But it kind of let me down. Really expensive. The salsa was very good though. I would of given it a 1 star had the salsa not been so good. I wish I would've just had a drink and chips and salsa. Then I would've left a very positive review. But me and my wife both felt horrible the remaining of the day also. Just kind of recurring burps of the food all night. I didn't want to eat my burrito, but at $15 for the burrito, I ate it anyways. I would've rather eaten at chipolte.
It ended up being worse for my wife. She spent all day on the toilet and puking. Then off to urgent care. Food poisoning is considered the most likely cause. I felt pretty bad after eating there but at least I wasn't doing as bad as her. $70 later for a crappy dinner and kind of ruining our trip to vegas. 1 star now. Only because they don't have negative star ratings.

Ever since eating at this downtown Las Vegas spot, I've had a recurring dream where I'm in the middle of a big plate of nachos ready to be devoured by giant versions of my friends a la Honey I Shrunk the Kids. And no, it is not a nightmare, because the nachos here are so good I can't think of a better place to perish than in the gooey goodness of a soggy, cheese-smothered tortilla chip from Nacho Daddy.

Before you ready any further, take a moment to appreciate the pun of the name.

...It took me a while at first, so just want to make sure we're all on the same page.

BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS.

So the chicken fried steak breakfast nachos are in my top ten favorite dishes of all time. I was even inspired to make a version for my friends on a few occasions to great success, but I haven't come close to beating the original.

The one drawback to this place is the service. When we did get service it was great, but the waitstaff/bartenders were spread thin and trips to our table were few and far between.

Even so, you neeeeeed to go here if you find yourself in downtown vegas. Back to dreaming about the next time I get to visit here.

I went a few times after my initial review and I'm glad to say I gave it another chance. As always the staff is friendly and very attentive, the atmosphere is casual. I'm in love with the enchilada nachos (green sauce) and the frozen margaritas  I find myself craving their food ALL THE TIME! My best friend is in love with this place & I'm glad she dragged me along once more to give it another try. Super cool how you check in on yelp and get a house margarita for free! Love it!
Really awesome Nachos! Service was good as well! Can't believe I didn't snap photos! Will return to this place next time were in Vegas!

Perfect downtown location. Parking around the corner. Great service, great drinks and amazing nachos! Unique place, check it out! Ric, our waiter was attentive and nice. No apple pay nor digital wallet acceptance. This is 2015!

Recently turned 21 so it's hard to find bars and resteraunts without the staff making you feel like a total imbecile. I've read some articles on how going to ND was a must so I had to come check it. One of the best decisions one could do everything felt very millennial like the staff was cool the food was great and the drinks were delicious and refreshing

Ok let me start off by saying I was a demanding customer , I wanted the clipper game on and before we even ordered something I was asking everybody wearing a " nacho daddy " shirt to put the clipper game on . And of course they did swiftly with complete professionalism.. our server was Aerrick yes Aerrick with a "A" he was absolutely fun, awesome, knowledgeable . And was our heart beat to our experience . The food was amazing we are vegan and they have a complete vegan menu! I had the kale salad it was very fatty and yummy. We all started with the Vegan nachos it was big and amazing !

After flying down Fremont St. on Slotzilla zipline we needed to eat! Nacho Daddy was a short walk back from the end of Fremont and could seat 8 of us right away. We started with the Mexican street corn, which I've had in Mexico, and it was pretty good but not the same as in Mexico. I had the pork tamale and seafood enchilada combo. I was really happy with both of my dishes. Our friends split the filet fajitas and they really liked them too. They have scorpion shots for those who are brave enough lol. Our waiter was great too, fast service and checked on us appropriately. All in all a great dining experience here.
This place was fantastic, Mark was our server he did the best job!!! Definitely eat at this place.. fantastic off the beaten path type place. We had the pull pork nachos, and they were amazing.

This place was pretty legit. I was looking at the pictures and I was impressed. I love the concept, and the name was just so funny. So we went. The food was really good. I got the chiliquilles. It came with eggs, tortilla chips, sauce, chicken, pico, beans and rice. And guacamole! Yay! The only thing that's missing was a crunch factor. The whole main dish plus the beans just makes the whole thing soggy, but that's the nature of this dish anyways so I'm not too mad. My boyfriend got the loco mock nachos. It was really good. Everything was really filling though. We were straight up so full after we left. And we were going to explore DTLV so we didn't want to carry take out boxes with us. So if you're going, it's good enough to take back home. 

The atmosphere was great. The servers were really nice. The food came out relatively quick. The music was a little out of concept but it's fine. It looks like they have really good drinks, wish I tried some but it was 10am and I couldn't haha. This is more of a lunch/dinner place, but it is good for breakfast. I only found parking in the street right in front of the place, and there was no one so it was easy for me to park. I don't know about busy hours.

Would I come here again? Sure why not

We went in there to get a quick
Bite. The waitress was great. She really helped with there big menu. I got a melon margarita and my husband got a beer. The nachos are very big and they don't have a bunch of fake cheese on it. Real cheeses and it was great. Would come here again when in town.

Love the pulled pork nachos.  So glad they now have a lunch portion that is a little cheaper.  We also had a blast with the mixer coke machine.  Now all of your weird tastes can be fulfilled.  Bonus.  We sat next to Tony Hsieh on our last outing.

We (my niece and I ), found this hole in the wall Jewel the last day we were in Las Vegas. You just would not believe what a great place this is!  The service was outstanding as was the food. Enormous portions, seasoned perfectly and served with plenty of condiments. 
We packaged up our leftovers and blessed one of the many homeless folks on Fremont Street. 
Don't let your Mexican cravings go unfed. Go to Nacho Daddy's. You won't be disappointed

Literally the BEST Mexican food in town.  Stopped in for happy hour with my husband.  The service with Courtney was OUTSTANDING!!  I will definitely return, maybe even tonight!  We had a Modelo, Pork & Steak tacos, and Cheviche.  So delicious and a good deal, if you love tacos, come for Taco Tuesday, the deal is even better with 3 tacos for 5 bucks.

This is an absolutely amazing place! The food was delicious, service impeccable & it has a great, chill vibe. The trio of queso, guac & got salsa was wonderful along with the fresh chips. My husband loved his cheese enchiladas & my shrimp tacos were out of this world. I'm so glad we discovered this place & will be returning every trip!

Wanted to find some amazing Mexican food and some were either overcrowded or couldn't find what we wanted (homemade quac) so we found this place not knowing what we were in store for. This place has an amazing Mexican flavor with the food and the environment. Very nice to see that when we sat down instant service, friendly and fast. The quest dip was unreal along with the spicy jalapeño cucumber margarita! I will definitely be coming back when we do Vegas again! A must eat!

Thought we'd give this place a try. Upon entering there was hardly anybody here. We took a seat at the bar. Sat for 30 minutes as 3 different servers/bartenders walked past us several times before we were asked if we would like to order. We finally ordered didn't wait too long for food but once again had to wait another 15 minutes just to get salsa for out tacos. Food was nothing special. Ordered the ceviche which had maybe 4 shrimp in it, found a peice of hair on my chips. Also ordered the filet mignon street tacos which were ok. Will not ever go back and would not recommend this place.

I'm going to start off with the rating. Most reviews give it 3.5/5. As much as it pains me I have to agree with the rating. The saving grace in this restaurant is the incredible food. It was our first time there so we have no clue to wait for a hostess or just sit where we please. It has the potential to be a very hip hangout if they didn't shove their merchandise down your throat. After we found a table in the small eatery we finally got to order, our choices were the beer battered lobster tacos and the fajita cheese steak. The lobster taco was on point. I was surprised that even smothered in sauce the lobster stayed crispy and delicious. Covered in fresh avocado, corn and lettuce it comes with beans and cheesy rice. 

The fajita cheese steak is tasty but very greasy ( those with sensitive stomachs eat at your own risk) the bread was soaked with queso so it was difficult to eat. It only comes with fries but they were amazing in my book. I love a good pile of crispy fries. I would have liked to try the drinks and shots but unfortunately most are over priced. They have huge portion sizes but you end up paying for it. 

As for the service it was not great. The waitress acted like she hated her job and didn't want to be there. Not to mention alot of things were left unclean and dusty. Like I said earlier I agree with the 3.5 rating. Perhaps in the future I can change my review. Love, Bug

Great place to eat on Fremont area
Best food all week. Sorry that we didn't find it sooner , guacamole and pico are fresh and. GREAT. The best waitress EVER. KAYLA!!!!!

Great atmosphere ,great food,nice waiters
Nice size portions Aerrick was our waiter and he was great the supreme tostada nacho and wings where bomb

The good: The selection here for tacos and nachos is pretty great. I loved the bacon wrapped jalapeños with cream cheese. So darn good! Make sure you try the Fireball Scorpion Shots! The service was fine.

The bad: If you wanna pay a lot, come here. Three orders of nachos, 2 cokes and two lunch special tacos plus that wrapped jalapeño equalled $76. Sorry, overpriced for what you get.

Seated at a table quickly in the middle of the day. The place is like a sports bar, but nicer and cozier. Great place to go with friends, or to just sit alone at the bar and meet strangers. Filet mignon nachos were delicious. Tons of meat and cheese that really hit the spot. Our waitress was also so nice. Cherry on top was that DJ Stellar was hanging out there with his crew, and then we saw him perform an hour later! So you may just see some cool people there too while eating awesome nachos.

Our group of 5 came in here for a a few drinks and to split a plate of nachos. The filet mignon nachos were, in my opinion, surprisingly good. The meat was certainly more tender than I was expecting. I was served a nice, strong red sangria, as well. A lot of their menu items look good. If only we were all hungrier upon our visit. It was a bit crowded in there but service was friendly, which is always a plus. It's worth a stop.

Oh my guava margarita!! We stopped by as we were leaving Fremont while showing some out of town friends around. Little did we know that were going to have such a pleasantly delicious experience. The margaritas were amazing. And those supreme shrimp tacos.........no words! I would drive all the way downtown just for a taco and a margarita. I have no doubt that everything else on the menu is probably amazing too! Can't wait to experience nacho daddy again!

The portions size for the nachos was pretty good. I got the supreme chicken nachos and my dude got the enchiladas nachos. We had a few bite, not bad food just seemed seemed to be a bit flavorless to me. We only got the nachos, we sat at the bar. Didn't Didn't have much to say about it. Decor was nice.  Not bad not great

Great place for some nachos. A bit of a novelty to have a restaurant for just nachos. They have other Mexican food but I wasn't able to try that at our table. The nachos were good because the chips seemed to be freshly made. They have a variety of different toppings and it's worth a visit.
Great food and great service. The portion sizes are huge. The staff definitely go out of their way to resolve any issues that may pop up.

I was hoping this would be my new hang out spot but the customer service is appalling.  Drink order right away. Food order 25 min later and taken after three other groups who arrived after me. Had to ask for napkins. Then when my food came I had to ask for a fork!  I waited on a for so long my food got cold, because I was sitting near the open bar door.  The server was more concerned about the hockey game on tv than her customers!  I should have taken a pic of that. Her standing with her back to the customers. Watching tv.

I usually go to the Summerlin location but we were closer to the downtown location and decided to try it. We had house margaritas, fillet mignon nachos, lobster &crab nachos and their AMAZING queso dip(seriously freaking amazing). Food was great as it always is, but I do feel this location doesn't focus on customer service, felt it was more get in get out. This space is also a lot smaller than Summerlin ,which causes it to be a bit overwhelming when trying to enter and exit because there are such large crowds around the entrance .

Service was super slow and the place wasn't busy at all.  We left before we could order because our waiter left us unattended for so long. 

We really looked forward to coming in and were really disappointed.

I was beginning to think there was no Tex-Mex in Vegas. So happy I was wrong. 
One thing I would change: frozen drinks should be served in chilled glasses. My margarita was delicious but the glass was hot to the touch (like it was fresh from the dishwasher) and my frozen margarita reverted back to a regular margarita pretty quickly. All good, though. We'll be back.

Really disappointed! We went to eat on a Wednesday  about 3pm, the place was practically  empty & it took 15 minutes just to get our menues. The waitress was very rude & unfriendly.  After we ordered it took about 30-40 minutes for our food & the place was empty! Food was below average, my kids & I didn't like it, needless to say we won't be going back.

Lunch today@ Nacho Daddy downtown was pretty darn good. Quesadilla appetizer share and the big Daddy taco for my wife and I. Mine was a barbacoa and hers the filet minion. Both were excellent at two for $6.95.  
Try the fried ice cream.  Sharing is good !
Great nachos.  Friendly service.  We will definitely come back again.  The surrounding area is not the best but it is good once you are there.
Wanted to give me free food, why eat here when you clearly don't care for having a hair net. Should be shut down like your Henderson location

I tried to look for a spot to eat & hang out in downtown Vegas this late after 10pm & found out a good Nacho place is well known for their nacho reputation & it was on the tv show they mentioned to me but I forgot. I wasn't disappointed with the margarita drinks & the food. They came out as big portion for me & taste great! Our server at the table is awesome. We will have a good time after all for sure & win big money too...

Worst service ever. Yes, we got here at a busy time but it was SUPER BOWL weekend so you think they wouldve thought about that fact ahead of time,no? We were told by Dianna that a server had called in sick and that Aerick would be out soon. We were told to have a seat outside and he would come clean the table in a minute. We sat outside for 30 min with a dirty table and no water. My cousin went in 3 times!!! Dianna finally came out to clean our table and my COUSIN went in for our water. 20 min later Aerick comes out. We order. I did the check in for the free house margarita and he acknowledged it....but I never got it. Cancel that I did but only after I reminded him AFTER we were pretty much done with our food. Food was ok, salsa was really good but that's it. Wont recommend that place to anybody, especially when theyre busy! But hey, isn't that the goal of a restaurant- to BE busy?? Huh.

Went for a late afternoon snack of nachos. I indulged in a spicy cucumber margarita. It was spicy yet refreshing. We had the spicy shrimp nachos with spinach tortilla chips. It was just the right amount of shrimp. We shared amongst 3 but it really is a perfect meal for 1 or snack for 2. 
The wait staff was very attentive.
Wow! The Mexican candy margarita is so delicious. Amazing service! The waiter's energy was infectious, the vegan menu is fantastic and great vibes and energy all around.

This place is super fun to watch football with great specials! The manager Angie was very friendly and the bartender Courtney made me a great peach margarita! I will definitely be back when these two are working!

Went into Nacho Daddys, around 12am, was definitely craving some nachos. Upon checking in, I received a free house margarita! Thanks Yelp! So for my Nachos, I ordered the Cheese Nachos, plus added some pulled chicken, and bbq sauce. The Nachos were so good, I really picked some good ingredients, to compliment each other. I liked how the tortilla chips stayed crunchy, they never got soggy, so that was a plus. Stop by if your , around Fremont street.

After hearing they had some of the best nachos around, I knew my boyfriend and I had to stop here for dinner. We are nacho fiends!! We went around 8 at night. There was a good crowd but it was not too crazy. The service was not the greatest. It was incredibly difficult to find our waitress and order food. Once we finally did, it took 35 minutes to receive our food! We ordered the queso dip (which we asked to be brought before everything considering it is an appetizer), but it came with everything at the same time. Also, the three tables that were seated at least 15 minutes after us received their food far earlier than we did, which did not make sense. The queso was good, but only when it was hot. After that it had some sort of funky after taste. The kale salad was incredibly bland and disappointing. The fiesta nachos were okay but not anything close to what I expected them to be. Overall, we left nacho daddy with queasy stomachs and had to end our night there. Definitely not how you want to spend Vegas.

I LOVE NACHO DADDY.  I am a nacho fanatic.  I went to the one on the old strip its just off to the side a bit but has a huge sign you can't miss it.  This was a dream come true.  The waiter was SO NICE and fun and happy and was very accommodating.  
I got the filet nachos and they were AMAZING.  If I go back to Vegas I will definitely stay on the old strip just so I can go back to nacho daddy.  Also their margaritas were to die for!  
Seriously if one of the restaurant managers reads this please give the waiter that was there on the 19th of May at around 5 or 6pm, male, about 5'5 and very short trimmed hair a pat on the back or a nice bonus cause that guy is a great waiter.

My whole family and I look forward to coming to this restaurant every time we are in Vegas! I order the normal quesadilla and honestly, it is the best quesadilla I have ever had! Yeah I know... A quesadilla... How could it be that amazing? Oh trust me it is! Also, order the scorpion shot!

My husband and I don't get downtown very often, but when we do we always make sure to stop in and see our favorite red headed spit fire, Courtney! She is the best. Always so happy, upbeat, oh and she makes a wicked margarita! Next time you are downtown be sure to stop in and see her, you won't be disappointed!
This place was sooooo good. From the margs, to the queso, to my entree it was all just great. Kayla was very nice and kept us happy. :)

Came here during Happy Hour and got a couple of appetizers before having to go to our tour at the Neon Museum. It was pretty empty and service was fairly fast. 

We shared the following:
Tortilla Soup 
Chicharrones
Grilled Mexican Corn On The Cob 

I also asked for Mexican Rice on the side and they were able to accommodate me. 

The tortilla soup was perfect for my stomach as I was feeling a bit sick. Paired with the rice, it made for a very filling meal. I especially liked the chicken in the soup, along with the crunchy tortilla strips. My tablemates enjoyed the chicharrones and corn as well. 

I regret not getting any Nachos as their name clearly states Nacho Daddy - but I look forward to coming back and ordering some of their more well-known Mexican dishes on the menu.

The food & drinks was exceptional. The service could have been better.  We waited 10 mins before anyone over to the table.

We shared:
Triple Dip
Grilled corn
Street Tacos
Filet Nachos
Unbelievable food here. If you love Mexican, this place is the ultimate in delicious!  Try the queso dip.
I LOVE nachos and these are hands down the best nachos I have ever had! I went here after running a marathon and all I wanted was nachos. I was blown away! EVERYONE should go here!

Well ... you can't beat drinking and football. We walked in and the bartender was nice and polite but when we asked to play a patriots game on one of the 15 she told us there were other requests.. understandable, but when we looked up and the same game was on all 15 TVs. We asked again if we could just change one TV to our game and they lied to us in the beginning and told us the truth when we asked again said they don't have a satellite. I wish they would have started with that instead of making us look like pests.

I always stop in late night on my break and the bartender Gee is awesome. Always remembers to give me my indi card hook up for being in the industry. She's fast, accurate and doesn't forget a thing. This place has amazing food for down-towners. Kudos!!!!!
Went there for the queso dip and a margarita.  Both were amazing! Will definitely go back when I am in Vegas!

Not helpful staff got a free margarita was straight mix I'm a bartender so I'm pretty aware on the standard margarita. Burrito was ok. Wanted to try more drinks but the first one ruined my experience. I'll find somewhere else.
Overpriced 17.00 for a smothered burrito?? Slow service. Would probably not come back again unless on a Groupon lol
Food and drinks were as awesomical as reviews and our server Mikey recommended - get in here you won't be disappointed!

So our first time at Nacho Daddy was a couple days ago on our first night in Vegas, but I was way too fucked up to really eat. Our friends ended up ordering two nachos, the crab and lobster and filet mignon nachos. Once we got back to our Airbnb I sobered a little more and got to try a little bit of their nachos and OH MY GOD best nachos ever. I'm not really a big fan of nachos, but DAMN their nachos are literally the best nachos I have ever had! Yes, they are on the pricier side for nachos, but they're so worth it!! 

Fast forward to tonight. While we were walking around downtown Las Vegas, a few of our friends got hungry and had no idea where to eat. We saw Nacho Daddy and decided to go there to eat since we remembered that the nachos were amazing. There was no wait and our group of 11 got seated immediately. Jose was our server and he was excellent. We got the same thing and ordered two orders of the crab and lobster and two of the filet mignon nachos. Our friends we brought there for the first time also agreed that they weren't too huge of fans of nachos until they tried these. We demolished those nachos and didn't leave a single chip behind. I'm just sad that nachos won't be the same to me after having them from here.

This location is right off of Fremont Street. It was a nice reprieve from the insanity that is Fremont!  We had  the crunchy avocado tacos which were topped with fresh ingredients. The nachos were decent. There is also a full menu page of vegan options.

Trying this place out for the first time for some vegan nachos. It was ok, I'm not a big fan of daiya cheese if that's what was used. Should consider using almond or cashed cheese. Food was alright, but nothing I'd go back for. House margarita was all syrup.

Service was great however, went on a Thursday night around midnight and our server Aerrick was awesome. 

3 stars for food
5 stars for service

Our waiter Jovany is super amazing... great service and made our experience exceptional!!! 
Thanks Jovy!!!

Been wanting to come here for a long time. Every time I go, there's a loooooong  wait. So went early (9am) to get in. And It was amazing!  HUGE selection,  very nice employees, great food, everything I hoped it would be! I will difently come in every time I'm in town (if I can get in)!

Food was great! 3 dip appetizer was delicious.  Order street tacos and tortilla soup which were delicious. I drank the skinny margarita but had to get have them remake due to they put soda water in it but was not listed in the ingredients on menu.
Best Margaritas...made strong the way I like em...even squeezed extra lime juice in mine...mmmmm...thank you sir ;-)

Make sure you check in so you can get a free margarita! The menu is so impressive. Everyone will find something they like here! I would definitely recommend one of their many, many, many nacho options as an appetizer to share. So many options. We sat at the bar and the servers were friendly and attentive. It's essentially a sports bar and grill so it has a very cool and casual atmosphere. Just remember, it's on Fremont street so parking is non-existent

Never again! Burrito was too salty and just absolutely disgusting. And the nacho cheese on top did not add anything to help. However, the queso appetizer with nacho chips was off the hook. Our waitress was a total gem and really understanding of our issues with the food. Thank you for that! But I doubt I'll return to this place.

Two friends and I were passing through Vegas and we found a place that spoke our language. Nachos. 

I have to say that after a serious summer long quest to find the best nachos, my search is over. It just happened to take going to another country to be this impressed. Nacho Daddy has an insanely good menu, out of the box combinations that will ring bells, great atmosphere and impeccable staff. Our server Luis made our night. He made us feel welcome, offered great suggestions on what to get to eat, as well as what to do while we were in Vegas. He was hilarious, personable, engaged in conversation and you could tell he was a very passionate person. It was so refreshing to have such a kind and accommodating server.  This place is a little nacho heaven.

What the hell is a place that specializes in Nachos.  You have to experience it to believe it.  I had the Thai Nachos with spinach chips and they were healthy and good.  Others had cheeseburger Nachos plus everyone had many different kinds, all of which were delicious.  Use your Yelp ap and you get a free Margurita with the order of Nachos.  
I, a local would, would bring guests there anytime we are downtown.  It's a full meal.
Prices are not bad.
Soooooooooo amazing! Delicious food. Incredible service. Amazing atmosphere. A must every time we come to Vegas!!!

Looking for nachos? THIS IS THE SPOT! Melty, meaty goodness... And so many choices! They serve more than nachos (but why would you get anything else? Lol) I had the burger nachos and they were exactly what I was hoping they'd be. The margarita choices are plenty as well. Great service. Will be coming again.

I was super excited to go to the famous Nacho Daddy especially after hearing nothing but good things from friends that have been here a few times. As we walk up to the door I hear music, people talking and laughing I immediately perk up thinking this place is going to be fun and amazing.... we walk past the hostess stand which is outside of the door, we look around I see a few bartenders, servers  and Busboys yet not one bothered to say Hi or  acknowledge us. I finally walk up to the bar and asked if I could sit anywhere? She looked shocked that the hostess wasn't out side and the then was nice enough to give us menus and found a good table for us. The waiter was nice informed us of the drink specials. I decided to get a Daddy's Michelada and OMG it was like unicorns and rainbows Amazing!!! And it's the main reason they are getting 3 stars... for the appraiser we ordered Queso Dip although the presentation was good the actual Queso was very bland no flavor at all and overall disappointing. Finally for my Entrée I ordered the Smothered Burrito with chicken and the green sauce it was okay. It was a little bland. The only thing that saved my Burrito was the sauce it was drenched in. The chicken on it's own was dry. Now I didn't go in thinking it was going to be authentic Mexican food but I did expect for the food to have some flavor and it didn't. I also did have the Guacamole and Pico with chips and that was really good. I might come back to give it another chance but it definitely won't be any time soon. Unless I'm in the mood for a Daddy's Michelada.
We were 2 people and we ordered 2 nachos and a michilada picture. Both nachos were pretty good and more than filling. I really liked the michilada but it was bit spicy for my friend.

Spent a weekend in Vegas and our Lyft driver told us this place was great. We decided to check it out since we were in the area. Seriously was sooo good. Good food. Good beer. Good service. Defiantly on the top of my list next time I'm in Vegas!

What do you call cheese that's not yours?? NACHO CHEESE! 
Found this option via Yelp. A little divey upon first impression but sometimes that can be good. Had Monday night football on multiple televisions with sound versus playing annoying music... big plus. We stuck to just apps and were not disappointed. The naked wings were wonderful. Meaty with great flavor. The triple dip offered cheese, guacamole and salsa. So tasty. We also had the sizzling shrimp which was good but not my favorite if the meal. Friendly service and quick response even though they were pretty busy. Next time I'd probably try the fajitas cause they looked amazing coming out of the kitchen.

Working downtown gives me the luxury of bountiful options for happy hour.  So when a Tuesday night craving randomly arose, I decided to choose a place close to my job that offered a little bit of happy hour libations and good grub. Since they've opened, I've visited Nacho Daddy a few times. For someone who hasn't really put Mexican cuisine at the top of their list, they must be doing something right for me to continue coming back!

As successful as the Anthem location was, Nacho Daddy decided to open up shop last year in Downtown Las Vegas. This semi-hole in the wall gem of a cantina is located on 4th St., between Stewart Ave. and The Fremont Street Experience.  If you get lost, just look for the bright red and yellow neon sign accompanied with a Nacho chip man dressed in a Sombrero.  When you enter in the restaurant, you'll notice a few focal points. The first thing I noticed the partition separating the restaurant from the bar. Covered with pictures of various tequila brands, the partition really holds true to the type of restaurant this is.  There were also two garage style rolling doors offering a lot of fresh air ventilation which I appreciated on this warm evening.  

Entering the full service bar, I immediately noticed the square bar top that took up almost the entire space.  Big screen TVs and projectors allowed me to watch multiple games and networks.  On my visit, Tyrone and Rick were the bartenders helping me out.  Tyrone was the one who actually took my order and stood out to me the most.  He was not only easy to talk to, but super attentive and really took the time to show me I was a valued customer.  Now that's customer service!

The partitions made me realize that margaritas were definitely in order! Call me a lush, but since this was also an important review, I thought it was only fair to try an array of flavors! So here's the deal: their margaritas run anywhere from $8-$11 depending on the flavor.  All margaritas are served in a cool mason jar and garnished with a lime wedge and salted rims. On my visit I wanted to stick to one brand of tequila, so I chose the Sauza Hornitos Plata for its spicy taste and agave origins. Here's what I got:

Blackberry Acai Margarita for $10: Acai liqueur, muddle blackberries, agave nectar and homemade sweet and sour.  This drink was a bit too tart. You can definitely taste the sweet and sour flavor with a hint of the agave but the stars of the show were the blackberry and acai.  Chunks of blackberry offered a nice textured pulp and the sweetness of the acai balanced some of the tart flavor.   

White Peach Margarita for $9: White peach liqueur and puree, fresh lime juice and sweet and sour.  What I loved about this one was that it was a lot sweeter.  Sometimes sweet and sour can get a little to tart but this drink was subtle and full of flavor.  Like sitting on the banks of Georgia!

Guava Margarita for $9: Orchid guava liqueur, guava puree, fresh lime juice and sweet and sour.  This margarita was set up exactly like the white peach. Full bodied from the puree, the guava nectar really shined through.  I felt like I was on the beach in Waikiki!

Mango Thai Basil Margarita for $10: Thai basil, agave nectar, Mango Schnapps, mango puree, fresh lime juice and sweet and sour. I was pleasantly surprise about this one. On one hand you have the fragrant taste of a mango.  On the other, you're hit with a hint of the basil herb, breaking up the sweetness in an awesome kind of way.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND this eclectic drink!
