I loved that this place had plenty of vegan options. I had the Vegan Ch'kin Nachos with the Nacho Daddy beer flight. I loved all of it! The staff is so nice . Giovanny and Perla were very polite and very helpful. I'd definitely come back again.

The best nachos and drinks ever the people there that serve you definitely are friendly and know a lot about the menus and the food is to die for I def will be back seeing that their nachos are something I crave constantly

I read about this place on fb newsfeed..i researched on yelp n read that it got good reviews..also it was walking distance from the hotel i was staying at aand also open til 3am which is great..i ordered the supreme tostada nachos..seasoned ground beef, cheese blend, yellow queso sauce, refried beans, pico de gallo, fried jalapenos, lettuce, avocado lime salsalita,  guacamole, sour cream aaall on top of housemade corn tortilla chips...i loved it! Friendly service..i will b back to try other items

Where to begin besides WOW! The food here was amazing and there was so much I couldn't finish my nachos. My husband is vegan and tried their beer battered avocado taco. He was beyond happy. I had the bbq pork nachos. There were delicious. The service was superb. Our waiter was friendly and answered all of our questions. Everyone needs to try the vegan nacho cheese. It is unbelievable and I'm not vegan, I couldn't get enough. There is something there for everyone morning, noon or night. We are so glad we tried this location.

We all enjoyed our food. The filet nachos were very good. Just note they are a lot smaller then they look pictured. The spicy bbq grilled wings were everyone's favorite. BOMB.COM Very tasty and flavorful. Street tacos were pretty good also. Hubby ordered the Huevos rancheros he thought they were bland and had NO flavor whatsoever. The service was fantastic! Giovanni was very sweet and helpful. Thank you for our free house margaritas. FREE House margarita when you check in with yelp
The perfect brunch place in Las Vegas..!! Good food, great ambience, amazing service.

Just left nacho daddy Downtown we walked in and were told I had to go outside to finish my beer I paid 7 dollars for I was the only one who had not finished there drink of the four of us.   Did you really think we would not order another drink and spend at least one hundred dollars on food and beverage.   Instead you kicked us out and we are at town square at millers ale house.   Your loss pretty sure no one cares

Found a menu in our hotel room & decided to try it out since they deliver.  Food was good, much better than going to a fast food joint ..more like something you would make at home.  Loved how they went the extra mile since there are no vending machines & gave us ice water.

Fun atmosphere. Waitress was great. I loved the chips and salsa! Filet Mignon nachos were pretty good, I would try the toastada ones next time. Looks like a good place for margaritas I had a  Dr Pepper :). Featured on food network.

I have been to this place once before and did not have a good experience the food was ok the service was crap but this time it totally made up for it. Our bartender Crystal was an absolute pleasure her spunk and personality made me want to stay there all day just to see what she could come up with next as well as Mark his attention to detail and expert customers service guaranteed that I will be back with friends. I did order the vegan nachos and o m g they were the absolute bomb I'm really excited to find a restaurant that has vegan options on their menu (more than side orders and meatless versions of their meals) thanks again for the amazing service you all deserve a rise. Be back soon  Jazzlyn

The carnitas was not very flavorful and undercooked. Probably pressure cooked and not enough spices rather than slow cooked the traditional way. The burrito they charge extra for guacamole and sour cream. The guacamole was inside the burrito which is a mistake. There was no sour cream. No salsa on the side at all. Could use improvement.

Plus: nice friendly staff and good beers. That's the only reason for 3 stars.
Best food on my trip to Vegas. Waiter Mikey was the best waiter I seen in a while. Good food good service.

Festive, fun, and decent food, this visit to Nacho Daddy's was ok. The location on the strip is much better when it comes to staff, service, location, ambience. The bartender, Anya, was not very helpful, didn't seem to have time to make recommendations, never came by to ask if we wanted more margaritas, and was just generally indifferent. We had sloppy joe nachos, street tacos, and house margs. It was a disappointing experience compared to the strip location. The only redeeming part of the evening here was that the margaritas and food were good. They didn't even offer scorpions in he tequila shots.

Meh. 
I'd like to give an impassioned thumbs up or thumbs down but it's really middle of the road. I enjoyed the Henderson location, and being a downtown denizen, I expected to love this location, which I do....sometimes. I say meh because this place is literally hit or miss. I've had times when I can barely touch the food they give me, and three times when I'm scarfing it down like Gabriel Iglesias on taco Tuesday. This applies to both food and the drinks. There are some bartenders that if I see working I immediately know that I need to stick to my cervezas since they can't mess that up. Overall it's not bad, but it's not great. It's just workable, I'd just like consistency. The Henderson location has always been pretty good, I've heard good things about summerlin, and I liked nacho daddy when they had a booth at LIB. Fingers crossed that this place gets where it needs to be
Nacho Daddy ha the best employee, Mark! Very attentive and well informed of the menu. Thanks for serving us.
Three of us all had heartburn and felt a little sick, shortly after leaving Nacho Daddy.  We all ate different things so I'm not sure what happened.

The corn, fajitas, nachos fiesta and naked wings are amazing 
 Services was great as well

We came in on a Saturday night so we expected to have a long wait.  But a 30 minute wait wasn't bad.  This place is loud and cramped!  We didn't mind the noise but feeling cramped is never a good thing.  
Going through the menu, there were a lot of dishes we wanted to try.  They have a large a menu so we needed extra time to order.  In the meantime, we ordered a Daddy's Margarita and a White Peach Margarita to help us decide.  Both were really good and plentiful.  I loved that it wasn't watered down and you can clearly taste the alcohol. 

We finally decided on the menu. For starters we ordered the ceviche.  This was pretty good. Not too salty and ingredients tasted fresh (minus the shrimp).  What I didn't like was that the ceviche to chips ratio was way off. Too much chips, not enough ceviche.  It seemed you had to stack 3 chips together to get the ratio right.  For our main dishes we ordered the Cajun Nachos and the Baja Seafood Combo.  These portions are huge!  The Cajun Nachos could have easily been split between 2 average eaters.  This nacho dish has shrimps, andouille sausage, and cajun spices. And let me tell you, Nacho Daddy didn't skimp on the shrimps and sausage.  This dish literally overflowed with them. This dish ended up being too rich. It was hard to finish this because the spices became overwhelming.  But I think that if this was shared, it probably wouldn't have been that rich.  Another thing I didn't like was the shrimps were the frozen kind.  They did little to mask that.   The Baja Seafood Combo  definitely a better choice between the 2.  This dish consist of fish tacos and lobster/crab enchiladas with rice.  This too was rich in flavor but better balanced.  I would definitely order this again.  

Our server did a good job managing the packed house.  The only complaint I have was that he forgot to put my credit card back with the receipt.  We walked out thinking that one of us grabbed it.  It took him a while to find it but eventually did.

Kayla was the best server ever she was funny attentive and made us great suggestions! She gets 1 million stars! The place is fun lot so great if you have an ugly date;) lol the salsa is insane no baby ass hot salsa here 10 points for griffindor! The chips and salsa are bottomless which makes this the best place to eat on the downtown strip HANDS DOWN! I really appreciated my waitress making sure to ask if I would like water because it's so easy to forget out here! Thanks for keeping it real nacho daddy your the sh*t!
Came to have breakfast at Dupars but it has moved :-(.   So - found this place - great pressed coffee and Brittany treated us well.
Great margaritas! The mango Jalapeño and raspberry were amazing! Great service as well!

Walked around downtown close to midnight I was amazed at all the restaurants that were closed the only thing that was open was crap hole in the wall pizza, tacos, burritos yuck. So I came to yelp and found this wonderful establishment- it literally was walking distance from Fremont Street.  I will tell you walking up to this location and walking in it looks like a dump, but man oh man was I wrong. Arrived and was seated right away. Service was good nothing magnificent but the food OMG.  Lord was it good. Great flavor and so many selections. I for sure will come back here hands down. Do yourself a favor and don't eat that crap on free mint walk a few steps to nacho daddy!! Only one bad thing. Safe the calories,The free check in margarita suck.

Ok Nacho Daddy Downtown, you have redeemed yourself. I'm back to being a believer! In NACHO DADDY, I BELIEVE! haha...no really Jennifer, Tyrone and Rick took excellent care from before me stepping in to the place. The service was overly on point, and not just with me and my guest, but with everyone. I had the Mango Thai Basil Margarita and the Raspberry Margarita (Tyrone's suggestion) and both were the bomb. We partook in the Supreme Nachos sin jalapenos (I can't do spicy) and they were delicious. The guest I took rarely ate and in fact prior to eating said he'd just have "a lil sum sum"? He ate most of it because it was so good. Rick was very attentive to his bar guests and Tyrone was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. Thank you again for the great service, delicious drinks, and scrumptious food. I'll be seeing you again.

This place is awesome! What a friendly atmosphere. Highly recommend this place. Second visit in as many days.  
The staff was extremely friendly food was great. 
Kadene is great!!!





Bring all your friends for a delicious meal

The food was excellent. I had the pork street tacos that were packed with meat. I sampled my friends nachos and all three were great. Everyone liked the food with no complaints on that front at all. The service on the other hand was slow and we didn't see our waiter very often. It didn't appear the restaurant was that busy either.

After a long night of walking, we looked for places to get last minute food, because of course after having a night of drinking, you'll need food too. Although they were nice enough to seat us after arriving 10 mins before closing time (2am), they were giving dirty looks, specially by the host, who apparently was not happy to serve prior to closing (which I do understand, but nonetheless, his attitude should have been adjusted, as he is serving costumers). I walked in with a drink from another place, and he rudely told me to take my drink "out". I was with a group of friends, and I was not going to hand him my drink (since I had just bought it). The way he wanted to take my drink was not polite at all. He was not a good server. (Bald headed guy). Nevertheless., I will not return to this place only based on costumer service.

Wow - this restaurant was an incredible find for hungry Vegans. We watched several nacho plates go by and they were huge. I had the Thai chicken plate and our server, Dezi, happily substituted vegan chicken for the meat-eater variety,added back beans, and subtracted the jalapenos.  My goodness - so good. 
And the staff is so friendly. We met the manager and the head cook. We really hope this Vegas local restaurant (actually 3 in this area now) will come to Plano/Frisco, and Georgetown/Round Rock areas in Texas.
Nothing quite like this gourmet Mexican restaurant with a whole Vegan section in Texas.
Try it all you vegans, vegetarians, and meat-eaters.  It's delish.

This place was pretty good! We got the Tostada Nachos and they were very tasty!!! My fiancé doesn't like nachos but he likes the ones from this place! I also had a skinny margarita and it was really good too! You cannot go wrong with this place! 

The only reason why I gave this place a 4 and not a 5 was because the hosts were extremely rude! It looked like they didn't want to be there and they gave us the impression that we were interrupting their conversation when we were trying to get a table! Besides rude hosts the food is really really good!

Edit: We were there on Saturday June 23, 2018 around 7 pm!
